Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cruzfool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week after our Princess Cruise and it was absolutely in the best location possible for touring Sydney and the attractions close to and from Circular Quay. The front desk staff, concierge, and doormen were quite possibly some of the nicest, efficient, and most friendly people we met on our 3 week stay in Australia. They were all very welcoming despite what was obviously a very busy week. Lovely from top to bottom!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: D-tip
Reviews.Content: We live in Sydney but wanted to have a weekend away. We couldn't be more impressed. The service was professional but friendly throughout the hotel. The club lounge was brilliant (food, view and service) and our room had a great view of the bridge and circular quay. Rooms are clean, recently renovated, there is free internet if you are on the executive floors, the TVs are large and the sound proofing is really good. One comment about the movies, they're AU$18 each - we'd have watched at least one if they were cheaper or in a package.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: denevans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king room with opera house views on 26th floor. This is not the cheapest room in the hotel. Room was very large with excellent modern appliances. Bathroom was beginning to show its age if you looked closely.. Will soon need a refurb but currently everything worked and looked superficially good. Breakfast buffet is excellent. Food is actually hot! Eggs available on demand. In the evening there is often good live entertainment. Our second stay at this hotel and we will undoubtedly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel but Im sure there is better”
Reviews.Author: Melissa R
Reviews.Content: We went to stay here a good 6months ago. The room service was amazing! The room was a little tight fitting but cosy. The tv even welcomes you on screen with yourname on it.. One flaw - the ac wasnt really strong the room was stuffy even at its maximum. Excellent location, the service was great (As you would expect in a 4-5 star hotel i guess) it was central to everything. Def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly, depressing disappointment of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowerchat1
Reviews.Content: This place has just been refurbished!? What were they thinking? Room was motel level with ugly lighting, grey depressing furniture, uncomfortable hard cheap bed ( i thought Marriott was proud of their mattress comfort...), poor minibar, bathroom was like a mini morgue. No kidding! Toiletries were fit accordingly. Room service arrived promptly and was average. A lazy hotel capitalizing on its location. Unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel with service to match”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLock
Reviews.Content: Great location rooms are very comfortable but what makes the difference is the staff

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Convenient”
Reviews.Author: 2Bonnie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay twice during our trip to Australia. The Marriott Circular Quay was very convenient to downtown Sydney near Circular Quay harbour but we had to take train, bus, or taxi or lengthy walk to Darling Harbour and other areas of city. Because we had luggage, we took a taxi (with 3 people and 6 luggage) to catch cruise at Darling Harbour. However, we walked to our cruise ship docked at Circular Quay from the hotel. The room (2 double beds) was small to average size but adequate for 3 people. The hotel's restaurant was expensive but there are other reasonably priced breakfast cafes nearby. Lunch and dinner in the hotel as well as all of Sydney is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ordinary, but good location!”
Reviews.Author: wasimmehr
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks dated, front desk staff unreceptive, decent value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: oils1216
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very nice and clean. Comfortable. Professional. Awesome location. Restaurant is very pricy, but what hotel restaurant isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Steven V
Reviews.Content: This is not a cheap hotel (even by local standards), but in my opinion you do get what you pay for. The biggest upsides are the staff professionalism and friendlyness, location, and interior (lobby, restaurant, as well as room). The sound isolation of the rooms is excellent. Downside is that the 'standard' internet connection which comes with the Marriott membership card or corporate rates is really inadequate, while the 'high speed' internet is very expensive in comparison. This really is a very cheap trick and costs this hotel a full star in my review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location - No Negatives”
Reviews.Author: Mellicon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on 2 separate occasions at the start and end of my recent trip to Australia / NZ. Overall, my experience was excellent and my comment will echo those of many other reviewers. I have Gold status with Marriott Rewards and both of my stays were booked with points. I was happy to have secure this Level 6 property and felt it was a good use of my points, especially with hotels in Sydney being so pricey. Check in service was fast, friendly and helpful. They went to great lengths to recognize my status. I was very happy that my room was available both times early in the morning after long flights. On my first stay, I was in an opera house view room on the 18th floor; the second time i was in a Harbor Bridge view room on the 21st floor. The views are really not that big of a deal; I don't think I would ever pay for them, but it just depends on what's important to you. The rooms were spacious and spotless. The bed was very comfortable. Internet access was free (given my Marriott status) and I found the speed to be just find for using email and Facebook. I also has access to the Executive Lounge on the 30th floor, but only used it for breakfast. The fare was decent, offering breads for toasting, cereals, limited fruit and yogurt, eggs, etc. The location of the hotel is excellent and makes life easy. The property is steps from the Circular Quay train, ferry and HoHo bus stations. There are ATMs for 4-5 banks on the same street as the hotel. There's a McDonalds and Starbucks around the corner and a convenience store across the street. The Harbor Bridge, Opera House and Botanical Gardens are just a short walk away. I really came to appreciate the super-central location after long days of sight-seeing. I was very happy with my stays and I don't think you can go wrong with this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Heron2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter break. This was our third time at the Marriott Circular Quay and its attraction is summarised in the hotel's name. Circular Quay is the ideal location to enjoy the Rocks, Sydney Opera House and the many on water activities available. The rooms are smaller than a lot of hotels but are modern and well kept, with all the conveniences one would expect. The staff and managemnent should be congratulated for providing a seamless service experience from the moment we arrived. Our car was taken care of efficiently and check in conducted promptly. Our bags arrived at the room moments after us. We took advantage of the location and dined at local restaurants but did use room service on one night when we had returned after a tiring day of sightseeing. The room service menu here is one of the most comprehensive of any Sydney hotel and provides ample variety of dishes for most diners. Check out was very easy as we used the express system, which was only a matter of signing the invoice and dropping it in a box at reception. We enjoyed our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcome in an Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: We had two stays of two days each in Feb 2012. Welcome at reception was excellent - friendly, quick and efficient. This was better than expected at a busy hotel in and oustanding location. Rooms, food and service first class. Particular mention for outstanding service from staff in reception and in the executive lounge. We hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And Location”
Reviews.Author: mmbeers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for part of my stay in Sydney. I only wish that I had stayed for the entire trip. The location was not only near the harbor but close to the Rocks which had sll sypes of shopping, restaurants and pubs. The Breakfast Buffet was great as I found by comparison to the next hotel. The Staff could not have been friendlier. Marriott rewards members got free basic internet that was also lacking in the other hotel. If I get to Syndney again, I'll stay the entire time at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: PacificSandy
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here. We were leaving on a cruise the next day and we requested a room with a view of the Harbour which they gladly gave us. The room was very large and the bed heavenly. The service was excellent. The Hotel is very centrally located and we were able to walk everywhere. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel... fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_Retriever
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for three nights in two rooms (using our points so admittedly, we got a really good deal!) at the end of February. The location right by the Rocks and the ferry terminals at Circular Quay is perfect to get out and explore the city of Sydney. The service was outstanding, in spite of the fact that we were staying for "free". The executive lounge offered terrific snacks and a great range of drinks in the evening. Breakfast was also very good. The valet parking was outstanding. In general, the staff was very pleasant and helpful, and there were enough around that you could get help when you needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JohnDeere63
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very nice. Our room had a "city view" on the 14th floor so was quiet. It was a corner room and had a unique floor plan with lots of space - cool, comfortable, very clean. There was a hot pot for coffee or tea, a table to work on, a comfortable reclined chair with foot stool, lots of closet space, and a large bathroom with separate shower and tub. There was a bank of light switches by the bed. One of the switches controlled a small light under the bathroom sink that served as a night light - very clever we thought. We booked this room about 11 months in advance, online, using our Marriot points. We arrived about 9:00 in the morning after a 14 hour flight from Los Angeles and were able to check in immediately. The hotel is extremely convenient to the Circular Quay area, the Rocks, the Opera House and, for us, the cruise ship terminal. If you don't have too much luggage, it is possible to walk there. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel, and it cost about $45 AUS. We found that Australia had gotten more expensive and the meals at the hotel are no exception. However, there are several eating places nearby. We ate our breakfast at a street cafe. There is also a Hop On Hop Off bus location very near. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the best Marriott in the World?”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBoulder_CO
Reviews.Content: I had this discussion with several people in the Executive Lounge. We never found a consensus, and I have these thoughts. The top Marriott hotels are all excellent in most important areas, and this hotel is no exception. The location of this hotel is exceptional. Moreover, this is something hotels can do little about. All the following are in easy walking distance: 1. The excellent restaurants in "the Rocks;" 2. The comprehensive Sydney ferry system; and 3. The (slow) train to the airport. The hotel's triangular shape supports many rooms with wonderful views. The staff are excellent, with special attention to our needs. A "lobby-manager" cruises around taking care of guests' needs. Moreover, the staff in the Executive Lounge, led by Sallie were the most personally attentive i have ever seen. (I have been a Marriott Platinum member for many years.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: merlionease
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at this Marriott. While the room is dated, the location is outstanding, walking distance to the Opera House/harbor. You can see the harbor bridge and Opera House from the executive lounge/some rooms. Room service staff and bellman are friendly, as is staff in executive lounge. Concierge in lobby not overly helpful/receptive. Rooms are small and in need of updating, but clean enough. Pool is rather small, but adequate. Fitness room is good. Room service food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for an Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dino265
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Syndey, and hotel staff did thier best to ensure that it was sensational. Arriving to Sydney from an 15 hour international flight in the early morning , the staff checked us in very quickly and were in our rooms within minutes. We orginally booked a standard city view rooms but upon check in we were given a complimentary upgrade to a harbour bridge view. The View was amazing, though the room itself ( two queen beds) seemed a little small (tight) . This Hotel has a very convenient location. Just minutes from the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the Circular Quay which has variety of restauarants and souvenier shops. For the location, the value, this hotel is well worth the stay. It was our first trip to syndey and most definitely wont be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: NickB1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business. Cannot fault this hotel from great friendly service at check in to same service at checkout. Beautiful room with stunning view. Close to the best of Sydney and 1 min from circular quay to access the rest. I noted $55 per day for parking. Lucky i was using trains!

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Great Location - lots to do within walking distance. Shopping only about 10 mins, Harbor is less than 5 min walk. Hotel itself is average. Nice staff, good service. Food at hotel is not that good, but you are walking distance from lots of options. The key cards do not work well in the elevators, not easy to use. Room was fine - good size for a big city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: AlexKuhne
Reviews.Content: It's the third time I'm staying at the Marriott and from my experience over the past year, it has been the best hotel I have stayed at, bar none. I always know I'll be well looked after here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location ....”
Reviews.Author: Cialainen
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to everthing - unless you want to take a ferry to the zoo, Darling harbour or Manly. But then afain, the ferry terminal is just 2 minutes walk away. Excellent service, Sally in the executive lounge was incredibly helpful and even the cleaning ladies made our stay very special. We were spoiled, well taken care of and and had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist end of town”
Reviews.Author: Liss_mj
Reviews.Content: Recently we took a trip to Sydney for the weekend and decided to try the Sydney Harbour Marriott. We usually stay at the Westin in the centre of the CBD but it was heavily booked and so we decided to try the Marriott. The position is great if you are a tourist staying in Sydney for a short amount of time. Value wise it was really expensive. The room was tiny with a view of walls of other buildings. The pillows were the worst I've ever had and the bed was terrible. There was a very strange yellow light in front of the mirror hanging so low that if you stood in front of the mirror you looked like a body with a lampshade head. No bath for the kids and when you have a shower the bathroom fills with water. The staff were really nice though.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: EllaQueensland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, I was going to a concert at the Opera House and wanted to be able to walk to and from the concert. I have stayed at 5star hotels overseas and this was disappointing, the room was clean and comfortable, the bed was really comfortable but the pillows were the worst I have ever slept on. When I checked out the receptionist asked about my stay and I mentioned the pillows, she told me the book was in a draw that I could have read about ordering more pillows, I have never had to rummage through draws in a hotel before to find information on what was available. In my opinion this hotel is on a par with Novotel and Mercure, not worth the extra money, unless you want the location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, helpful staff, okay rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jeck L
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star hotel, you'd expect the rooms to be top-notch; this wasn't the case for us. Having that said, location and hotel staff makes up for it. Room: Opera House-view Pros(+): + Complementary internet w/ Marriott Rewards Card member. + Rooms are very close by the elevator so minimal walking required. + Security cards required to access even the floor of your room; extra security in my mind. Cons(-): - View was only okay. The Opera House is in view, but the angle is not ideal for any sort of picture taking. Haven't seen the city side view to compare. - The most noticeable area that needs work is the bathroom. Floor between room vs bathroom is uneven by over 1". I kicked on the uneven floor in more than one occasion. Noticeable corrosion on the shower tiles. - Key cards did not work on 1st or '2nd' try. On 2nd try they told me to call from the floor phone if it did not work again...floor phone did not work, so I had to go back down. 3rd try they had someone escort me up to make sure it works, it didn't. They let me in using a master key and the escort went down for me to get me some working cards. Service is there, but things just don't work. Unbelievable. Service: + Helpful staff and concierge. Allowed me to use their computer to print out plane itinery. + Got a complementary upgrade from city view to opera-house view w/o asking. Nice! Despite many things not working, the location and helpful staff does make me feel that this place is 'almost' worth staying at. I've been to other 5-star hotels in places like LasVegas Wynn or LasVegas Trump, and this place is not on par, room-wise. Service-wise they are there...they just need to update their rooms!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific end to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: bioprof
Reviews.Content: We ended our month in AU at the Marriott, and after a number of days in the outback, nothing beats a room (and bed!) at a Marriott! The hotel is just perfect; the room was nice, we had a view of the opera house and bridge. Staying on points, we visited the Exec Lounge at night and made many new friends of other travellers. Good location, can walk in any direction to restaurants, shops, the Rocks, the Harbor. So enjoyed our stay! Thanks, Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelchick1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Sydney within easy walking distance of major attractions, shopping and restaurants. Hotel was well maintained, staff was friendly and helpful and our room was spotless. We booked a room and breakfast package and the breakfast buffet was amazing. Great selection of everything as well as a hot bar for freshly made, pancakes, waffles, omelets, etc. On Sundays it turns into a full brunch buffet. We had requested an early check-in when booking but due to the hotel being booked to capacity the night before they were still cleaning rooms when we arrived. They were more than happy to hold our luggage so we could go explore the city and got us into a room as quickly as they could and had our luggage delivered immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: fetcher9
Reviews.Content: You know what you are going to get with Marriott, which is why I often stay at Marriott hotels on business trips. Comfortable beds, clean rooms, close to transportation at circular quay. Only knock is that the "free WIFI" was really slow, I had to upgrade to the high speed access.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: This facility is average for big brand hotels but the location is great. If you want to stay next to Circular Quay. On the other hand if you don't need to stay in this area I would look around for a more interesting place to stay. The restaurant was average, room service was good. The main annoyance was the elevators were slow and didn't want to read the room cards. Almost everyone had problems getting the elevator to recognize the room key card. Concierges and staff were friendly. Executive room had a decent view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: iandorothy
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a room on the 27th floor with a view of the Opera house which was worth every cent. The room and bathroom are a good size and as you would expect are spotless. You are within minutes of the Opera house, bridge and shopping streets. The reception and concierge staff are excellent and were always pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty rooms”
Reviews.Author: MSCBrisbane
Reviews.Content: great location - just steps from the harbour & about a 15 minute walk to the heart of town the room was lovely all the facilities you would expect from a Marriott great service although the check-in girl was extremely rude!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great room & view”
Reviews.Author: Jeff57_9
Reviews.Content: Just a quick overnight stay but what a great base for a weekend in the harbour city. A brilliant view to the bridge & a short stroll to The Rocks, Opera House and all the local bars & cafes. The hotel has everything one would want including an unexpectedly delicious breakfast. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_jNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - Wont stay any where else in sydney ( If i can help it ;) My partner and I stayed for 4 nights. Stayed in a lovely room and had access to the executive lounge every morning for brekky, canape's and drinks and desserts. I was ill one night so they allowed my partner to go to the executive lounge and bring me back food - and also provided a wheelchair for me, as I was in hospital a few days before. Very accommodating!! and the staff were AMAZING and very attentive!!! We went to the buffet restaurant down stairs. Pricey, but had lovely food.. and the BEST macarons too for dessert ;) Only downfall... we arrived and the valet parking people took our car.. we didnt realise we could park it ourselves. it was about $50 a night to park with valet - we definately learnt our lesson there. but amazing! and would definately stay there again, and again, and again!! Keep up the good work Marriott!! oh, and the bed was VERY comfy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: vinesho
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel in Sydney that I stayed. The only issue was the office table in the room was glass rather than wood.I preferred a wooden office table as it is easy to work with a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at Circular Quay, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mossflower
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for accessing all that Sydney has to offer. Short walk to the ferry terminus and circular quay railway station, plus plenty of excellent restaurants, cafes etc close by. Our room had a city view and was well appointed and lovely and clean. Extremely comfortable bed and I love Marriott's bedding! The breakfasts in the restaurant were great too. Our associates had a harbour view room. This was possibly the only disappointment in that the harbour view was very obstructed by surrounding buildings. Fortunately we did not pay for a harbour view and chose to just walk down there instead. I would highly recommend this hotel as a base in Sydney. As we were in sydney for new years eve, we had to leave the hotel to view the fireworks on the harbour as the view from our associates harbourview room were very obstructed by other buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: johndoe13
Reviews.Content: Across the street from public transportation, so convenient to take trains/ferries/buses all over Sydney. The staff is VERY responsive, all requests answered within five minutes. The rooms are renovated, but the bathroom does not seem to be. The toilet does not flush circularly, so could not observe which direction water flows in Australia. Hotel provides adapters for the outet, physical connection only, your charger still needs to work at 220VAC.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: karena2001
Reviews.Content: The Marriott at Circular Quay is centrally located between the Rocks and the CBD, all within walking distance. Also, a couple of blocks from the train station where we arrived from the airport. We arrived a three hours early and were not allowed to check-in until the published 3PM check-in time. We requested the best room available for our price category and were given a room on the 25th floor. We had a view of the Harbour Bridge and Luna Park across the bay. In order to have this view it was necessary to stand at the window or pull up a comfortable side chair located in the room, which I did. The bathroom is large with a shower no tub. There was not a fan in the bathroom which made it difficult to apply make-up after showering. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens and pillows. It was not to hard nor to soft. Twice we requested ice and it was delivered fairly quickly, about 5 the first time and 15-20 the second. The gym had several cardio and weight machines, along with free weights. Free internet is available if you are a Marriott Rewards member. Enjoyed my stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “My Sydney arrival experience”
Reviews.Author: jimmclendon
Reviews.Content: This Marriott property was a lovely way to begin a 23-day trip to Australia & New Zealand. We were able to check in by late morning and as soon as my group began wearing thin by the 14 hour journey, we able to return to our great room and simply crash in comfort!! This enabled us to be rested and ready for our next morning's departure for New zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: SlotF16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a simple 2 block walk to the train station and ferry services of Circular Quay. This central location is perfect for a vacation or business stay in Sydney. The airport train gets you to Circular Quay in 18 minutes. Get the multi-pass to travel on trains, ferries and busses at reasonable rates. The location is also within easy walking distance to "The Rocks" shopping and dining district. The hotel is clean, modern, and provides exceptional service. The rooms are a bit small, but provide all of the conveniences most would expect to include coffee/tea service in-room. The "Executive Lounge" provides a full breakfast, and evening snacks, sweets, and liquor for those staying at that level. The hotel provides WiFi in guest rooms as well as the executive lounge. Overall, great hotel and staff - Perfect location! Highly recommend. I will stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: julielp
Reviews.Content: this is most conveniently located hotel in the city. Close to circular Quay..the rocks...martin place...you can walk to it all. the people that work at the hotel are very helpful..the honors lounge had lots of options for breakfast...and happy hour.. which went into the night. A very social place to be. the only downside to this hotel room wass the lack of dresser drawers and closet space. We were there for a week and it was difficult to live literally out of the suitcase. Not enough outlets to plug things in. that was the biggest issue with us.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: 100Kathy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on valentines day this year on business, i was a late afternoon walk in and as such paid a large rate for a room that had executive floor access and was on a high floor and the receptionist even made a comment that if i was prepared to have 2 queen beds she'd upgrade me to a harbour view which i agreed and was happy. I was given my keys for the room, sorry can't remember the room number, level 21 i think straight in front of the lifts on the left, and proceeded to go up to my room, used the key and entered to find that it was occupied already, kind of embarrassing situation to be in, i apologised and went back to reception, she didn't seem to see the seriousness of it all. I ended up being put, i guess, into a last sell room as there was no bath, no robes, mold in the grouting in the shower and just a general 'stale' feel to the room, i had been traveling for some time and just wanted to sleep so i didn't bother to go back to reception, what a disappointment for $600 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalRoamer2003
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Sydney, and Marriott was just part of the wonderful experience that made me fall in love with this city. The hotel is perfectly located, with just a short walk to everything: The Opera House, the botanical gardens, the waterfront, the bridge, restaurants, great barsâ€¦ Sigh. Did I mention I fell in love with this town? Like all Marriotts, the service was superb; this concierge desk, though, was one of the very best Iâ€™ve used in the world (maybe THE best). If there were one downside to the whole thing, it was just how incredibly busy it was! I went during the peak tourist season; adding the business travelers made the hotel perpetually crowded, busy. From the bar to the Executive Lounge (which had limited hours and offerings compared to other Marriott Hotels) to having always wait for one of the five elevatorsâ€¦ it was just too busy. (I learned from some living in Sydney that all hotels in the area were like that.) In the end, though, it was a great stay and Iâ€™d stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: Sydney Marriott is in a good location. You just walk out the door, turn right, and walk a block and a half to Circular Quay. The subway and ferries are right at Circular Quay. You don't need a car, but if you need one, there is an Avis rental right at this hotel. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was luxiorious, but it was expensive and breakfast was not included. Elevators were a bit slow. There was a gift shop in the lobby and an indoor pool and exercise room which we used. There was also a convenience store across the street to buy small items to eat. You have to go to the staff however to print boarding passes. We stayed here for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: 1Lad
Reviews.Content: Mariott Sydney Harbour is right where tourists want to be. You can choose Bridge or Opera House views from your room, and walk to the major tourist attractions. Our room was clean and modern with iPod dock, big flat screen TV, movies (pay), a huge bed, good sized table with two chairs plus two other lounging chairs with coffee table. The room was very quiet day and night. The bathroom was well appointed but a little dated in appearance. Big bath and shower with massage option. Staff were generally very good, friendly and helpful. A highlight was the early arrivals lounge (that we used when leaving late), tea and coffee facilities, TV, computer and plenty of lounges, tables and chairs. The bathrooms are beautifully clean, big and modern. A lifesaver before heading to the airport after a hard day in Sydney. The lobby area is nice and airy, however, the lobby bar lacks atmosphere. But then you have all the bars and restaurants along Circular Quay starting less than a two minute walk from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Flash but Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I spent a night here for work. The room was refurbished and comfortable however the bathroom could have had more concentration on the detail. As I was working I had room service and I was surprised at the quality and reasonable price. Also there was complimentary wifi which is unusual for Australian hotels.For tourists to Sydney this is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Taras P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first stop of our honeymoon, and couldn't have asked for a better experience. We had a executive level room with an harbour/opera house view and it was really nice being able to wake up look out the window and see that. Also, on the executive level, you get access to the lounge which offers free wifi, and a really reasonable breakfast every morning. After going out once for breakfast, we realized that we did not need to. Also, located just steps from Circular Quay, you could get everywhere you need with the buses, trains and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location if you plan on not renting a car. Less than 10 minute walk to Bridge and Opera House. About 5 minute to Circular Quay station. Took train from airport and walked from station to Marriott with no problem. Would stay here again for sure if I went back. Food though is very high here, but I stayed here for location. Not food!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandk_95
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic experince!! The whole great experince started when we were met by a friendly concerierge who took our bags from the car and the team who looked after our car unteil we needed it on our last day. Check in was fuss free and the room was ready even though it was before 12pm. Our room had a spectacular view and the room was clean and tidy. The bed was comfortable and the room dark to allow a great nigths sleep. The location was fantastic and close to everything. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller227
Reviews.Content: We stayed over night and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean and well presented. The bed and pillows were the best (really comfy) and the breakfast we had delivered to the room was plentiful and lovely with the view out towards the harbour bridge. We had a few drinks downstairs at the bar and found the staff there to be friendly and chatty, in particular Simon. The concierge recommended a restaurant nearby that served modern Australian cuisine. His tip was spot on- we ate dinner there and will be definately returning in the future. The valet staff also deserve a mention. They were all very professional and prompt in returning our car to us. The only downfall is very minor- Queing to check in took some time. Perhaps we just arrived at a very busy time???

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter494
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Circular Quay is well situated for touring Sydney, and for many business appointments. It is about 150 meters from the Circular Quay train station and ferry docks. The opera house is just another 250 meters beyond the ferries and a lovely botanical garden is also nearby. In the heart of downtown, all major services are available in a short walk: banks, restaurants, etc. I stayed at the hotel twice about 3 days apart. Each time, my room was attractive on a high floor. One view was of the harbor bridge. The other overlooked the opera house. The concierge lounge had a decent selection for both breakfast and after-work snacks (which you could make a dinner of if you didn't want to go out). The lounge itself was attractive with spectacular views in all directions. Several people attended to the lounge guests keeping it tidy and the food offerings replenished. It can get crowded at peak times. And lounge access comes at a premium -- unless you are a Marriott Gold or Platinum member.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel at Very High Prices”
Reviews.Author: TravlChick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on business/personal trip. Location of hotel in Circular Quay is very good. After that the hotel is just average but is extremely expensive. I upgraded to a club room (not on the club floor but access to the club) and it was not worth it for A$100 per night. The club breakfast is OK but not terrific; some warm items like eggs and sausage but otherwise a traditional continental breakfast. The staff tell you to make sure to see 'the view' from the club but there is actually only one small window that looks at the harbour and unless you are sitting at the table in front of it you can't see it. The gym is very good and accessible to all guests. 3 elipticals, 4 treadmills, 2 bikes, plus dumbbels and cable machines and a few benches plus a few weight machines. The room itself was a bit on the small side and the bathroom was also a bit small but serviceabe. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night; we did not chose the buffet which they push but the food was reasonably good but not special. The buffet itself looked good but not great and had a price of A$50 per person. I travel on business a lot around the world, and for the price this was among the worst value I have experienced. You are clearly paying for the location more than the quality of the hotel. The staff that I encountered were certainly nice but did not appear to want to go out of their way. Concierge service was adequate but you had to really push them to get them to give you restaurant suggestions that weren't the typical marginal tourist fare near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy808
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott was wonderful, the service was great, rooms were beautiful and it is located walking distance to most everything: the Sydney Harbor Bridge (what a blast the climb was!), Opera House, train station the Royal Botanical Gardens and The Rocks. Just one thing to be aware of...the taxi's are usually waiting just around the corner from the hotel, don't tell the valet guys you need a taxi in advance, we had to pay for an extra 25 minutes, because we did some last minute shopping and didn't notice until in route to the airport that the meter was running from the time the taxi arrived at the hotel, not from the time we all got in to leave.

Reviews.Title: “I did like breakfast”
Reviews.Author: anna00747
Reviews.Content: In the interest of a fair review, I have to say that my favourite hotel in Sydney is the Observatory Hotel and I do tend to compare other Sydney Hotels to the Observatory. I also have to confess that I never choose to stay at a hotel whose windows do not open, and this was an exception on a night where any of my other choices in Sydney were full. I also paid a high room rate comparable to that at the Observatory so my expectations were perhaps higher. Added to all of the above I am rather fussy, perhaps to the extreme about cleanliness so this review is perhaps best for those who are of the same inclination. I will start with the positives, because there were some. I liked the buffet breakfast, it was very busy but the staff were extremely attentive, the coffee was great, very good choice of fresh fruit, smoked salmon and cold cuts, cheese, sweet treats, chef who cooked some great eggs, everything you could possibly want in a breakfast buffet and more. I have no complaints about the staff at all. The pool area and gym looked great. The negatives for me was the terrible smell of stale cigarette smoke coming from the air conditioning system. It really was very unpleasant. The bedroom was of a reasonable size but the bathroom was really small and I felt it needed some upgrading and a little more industrial cleaning and luxury for the price. The bed was very uncomfortable, very hard and despite being very tired I found it very hard to sleep. It would be fine for people who love hard beds and floors. The pillows were good. The sheets were of reasonable quality but once again had the same sort of smell as the air conditioning. The carpet had several stains and patches of sticky stuff so I made sure I put socks on to walk around the room. The iron was of inferior quality as was the ironing board and not kept in good condition. I could not iron at all with it. The alarm had been left on by a previous guest so a 2am wake up call was not great either, but I perhaps should take some responsibility for checking this. The queues at the elevators at all times during the evening and most especially in the morning were really bad. Obviously not enough elevators for the amount of rooms. I wont even mention the check out queues!! This Hotel does have many airline crews and I wondered whether their sleep had been as bad as mine. I hope not! I personally would not stay here again but if you are paying a very reasonable rate and like hard beds and are not a fusspot like me it may fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad For A One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: cap3tt3
Reviews.Content: To be fair when we arrived late on our night we were tired and exhausted plus a tiny bit cranky. The staff were very nice and the accommodation while small was clean, modern and comfortable. We didn't want room service but there is not much in the way near by of alternative eating so we had MacDonalds. As an overnight stay it was good enough, we had friends nearby we were able to visit easily the next day. The view from the room was not great but we weren't really in there to look out the room. The location however was not fantastic for sight seeing, it would be a bit of a walk or a taxi ride to see the major sights. We had a comfortable sleep and the room did everything we needed it too.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: stamfordtraveler72
Reviews.Content: We finished our Australia honeymoon in Sydney and are so grateful that we stayed at this Marriott. As per other reviews, it is a coin flip as to which was better -- the location or the staff, especially the concierges (if you are planning any activities, make sure you talk to the concierges.) From check-in to check-out, this hotel knows how to treat its guests properly. As someone from the States, it is exceedingly rare to encounter that level of above-and-beyond service with no expectation of a tip or gratuity to follow. As far as the location, its proximity to the Rocks, the Bridge, the Opera House, and the ferry terminal was excellent, not to mention the botanical gardens and even Darling Harbor isn't too bad a hike. We had no issues with the room, which was both comfortable and clean. Also if you are buying any souvenirs, check out the gift shop. The guy there was friendly and if you don't mind a little haggling, you can get as good a deal on some stuff others are selling at the nearby shops.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par hotel, dated interiors, micro tiny rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: drea2000 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks as a business traveler. I was treated like hurded cattle, room service delivered wrong/missing food 50% of the time, and they ask you to buy an internet card to print a boarding card from the business center! The price you pay for the value you get is laughable. Next trip I stayed at Westin Sydney just a block away and had the full 5 star experience. Never again Marriott. Pros Location 5 star breakfast Prompt room service Cons Service non-existent Delivered someone else's dry cleaning to my room with mine - no apologies by staff. Asked to purchase internet card to print boarding card from business center computer - ridiculous! Micro tiny rooms LOW ceilings - claustrophia to the max! Never again Marriott Sydney Harbour. Say hello to Westin Sydney where customers are treated as individual guests and delivered service 5 star customers expect.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Quality in an Excellent Location (and Best Concierge Ever)”
Reviews.Author: ajax3000
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Sydney Marriott. Our trip to Sydney was unfortunately plagued by cold weather (think it set a 50-year record that week) and persistent rain, so we spent more time than expected in the Hotel. What we discovered is that 1) the Hotel's Central Location made exploring close-by activities super easy (great when you never know when the weather will turn), 2) the recently renovated rooms are supremely comfortable and 3) the Concierge desk is an absolute jewel in the Hotel industry. I have stayed in hotels around the world, and I encountered the absolute best Concierge at this hotel. Jonathan helped us arrange trips, babysitters, discounted tours, and got us last minute reservations into some of the nicest restuarants in Sydney. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Great location”
Reviews.Author: TCPP
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Marriott. We had two lovely large interconnecting rooms as a family of 5. Very comfortable and modern. Breakfast was excellent (and we have travelled widely and eaten at multiple resorts around the world so we are good at comparing!!). Best of all was the staff. At breakfast they made our day with their great attitudes and smiles. It really makes a difference. Best of all was the help I received after realizing my daughter had left her money in the safe. We were already flying home by this time. Everyone was so helpful and kept me informed of whole process. Thanks especially to security and Jonathon from concierge. With staff like this the hotel can only succeed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel unless you are prepared to live out of a suitcase”
Reviews.Author: Margot C
Reviews.Content: I do not usually post hotel reviews but feel duty bound to warn potential bookers of this hotel that they will not be able to unpack unless they can manage with space for just 6 hangers or are staying only for one night. I booked this hotel for a 17 night stay for my husband and I but checked out after a few hours sleep, I would have checked out immediately on seeing the room but it was late at night. The receptionist showed me alternative rooms including a suite but still the problem was the same - THERE IS NOWHERE TO STORE YOUR CLOTHES OR ANY OTHER PERSONAL ITEMS, just half a cupboard and not one drawer. Thankfully we had booked a rate that could be cancelled so were able to move to the Shangri La where we have a huge room with a large amount of hanging space and drawers, spacious bathroom with a bath as well as a shower, plus a fantastic view over Sydney Harbour. And the rate is averaging out only a few dollars more than the Marriott. So if you like to unpack your clothes, you have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, really helpful!”
Reviews.Author: SBhattacharyya
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the central Business district in Sydney, this is perfect for a short business trip. The rooms are clean, comfortable, basically all that you'd expect of a Marriott and awesome staff! They figure out just about everything for you. If you get a habour facing room on the top floors, you could have a great view of the Harbour Bridge. Also, there's a 7/11 right across the street so that's convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate America, but in Oz”
Reviews.Author: Charles_Orleans
Reviews.Content: One of the best located hotels in Sydney for tourists, very near the Opera House, Bridge and the Circular Quay ferry/train transport hub. It is however a busy business hotel with a very North American feel. There was a big a corporate exhibition/conference while we were there. The plus side was that our room was upgraded to a high floor with a view of the Opera House, the downsides were that the wait for the lifts was long and the queues for breakfast were horrendous, so much so that we went out every morning to one of the many coffee outlets a few hundred yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Marcopolo111
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality Marriott with the most desirable location in Sydney, one block from the Circular Quay and a few blocks from the Rocks. The hotel is pretty well kept and so are the rooms. At variance from other reviewers I found the service consistently great (we have been there twice/year for the last five years). If you get to the concierge floor the breakfast and evening appetizers are far superior to most other Marriott, and the view is sublime.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAFF ANYWHERE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan-80
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for two weeks for a vacation & Wedding and we were thrilled with the friendliness and courtesy extended to us by every member of the staff. They were truly OUTSTANDING!!!! Upon our arrival the front desk staff promptly checked us in early after our long overnight flight and upgraded both of our rooms-king and doubles- to gorgeous views of the bridge and opera house. This was followed with a complimentary bottle of wine. The bell captain assisted us with a Qantas luggage replacement and Abdul repaired another damaged piece on his own! Abdul then greeted us every day with a wave and collected both sets of luggage on our departure. Geoff at the valet desk greeted us daily with a smile and waited patiently with us when our car ride was an hour late--explaining that it was not normal in the Australia he lives in. We even met his family and were surprised to hear that he kept his wife informed of our wedding plans. Adam & Ben were terrific too. At the breakfast buffet Jenny, Viktor, Ashlee, Tim & Tatiana were wonderful. Jenny in particular remembered us and personally made us apple juice on our last day! This attention was only exceeded by the staff in the executive concierge lounge!! Roaslee & Johanna went out of their way to welcome us and make us feel like we were staying with "family". Both were sincerely interested in our son's wedding and gave us thoughtful gifts on our last day. Johanna even called our room to make sure we would say goodbye! Amazing! We looked forward to seeing them too, along with Jimmy, Aleen, Sally & Mariam. The maid staff also gave us conscientious attention, including helping with beach towels. Without question they are most amazing Marriott staff we have ever stayed with! As a Gold member we had daily access to the Executive lounge on the 30th floor and this too was amazing!! Breakfast, snacks, appetizers, desserts plus beer & mixed drinks were ALL included!! I had a great rate on the buffet so we usually had breakfast there but either was more than adequate. The Gym was a pleasant surprise for a hotel since it included free weights. Pool, hot tub & sauna were okay for a city hotel. We found this location to be ideal for seeing Sydney. The Opera House & Harbour Bridge, & The Rocks were right there plus buses & ferries are steps away at Circular Quay to go anywhere else. We visited Manly, Bondi, Bronte, Terrigal, Tamarama beaches---and saw no sharks. We highly recommend a stay here when in Sydney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location good, hotel dull!”
Reviews.Author: adlynmeg
Reviews.Content: Within eyeshot of the famous bridge and possibly the Opera House. However, everything else about this hotel is uninspiring, dated, dull and disapointing. From the moment you walk into the anonymous loby (first impressions are made in the hotel loby and this is consistent with that theory). In fact, from the moment you approach the hotel it seems disjointed and awkward. The walk to the room builds no anticipation or level of improved expectation for what the room will be like. Which is just as well because the room was dull. Dull carpet, dull decor, dull furniture. All the features you get in those 'has been hotels' are in here. Not enough power sockets and the ones they have are in awkward positions, Not enough bathroom accessories (every decent hotel should have a complimentary toothbrush/paste and other items in the bathroom). No iPod holders or other finishing touches. No little jogging map on a card. The bar was also anonymous. Overall, dull, dull, dull.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ryokoo-netsu
Reviews.Content: The location of this Marriott, just a block away (less than 5 minutes walking with luggage) from the Circular Quay train station/ferry terminal, was perfect for a first-time, four-day stay in Sydney. From this location, the entire city of Sydney is easily accessible by foot, train, bus or ferry, to include the International Airport (accessible by train on the airport line). The Rocks neighborhood is a very short walk from the hotel, with many options for dining, drinks, shopping and so on (although we found the Rocks to be a little too touristy, especially while one of the big cruise liners was in port). The major tourist spots are also walkable from the hotel, including the Opera House, the Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Royal Botanical Gardens. Using our hotel as our launch point, we easily traveled to several parts of the city. We took the train from Circular Quay to Town Hall and explored the Queen Victoria Building and shopping area around it. Following dinner in Darling Harbor, we walked back to the Marriott - which took us about 30-40 minutes at a relaxing, post-dinner pace. The next day we caught a bus from Circular Quay (which is a terminal for many of the Sydney's major bus routes) out to Coogee Beach, then returned to Circular Quay from Bondi Beach on the bus (with stop on Oxford Street in Paddington for some high fashion/boutique shopping). The following day we took a morning ferry to Watson's Bay and bussed back to Circular Quay, then took an evening ferry to Manly to explore Manly Beach and the surrounding area. We really felt as though everything in Sydney was accessible to us from Circular Quay. Each morning, we thoroughly enjoyed breakfast and excellent coffee at a wonderful little cafe called Utopia, located right next to the Marriott (accessible either by taking a left out of the "back" door off the lobby, or following the alley from the front entrance). The woman taking our order remembered us by our orders the next morning, which is quite an amazing feat considering the place was always full of customers! You can either grab your coffee to go or do like we did and start your day by enjoying your coffee and a nice small breakfast al fresco-style just outside of the cafe. The hotel itself is everything I would expect of a Marriott. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable about the area, and helpful with all of our questions or requests. Large umbrellas were available from the bell-stand, which (unfortunately) proved to be very useful for us during our trip. We stayed in a standard room that had a city view (no Opera House/Harbor from our side of the building), and the room was very comfortable. The price of the hotel was more than I'd hoped, but in comparison with other options in the same area, the Marriott was on par or less than competitors at the same level (we stayed the week prior to Christmas 2011). I will admit that my decision to stay at Marriott is also influenced by my Marriott Rewards status though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great executive lounge... bad service!”
Reviews.Author: voyageuse_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for a few nights in December 2011 and it was great... pros were great executive room (32nd level) with very comfortable bed, clean and new-ish looking bathroom (as opposed to standard rooms on lower levels, which I know have some fairly shady bathrooms!). We paid for the executive lounge and had a wonderful breakfast each day, and basically ate dinner up there by snacking on the canapÃ©s they serve, with lots of glasses of wine and champagne:) The front desk service was really quite questionable, as it was the last time we stayed there (we had to spend a LONG time at the front desk sorting out issues with the room), plus we were double-charged for our room!! They debited the full amount before we arrived, then also charged the same full amount during out stay...! Overall, the hotel is in a fantastic location, the executive lounge is great, executive rooms are super comfortable with fantastic views (although very expensive, of course). We had a wonderful stay and will return, but hopefully they will lift their front desk service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lyn L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location as we finished our cruise. We were able to take a ferry ride that was at our door step, walk the "Rock's" area next to the hotel and finish with some shopping a short walk away in the downtown area. The hotel breakfast although expensive was excellent and we did not stop for lunch that day. The room was spacious and immaculate and any problems were dealt with immediately. The dinning at the waterfront with views of the Sydney Opera house were amazing and just steps away no taxi's needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on three occasions within a one-month period. The Marriott is less than a 5-minute walk from the harbor and Opera House, as well as the hop-on/hop-off bus route and only 10 minutes from the shopping district. You're close to everything, including many great restaurants and bars. The hotel itself has recently been modernized and all rooms have somewhat of a minimalist, Scandinavian approach to decor. Rooms are not large but are adequate if you don't plan to spend all day in your room. On of my rooms was right outside the elevator and yet there was no noise at all. Some rooms have a nice view of the Opera House; others overlook the air conditioning system. You get what you pay for . . . be sure you understand what you've paid for. Was upgraded to a jr. suite which had a windowless separate bedroom and a sitting room that overlooked the harbor. The view is probably worth the price . . . the extra space isn't unless you have two people. The bath is modern -- some rooms only have a large shower; others have separate shower and tub. Everything is marble and granite and very clean. The concierge desk was extremely helpful - great suggestions for touring and dining. There was never a line and everyone wanted to assist whether you were here on business or pleasure. You can buy your hop on bus tickets here, which makes that tour quick and easy. The bell desk was also great -- prompt and courteous and always available. The concierge lounge is a nice perk whether your pay or receive it as a frequent traveler. A very large breakfast with American and European style food. There are heavy hors d'hoeuveres and drinks in the evening. If you're not from the US, be forewarned that the overwhelming majority of people there are Americans and, during tourist season, people going to and from cruises. The lobby bar had a great piano player while we were there -- a great way to unwind at night and there is absolutely no pressure to purchase any food or drink. The only thing that keeps me from givin the Marriott 5 stars is the front desk. Every single time I went there, day or night, weekend or weekday, there was a line. And, often, there were 4-6 employees at the desk but only 1-2 actually helping customers. I watched while one employee counted room key cards for over 5 minutes while 8 people waited in line. It's a large hotel and probably needs more people working the desk, especially during peak check-in and check-out times. There were other issues such as the keys not working (twice), etc. Overall, however, if you want a large, newly remodeled hotel with all the amentiies that is close to almost everything, the Marriott is for you. If you want a quaint hotel with lots of local flavor, there are other places that will be more to your liking.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott lift your game!”
Reviews.Author: hazel1954
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have stayed in various Marriotts around the world and can't fault any until I walked into this one!!!! Absolutely agree with previous post, on our arrival not one person came to get our luggage from Taxi as previously stated the staff were to busy with other things. The room was clean enough, but I cannot believe that there was not one drawer for us to place our clothing other than a small child size wardrobe with just hanging room only( what on earth are you thinking?????) We had to wait a good 15 minutes for our luggage to be picked up. The most rudest part was after we checked out I went over to the Bell Captain to collect Luggage Storage Tag and as I was asking him for Luggage Tag the phone started to ring....he didn't excuse himself, just picked up the phone ans started speaking with no gesture of apology . On finishing that phone call the phone rang straight away and a second time he left me hanging high and dry....I was dumbfounded to say the least!!!! Thick set man wearing a suit!!!!!!!! Apart from the great location will definitely consider using Sofitel or Raddison next time in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal & poorly managed 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bromeisl
Reviews.Content: To rate a hotel 5 star requires top facilities, rooms, service attitude and a somewhat personal approach. This is not the case with the Marriott at Circular Key, other than the location which is excellent. When arriving, one would expect the bell staff to ask you for assistance with luggage, rather than chatting among themselves and trying to re-arrange the busy car parking in front of the hotel, being more interested in the 'flashy cars' than the customers. In fact, I received not once a greeting or a remote attempt to open a door. The receptionist other than over friendly (..how lovely and what a pleasure... ) did not make an attempt to alter the room in line with my requests for high floor. The assigned room was it! When stepping into the room, I found it rather on the small side but with an excellent bed and clean. My requests for slippers and bath robe (when booking on the Marriott site) were not fulfilled. Then I tried to ring reception. There is no such number. You have to ring for all issues number 9 and then you will be answered by some neither friendly or competent telephone attendants. What is most annoying is the fact the you are put into a waiting line, as if you would call from outside ...this is the Marriott blah blah. My first call was answered in over 2 minutes and I was told that the receptionist, which I wanted to speak to is for the reception duties and not for answering calls from guests, this is the telephone operator's task. At other times I waited again between 1 and 2 minutes, fastest about 20 seconds. The bath robes and sippers were then delivered (we do this always when the guests have settled in...?). No enlarging mirrors, no handheld showers and after a shower, the bathroom needs a clean up. No ever turndown service, despite the advice by the duty manageress, in 5 days. The staff either at the concierge desk, reception or else do not know how to great guests, or are not interested, insufficient training, a management issue. The hotel was previously the 'Renaissance' a 4 star business hotel (I stayed there some 12 years or so ago) and that is it, when you rate the place. A typical example of a hotel which is poorly managed without a specific customer focus. Enter the Marriott or the central station, you would find no difference in attention. Unfortunately the excellent location makes it very popular and expensive, despite a poor service attitude and only average facilities for a so called 5 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Great location”
Reviews.Author: MHoskins31
Reviews.Content: Stayed just after New Year with my wife and 2 children and the hotel and staff were excellent, they gave the children teddies on arrival to the hotel and the Breakfast had something for everyone.The room was clean and modern and the location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to EVERYTHING you'll want to do in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TeriTravels74
Reviews.Content: The room had a great views of both the Opera house and the Sydney Harbor Bridge, which are beautiful during the day and almost even more striking in the evening. This Marriott did had a bustling executive lounge on a high floor, so for the rewards members the food in the morning and cocktail hour in the evening (along with friendly Australian travelers as well as visitors) was a great amenity. The bridge climb of the Harbor Bridge was the experience of a lifetime (walking distance from the hotel) and tour of the Opera house also worth the time, even better to see a performance. Also worth it if you have the time - bus trip to the Blue Mountains, which can be arranged by the concierge at the hotel. Absolutely stunning. Featherdale Zoo (where you can feed Kangaroos and pet Koalas) is also a worthwhile trip, and inexpensive. The hotel was also within walking distance to all the restaurants and shops at the Rocks, and the concierge was always willing to help with suggestions. Comfortable well appointed rooms, internet is pricey. There is a McDonalds nearby that offered free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldgypse
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights to include New Years eve. Had room 2216 which had a great view of the harbor bridge for watching fireworks (didn't have to fight the crowd with a view like that). Only thing missing was a bathtub (shower only) but nice toiletries and lots of counter space around basin which is a must for a female traveller. The light command stations on each side of the bed is a trip and allows for various room lighting options which I enjoyed. Also, it is nice to be able to get the room nice and dark. Bedding very high quality which I find a plus. I can't say enough good things about the staff and the concierge lounge on the 30th floor. Great location, centered between circular quay and the rocks area. The only slight disappointment was the onsight spa facilities which I had used on previous stays; had to ask for a robe, no slippers, terrible massage tables (way to skinny and uncomfortable) but the therapist did give a good massage and was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good service. Good choice for a family too”
Reviews.Author: vman63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and our 2.5 yr old in Dec 2011 for 5 nights. The rooms have been recently renovated so it's all white and modern and with the 'minimalistic' touch. We wanted a room with a bath (and not just a shower) so they changed our room without much fuss. We had breakfast as part of the package and the spread was fine. The bread/pastry section was fresh and of very good quality and they even had a live counter for eggs and pancakes. They had all the usual breakfast fare including a selection of Asian cuisine. They were very prompt in removing the food at 10:30am sharp! The rooms were nice and the beds were very comfortable - something that you come to expect from a 5-star property. The rooms now have 42 inch LCD TVs too with satellite TV. As a Marriott Rewards member I got free WiFi which was very useful in keeping my child occupied with the iPad. The only grouse I have with the Rewards Programme is that they have so far, refused to credit points for this stay since I booked it through a travel agent (NOT an on-line discount website like Priceline or Hotels.com) and paid the same rate as the Marriott website. Not sure if I have the energy to fight them for it. If someone from the hotel or the Marriott Group reads this review, I hope they sort this out for me. In terms of location, the hotel is very well placed. A stone's throw away from Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House and The Rocks areas. So if you need to take a ferry to the Taronga Zoo or to Manly Beach, it's very convenient. Also, across the hotel are a few convenient stores so you can always buy your jujices/milk, etc. in case you are not on the breakfast plan. There are also some bars around the corner opposite Circular Quay which were always crowded and seemed very popular with the locals. You can also walk to the shopping district which is about 3 blocks away and we used to do this often with our baby (in a pram of course!). The Botanic gardens are also a 15 min walk so that's another useful option. They have a pool and health club too but we didn't use either. Room service was prompt though the children's menu was a little limited. The quality of food was acceptable but with so many options to choose from in Sydney, one really does not have to eat in the hotel unless, like us, you have a very young child and therefore room service is an obvious choice. All in all I was pleased with the service (though check-out took a little longer than I expected) and would recommend this hotel for both business as well as families.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: dazzaderrie
Reviews.Content: You are pretty much close to everything its a great location! Fantastic view of the Opera house and harbour. Comfy bed and nice furnishing's. Staff were friendly and happy and nothing was a problem. Wi Fi connection was really expensive so we didn't bother. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One stay only”
Reviews.Author: 1place1dream
Reviews.Content: I chose this when the other hotel was not available for my trip. I understood why there were still rooms left during the peak week. It is on a quiet side of Circular Quay. A longer walk or travel to anywhere reasonable. The room is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back !!!”
Reviews.Author: Wackey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our cruise departure and found the location to be excellent. Upon arrival our children were given goody bags filled with toys and lollies to enjoy. We found all staff to be extremely friendly and helpful and our room was spotlessly clean and quiet and the beds were soooooo comfortable. We had breakfast included with our package and we found the buffet had a huge variety of hot and cold dishes. Would highly recommend this hotel for its location and friendly service. We will definately stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: Stay here for the location. Located in the historic Rocks district, the Marriott is steps away from the Sydney Harbor Bridge and a very short walk to the Opera House. We arrived at 8am after flying in from NY and to our pleasant surprise, the room was waiting for us. We had a glorious view of the Opera House. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The only drawback was that there were no cabinets to place the clothes. Since we (family of 4) were only staying for 2 nights, we worked out of our suitcases. We were able to walk all around most of the city from our location. We did take a 10 minute cab ride to Darling Harbour which has lots of great shopping, an IMAX theater, a mall and the aquarium. The Marriott does have a "could be anywhere feel" but it was exactly what we were looking for. It has a good gym and an indoor pool as well. This was our second trip to Sydney and it was even better than we remembered!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: balzer4
Reviews.Content: When traveling to Sydney every 3-4 years we usually stay at the Intercontinental. But we had lots of Marriott points and decided to cash in points for the Sydney Harbour Marriott. We booked a basic room and was extremely happy with the room and the view. We actually had a small view of the Opera House and harbour. The location of this Marriott is fantastic. Only 1 block to Circular Quay ( pronounced, Key!). You can take a ferry to many locations across the harbour. Pubs, restaurants, and world class shopping is all around this hotel. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The room and bathroom had every thing we needed to make our stay comfortable. Sydney is a fabulous city to walk and explore. Sydney's public transportation is wonderful. Buses, trains and ferries at your doorstep. The hotel has a great gym. Only needed if the weather is not good. You can get all the cardio you need by walking this magnificent city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay for five days and found it to be a perfect location for exploring Sydney. Many of the things visitors want to see are within walking distance. The hotel was clean, the rooms were nice, and the gym was good. We didn't eat at the hotel because the prices were too expensive; however, there are many restaurants nearby. The concierges were very good at giving tips of where to go and how to get there. As a few other reviewers said, there were none of the Marriott extras, such as robes or slippers, but that wasn't a huge deal. I do wish they had slippers because I personally don't like walking on the carpets barefoot. Other than that, it was what I have come to expect at a Marriott. I would definitely recommend the hotel as a good base for visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth paying extra for the opera house view”
Reviews.Author: Abidora
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for the room expecting a great view of the Sydney opera house. But all we get is the back view of the opera house. Nothing great! We stayed for 4 nights. Breakfast was boring, nearly the same kind of food every morning. Only compliment is free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “used to be better before the refurbishment?”
Reviews.Author: TCK33
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times and for a significant update, it doesn't seem that much better. The rooms have been updated but not the bathrooms. The tiles in the bathroom ( floor ) were really old and average looking. There are no bathrobes, no turndown or slippers, yet other Marriotts ( eg Brisbane ) have these and the room rate is higher. Room lighting didn't even have a dimmer - not so state of the art. Its a good location to be near the harbour, staff are good but overall not comparable to other hotels such as the Sheraton or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler11778
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week, we were able to check in straight away, the rooms are good, quite and clean, and best of all was the location of the hotel, it was close to everything (trains, ferries,..etc) no problem going anywhere around. Internet for Marriot reward program members is free of charge which was excellent, Breakfast was expensive but just beside the hotel was a nice cafe we used to eat there. My drawback was the amenities inside the room was missing many stuff like Bath robe,..etc. All in all was a very good experience and I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: Even though we arrived well before check-in time, they had the room ready for us. The room was a suite with updated furniture, two flat screen televisions, nice big bed, bathroom had shower and tub. We had a nice view of the harbour. We were very impressed with the knowledge and helpfulness of the concierge crew, they were able to recommend and subsequently book appointments for a hair salon, manicure, and even a dentist. All of which were close by. This hotel is close to so many good dining places and also close to the quay. The bartender can make some good drinks, but the breakfast buffet was mediocre--not terrible, good selection with an omlette and pancake station, but poor value considering the price paid--about $36 per breakfast, expensive even for this area of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Updated Room”
Reviews.Author: LadyPearl47
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early morning and were very pleased to have a room ready for us to check in. Our king-bed room had a very nice view of the Harbour Bridge, an updated bathroom (shower no tub) and newly renovated furnishings with a very comfortable bed and flat panel television. This hotel is steps to the Circular Quay train station as well as the Overseas Passenger Terminal and just a five minute walk to the many restaurants and shops in The Rocks. The concierge was very helpful in pointing out some reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance and the front desk staff was always cheerful and ready to help with any questions. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxnruby
Reviews.Content: I had booked a city view room with my reward points and we were upgraded to a harbour view on the 25th floor which had a good view of the Harbour Bridge. We arrived at 10.30am and our room was ready for us. 2 queen beds were very comfy, nice bathroom but abit dissappointed there was no bath. We had the buffet dinner, using our $20 per person off voucher received upon check in, so it was $40 each. It was nice, but I wouldn't pay $60 for it. Also had the buffet breakfast, all the usual things. I couldn't access the in room check out (something I had done countless of times) and the girl at reception was vague about it and not very helpful. All up it was a pleasant stay, great location for Circular Quay, Opera House etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sangio7
Reviews.Content: We decided for once to stay near he Quay with a view of the Harbour, and selected the Marriott because it had a reasonable rate and guaranteed a view (we selected an "Opera View" King room). From the 26th floor we had a great view of the Eastern half of the Quay, the Opera House, and the Harbour beyond. The room was comfortable, though not the best appointed Marriott I have stayed in, and it was very conveniently located for what we wanted to do. As remarked by others,the minibar was both sparsely populated and expensive - they obviously prefer guests to use the bar :-) Breakfast was a bit disappointing - some of the "hot" food was quite cold ans some of the bakery items stale from standing around too long - strange for a busy Saturday morning. For a downtown hotel with a view of one of the finest city harbours in the world, the cost is quite reasonable by world standards.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our king bed and superb views”
Reviews.Author: Oldandnew
Reviews.Content: Given the choice of 2 doubles or a king bed in our room we chose the kingsize which was huge and very comfortable. Our room was tasfully decorated and large enough, with a small, cosily modern sitting area, a good size desk. The bathroom had a big bath, shower recess and quality toiletries. Our Opera view was amazing - in fact from our room on the 18th floor we had a perfect view of the opera house and beyond, to the harbour entrance

Reviews.Title: “Queen beds are small.”
Reviews.Author: Polyglotte
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but we had two Queen beds in our room and they are the size of a US double. And our "view of Sydney Opera" room was only true if we stood right up at the window and looked dar off to the left. Otherwise, good hotel. Very good food.

Reviews.Title: “It does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: travellerLDN
Reviews.Content: During our recent visit to Sydney we stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbour mainly because of it location and the fact that the rooms have been recently renovated.
