Here are the pros: - nice new rooms - good beds - nice breakfast - good views if you book the right room - good service - excellent location if you want to explore Sydney Cons are: - rooms are refurbished bathrooms are not which is a bit of a shame All in all a very decent place to stay if you do not want to have a good hotel in the CBD Sdyndey

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jamcam76
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend a little more and go for an "Opera View" room â€“ we got room 2203. We were disappointed to find that only a limited view of the rear of the opera house could be had by viewing from the extreme corner of the room. A less misleading name for the room would be the "AMP Tower" view room (we had a magnificent view of this grey monolith from all parts of the room). If you want a proper view of the Opera House you are better to go for the Four Seasons or the Shangri La Hotels which have better locations for getting a clear view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and are closer to the Rocks precinct. If you are not happy with your view, complain straight away and demand a better view that is consistent with their sales representations. The mini bar had a half-drunk Gatorade (assume it was left by the previous guests) but when we took it down to reception they apologised and sorted it out. $5 for a small box of Pringles is absurd but what you expect â€“ there are plenty of convenience stores nearby which arenâ€™t that good value either but cheaper than the mini bar prices. The closet is small but has a safe and ironing board etc. The TV was quite big and the remote and menu were easy to follow and worked fine. The room was clean but a little â€œstarkâ€� and certainly not as luxurious or well appointed as the Four Seasons which we had stayed at twice previously. The gym (open 24 hours) and pool were good but this hotel is starting to look a little tired in some departments, especially the bathroom (the toilet flush actually came off from the wall, the shower door did not close properly and the tiles were quite dated). The shower itself was nice and hot and had a strong flow rate but the room only came with one set of towels (tip â€“ take some extra from the gym on level 4 if you donâ€™t want to call room service for more). When we asked about whether the room had a bath upon check-in, we were told that the newly refurbished rooms no longer had baths because a survey the hotel performed indicated that most people did not use them or have a preference for them in the room. This surprised us a little as we recalled seeing on the website that the Opera view rooms are meant to have a bath. To add to the confusion, upon entering the room it DID have a bath! I donâ€™t think that their website is entirely accurate about the amenities that come with each room so check carefully and hold them to it if what you get does not match what is indicated on the website. We didnâ€™t try to order food from room service but recommend â€œCafÃ© Sydneyâ€� restaurant at Customs House just 5 mins walk from the hotel â€“ terrific view of the Harbour Bridge with indoor and outdoor tables. Book ahead online for CafÃ© Sydney. Breakfast was pretty good with a wide range of choice (even had Miso soup for Asian tastes) and the staff there were in good numbers and quite efficient at arranging coffee, replacing popular dishes and clearing plates away. The breakfast cost $38 a head - convenient but not very good value. Free newspapers but limited range (eg no Financial Review). The official check-in time is quite late (3pm) but when we arrived at around 1230pm they were able to get us straight into a room which is always a plus. Bed was King size, firm but comfortable. In short, you can do better for the money you pay at the Marriott so check out the other hotels nearby (eg Four Seasons) and don't get your hopes up about the Opera View rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beware -check the rate!”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne35
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with the rooms, they have been refurbished well and are comfortable like most large chain groups. My warning comes to check your rate, and get them to print it off before you check in. If you have a 'quoted' rate on booking also print this before you leave home. It hardly seems necessary in the modern day of booking electronically. I don't print paper copies of any bookings normally including hotels and airline reservations however I have been caught out and wouldn't like to see others in a similar situation. I was surprised to find the rate on check out was $40per night more than the reservation and quoted rate on check in. The same receptionist checked me in and out and she became very rude when when I pointed out the discrepancy. She was rigid and kept insisting I could only change the situation if I had a PRINTED copy of the confirmed rate. I paid the higher rate....but would select a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ikromin
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for 3-4 months for 3 nights a week (business travel). The staff are rude, they never remember your name, service is just terrible. Being a silver or gold member does not get you any better service, if anything they are ruder. There are constant issues with crediting reward points. It seems like the staff that work there just do not care about their clients. In terms of food, the room service is terrible, it's like you are eating food that's been prepared days earlier. The buffet in the morning is reasonable, but they never get you your coffee on time and you always have to ask twice. The 'opera house view' rooms do not give you any decent view because there is another taller building blocking half the view, you are better off getting the bridge view room instead and saving the money. Overall, terrible hotel, this hotel has ruined the Marriott brand for me and I'm moving to another hotel chain altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: lyndajoMn
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay, within walking distance of everything, shopping the ferry, etc...Great, friendly accomodating staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: camnyc2
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for a Sydney vacation! Being so close to the quay where you get all the ferry service for various locations, and having such attentive service from the staff makes this a perfect place to stay while in Sydney! We always got great information and suggestions from the Concierge, even tickets to the current Picasso exhibit! All around great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: gnom:o)
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights attending a course held at the hotel over the weekend. Staff are friendly & helpful. Room was fine except was disappointed the bathroom only had a shower with no tub.

Reviews.Title: “"Great views of the Harbour"”
Reviews.Author: Karyn E
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Marriott. The first time we stayed, we had an Opera House view & the second time Harbour Bridge view. Awsome views. The rooms were very clean & spacious. Very comfortable king size bed, best sleep each night & so quiet. The bar lounge was great with very friendly staff & well waited on, the cocktails were good. We dined one night upstairs in the restaurant, we had the buffet meal it was lovely, plenty of selection & the seafood was so fresh.The staff all very friendly & always smiling. It was nice after dinner to relax in the spa & pool, lovely & clean. It was not far to walk to Circular Quay, lots of eating places. The staff at the reception were excellent & the concierge men very effiecient & well mannered. A short trip in a taxi or a bus to Sydney city shopping or the Queen Victoria Building, a must to see, its beautful & lovely shops, its not far to walk, a few blocks away. We will be back to stay here at the Marriott each time we stay in Sydney, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, standard Marriott rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bus_Travel_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and found the propoerty to be very good. It's a classic Marriott, but in a very good location .. walking distance from the harbor and many of the sights. The rooms were clean and everything functional, with decor that was the "Marriott standard" ... making to tough to know if you were in Sydney or Cleveland. :) I guess there's something to be said for consistent. The only strange thing we found (I was travelling with business associates) was around check in. When we arrived, there were no room available. They sent us to the concierge lounge to wait for our rooms to be ready. To our surprise, the only Platinum-level Marriott member with us was the very last to get his room. We assumed, at first, that the reson was likely because his room would be special, or upgraded, or otherwise more firring for a platinum member. WE discovered later that the room was the exact same as ours. Not sure why we would all check in at the same time, yet the frequent traveller with status was last to be accomodated. Overall, a very satisfactory business hotel. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Mix of good & bad”
Reviews.Author: easzee
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 4 days - started with a very poor reception. Was first told to wait for 2 hrs for my room (this was at 1230 in the afternoon) but finally negotiated for a room after 30 mins or so. Room was good - had a good sleep. However, simple things like international charger were missing (actually strategically placed at $10AUD for usage) which were available for 1AUD just outside the hotel. Buffet breakfast (complimentary to me) was okay - nothing great. However, must mention the staff at the restaurant were top quality - always smiling and welcoming you. The biggest surprise for me was my check-out - i was out of the hotel and called them to help pack up and check out which they did without any hickups. The lady who helped me for the check-out was one of the best receptionist in a star hotel that i have met (and obviously a stark contrast to the gentlemen i met when i came in). Overall, an average stay with hits and misses. For breakfast, suggest you have it any cafe just outside the hotel. They seem to be much popular (very economical).

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott with a View”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is typical of the high-volume properties located in The Rocks area of Sydney. Certainly not a Four Seasons calibre property, but a solid 4-star hotel. Rooms are stark and modern with minimilistic furnishings. Service is mostly up to par, but I had to call and ask why upgraded amenities were not in the room as promoted on the Executive Level floor rooms. They tried to argue with me that the upgraded amenities were not included with my room rate ,but when I showed them the website and description of the room I had booked, indeed the amenities (Bulgari) were listed - so they had to give in. Seems petty, but an annoyance that should not have taken up my time - arguing with staff about room amenities that were supposed to already be in the room. Closet was tiny - no room to hang many clothes - and the room is also small. Recently renovated so everything was fresh and new - but for the price, not a very good value. Guests here are paying for location and to be part of a whirlwind in/out hotel experience since this is not an area that is too concerned on guest service. I have found this to be true in Sydney, in general in high tourist areas. I would say stay here if you can get a good rate, but there are so many other hotels in this area (and a couple truly 5-star properties), that the Marriott should not be considered a "must" - just an option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View of the Harbour / Opera House”
Reviews.Author: Gavin W
Reviews.Content: Stayed Here for 2 nights in September for the Bryan Adams Concert at the Opera House - Paid for the upgrade to stay in a harbour view room - well worth it! Room recently refurbed, very modern look and feel to the hotel - very central in the city, easy access to all inner city attractions - good friendly service. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort in a modern city!”
Reviews.Author: Jannine-Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Having been there years ago we were curious about the renovations. I have one word to say... wow!! Modern and sleek with an excellent standard of cleanliness. We were also given complimentary wine and toiletry gift back (both of a high standard of quality). Staff very obliging and the bar in the foyer very welcoming with a great atmosphere. They still have the circa 70's gold lifts but we found that amusing! Within walking distance of the Rocks as well as downtown so we were able to explore both on foot. Our room had a view of the Opera House which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: some_honest_guy
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights in a Spa Suite on the 32nd floor and really had no complaints. It was modern, updated and clean. 2 bathrooms in 2 nice rooms with a good view of the bridge and some of the harbor. 4 minute walk to Circular Quay trains and ferries, a few minutes more to The Rocks. Free internet with a Marriott membership. Prices are astronomical in Sydney, and this room was upwards of $500/night. So if the boss is sending you down under, this would be a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: christine j
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Circular Quay in Sydney which is a beautiful spot. The Service was second to none with exceptional staff always wanting to help you in any situation. We loved our stay there and would always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: utkballa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott due to its close proximity to the Rocks and downtown area. The price could have been lower, but in Sydney expect to pay. The rooms were nice and early check in was no problem. We upgraded to a bridge view upon arrival, with a small upcharge. City noise was no issue. Location was our main priority as we did not have much time in Sydney and wanted to maximize our tourism. Easy access to train one block away and in the middle of the Opera House, Bridge, and downtown areas. Great stay, recommend highly. Full disclosure: we did not eat at the hotel, so no comments as to that or any other amenity not mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Professional”
Reviews.Author: Happytwo_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent smooth check in. Well appointed room. Extremely comfortable bed. Very quick response from the elevators. Fantastic room service (Oysters Killpatrick - The Best Ever) Abundant elevators Only the city view was average. This hotel knows how to look after it's guests. We stayed two nights but wished we could have stayed longer. Well done Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at Circular Quay, old bathroom, poor attitude at checkout”
Reviews.Author: apvac
Reviews.Content: I had an Opera view room on floor 22. The hotel has 32 floors and is triangular in shape. There are rooms with 3 categories of view in order of price: Opera, Bridge, City. I believe that the Opera view rooms are also the largest, from the floor map. The room was very new and comfortable; large 42" TV, splendid view over the harbour and the city, with the Opera and a few skyscrapers. The room was spacious, had a table, a little table, multiple chairs and armchairs, one footstool. Air conditioning was powerful and very quiet. The room (with window that can't open) was very quiet. The large king bed was comfortable. For Marriott fidelity card owners, internet was free 24h and worked very well both wired and wireless. One of the best rooms you can ask for in a 4+ star hotel. The bathroom was spacious, with both tub and shower, but it was quite old. Despite the contrast with a beautiful and modern room, the bathroom was still comfortable thanks to marble, large mirror and abundant space. But one thing is unexcusable: the shower floor. Instead of a ceramic shower plate, there is the old bathroom floor with little tiles. The floor remains very humid inside the glass contained shower, so that the floor appearance is not good, clean and healthy with mouldy grout. I arrived in Sydney from Europe and I got a flu (I was probably infected during the flight). So I extended my stay from 5 to 12 days. During my long stay everyone was very friendly and helpful: frontdesk, concierge, room service, housekeeping. They never failed; they always made it right. The breakfast buffet was very rich; there were lots of fruit and very good pastries. There also were some different flavours of yoghurt (plain, vanilla, different fruits) although no packaged ones. I was very happy with this hotel and its services. I also called the Hotel Doctor for my flu; she came quickly and was very kind. During my stay I also used the laundry service (everything worked fine, although prices are high). There is no self-parking, so the last day (when I had a rental car) I used valet parking. Just at the hotel entrance there is an AVIS office. I must say that I loved this hotel, excellent for its position and its services. I always had dinner from room service: the menu was large and varied, and there was one of the best pizzas I have ever had in a hotel. Since I got sick with flu and high fever for the first days, I had a couple of in room breakfasts. My room rate was inclusive of breakfast and it is customary for hotels to charge only a delivery fee for room service breakfast, when it is already included in the rate. The only thing that I really did not appreciate at this hotel has been finding room service breakfast charges in full. I sincerely though it was a mistake and asked at checkout whether those two charges for breakfast could be waved. I was firmly told that the rate includes breakfast in the restaurant and does not give any credit for in room breakfast. Obviously I was not happy and a modest discount was offered. I had 12 days at this hotel; since I had to extend my reservation during my stay, the rate I was offered for the last days was higher than the initial one; I used a lot of hotel services (room service, minibar, laundry, etc.) and I spent more than 5k$. I was astonished that they wanted to make me pay a breakfast that was already included in the rate, just because it was delivered to my room. It is not 60$ on 5600$ that make a difference, but this attitude of the frontdesk made me wonder whether they really value their guests' business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: imwmn913
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Nov 6-10, 2011 using our points. We were upgraded to a suite since my husband is a platinum premier elite. So my comments really cannot be addressed to a standard room. Our suite consisted of two rooms - divided by doors. Each room had its' own flat screen TV. The living area had a table/chairs and two additional lounge chairs. The bathroom had a separate tub. The stand alone shower was large and the shower head gave a good spray. Negatives about the bathroom - small counter area ... and for the female traveler it would be nice to have a wall mounted 'makeup' mirror. That being said - the room was clean, fresh, and quite nice. The bed was very comfortable. The concierge lounge - we ate breakfast and evening snacks there each day. The choices were good for each meal. They offered complimentary liquor and wine as well as juices, soft drinks and water. The lounge offered free Wi-Fi. The staff in the lounge were very pleasant remembering our names each time. They were helpful with sightseeing tips also. Negative about the lounge - it all the Marriott concierge lounges there have been complimentary computers for the guests to use. This was not the case in this lounge. We did not carry our laptop with us on this trip - so not having a complimentary computer to use in the lounge was a disappointment. The hotel does have a business center - but for pay only. The guest rooms did offer us free Wi-Fi. In either case, I was able to access the free Wi-Fi in the lounge and room but only using my iPod Touch! The front desk staff / and the Concierge were very helpful and cheerful. I did notice advertisements around the hotel describing a refurbishment of the rooms - so perhaps the earlier reviewers stayed there before the refurbishment. Location - 5 minute walk from the Circular Quay, and "The Rocks". Would we stay there again ... YES!!! I have no complaints of any real matter.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable Stay”
Reviews.Author: gghorse
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of a one night stay to make an night of it after a show. The staff from check in to check out were very courteous and efficient. All were very genuine in their desire to see that our stay was pleasurable. The room was spotless and whilst not the better side of the hotel the view was Ok and our request for not too low a floor was complied with. We enjoyed a buffet dinner which was excellent and the food was of a high standard. The buffet breakfast was also high quality and we could not fault it.We are planning another night in the City soon and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Lairoo
Reviews.Content: For the price i wouldnt stay here again thought the rooms were a little small. Breakfast was lovely and the staff excellent but found the rooms a little small and dark. In saying this the beds were comfy and clean and the location perfect for everything. Came back from dinner one night to have a drink in the foyer bar only for them to tell us they had just closed. Party of 6 people who wanted a couple of cocktails probably not the best decision they made but the hotel down the road appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT location!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCindyIL
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at this great hotel. No negatives to report at all. Beautiful rooms...I would DEFINITELY recommend upgrading to the Opera House view....SO GRAND. Nice beds, large rooms and baths...with bathtub & shower. Free internet to Marriott Rewards members...NICE! The location couldn't be better....just a block to the harbour and all the restaurants, cruises and sights....only 2 or 3 blocks to The Rocks area for the pubs and a little night life. My luggage had a loose piece (compliments of the airlines), so when the bellman delivered it to my room he noticed it and told me he could fix it for me....20 minutes later he returned with my luggage.....good as new....now that's service! I'd definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel-great location”
Reviews.Author: bjpremierontheroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights when we arrived in Sydney (our first stop in Australia) and one night when we left Australia 3 weeks later. The location is terrific. It's walking distance to the Opera House, the bridge, there Rocks area, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful; especially at the concierge desk (we really liked Alan and Wilson). You can eat there but there are lots of restaurants nearby as well and we were directed to several great ones. If you don't want to do the breakfast buffet, there are a number of bakeries and sidewalk cafes around the corner. This is not an inexpensive hotel, or an inexpensive city for that matter, but it is in line with any big city downtown hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Again, the service and location were ideal. I'm glad we were able to stay there and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It works”
Reviews.Author: Kiama1
Reviews.Content: I travel 2 hrs frequently for meetings in Sydney. I've been lucky? To stay on the companies expense at some very nice hotels in Sydney. The Marriot is consistent and not pretentious It's good

Reviews.Title: “A great family experience”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only but after experiencing this hotel we wished it was longer. The location was fantastic and within 150m from Circular Quay with its restaurants, ferries and views. Our two adjoining rooms were spotless and very recently refurbished and accommodated our family of 5. We were on the 9th floor so unfortunately only had a view of the buildings to the back of the property. This didn't deter us from enjoying the experience. The beds were extremely comfortable and the staff friendly. The breakfast should get a mention too as being excellent. This hotel experience was better than a lot of 5* hotels we have stayed in in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: svenfly2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location, right across the street from the main sights. Walk out of the hotel and turn right, after you cross the street you will see the opera house on the right and the bridge on the left. A short walk up to the rocks and there are loads of great restaurants and bars. The hotel gym is very nice, open 24 hours and has lots of equipment. The rooms are all newly renovated and upgraded, very nice to stay in. Beds are also very comfortable. Great hotel, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: deamole
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here. The hotel is two blocks from the Circular Quay Harbor and Train station. It is also just a few blocks from "The Rocks" section of town and a short walk to the Sydney Opera House. In addition to the great location the staff at this Marriott top them all when it comes to friendliness. My family thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If you can access the Executive Lounge the view of the Opera House is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: summerskye3
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic, location is great. Would we return? Most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “vacation stop”
Reviews.Author: riverviewtrvlr
Reviews.Content: This was a well kept hotel, very close to the action of Circular Quay. Perfect place to stay to check out the Sydney Harbor Opera House and the Taronga Zoo (ferry). The staff were very friendly to the kids after a gruelling flight.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: ViennaVisitor
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay here but wish it could have been for longer. We had two rooms booked and arrived early for check in. One of the rooms was ready so we were able to leave our bags in the room and explore Sydney straight away. The location is excellent, just 5 mins walk to Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge and The Rocks. Short walk down Pitt Street to downtown shopping areas. We had an Opera House view from our 30th floor rooms and it was worth paying extra for. We ate in Icons Brasserie for dinner. It was a buffet and some of the meats were luke warm at best so could definitely do with an improvement there. Breakfast in the same location was very good and service excellent. Thanks to Josh and Sarah on the Elite members front desk for their help and assistance. Very welcoming and professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views”
Reviews.Author: Nikkipie89
Reviews.Content: Great location, the rooms are clean and well presented. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel and we absolutely loved our six-day stay. Priceline usually ends up assigning us to the Marriott on Hyde Park but this time we ended up here for a very reasonable rate way below the rack rate. An easy trainride from the airport got us to Circular Quay (there are lifts),a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The main asset of this hotel, apart from its glorious location, is its fantastic staff: uniformly friendly, courteous, and keen to help. Check in/out was swift and polite. Free wifi access in the room came with free membership of Marriott Rewards -- very handy. The rooms have been recently refurbished; we were particularly impressed by the fine air quality and temperature of the room. We slept very well. Many attractions (bridge, rocks, opera house, botanical gardens) are within walking distance, and the ferries and trains from Circular Quay take you just about anywhere. We enjoyed good food at the Italian restaurant in the Public Library (housed in Customs House) and at The Sailors Thai. Negatives? The indoor pool water was perhaps a bit too cool for comfort. Would we stay again: absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, friendly staff providing great service, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Schm00py
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of the action within an easy walk to all of the major attractions, this is the hotel for you. The rooms are renovated and very well appointed. The staff is friendly and always at your service. Good services like the pool and gym. Really enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Modern - Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: dainvs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our base camp for four nights in Sydney. Its central proximity to Sydney's main sites as well as easy accessibility to Circular Quay made it easy to go just about anywhere. We booked a city view on a high floor and the high floor was definitely worth it. Our room was quite large, clean, and modern (I have read many that say sterile, but I disagree) and what you would expect from a Marriott. The bathroom was not all that large, but comfortable,but was a shower only, no bathtub. The staff was not overly friendly but did manage to arrange a room for us since we arrived on an early flight and our room was not available yet. Stay at this hotel for its location, it is great. Quick walk to the Rocks, Opera House and the CBD. There is a rental car desk right outside the hotel which is quite convenient, but it should be noted that parking at the hotel is extremely expensive (as in most areas around Sydney). Also internet is quite costly at $25 AUD / day.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: MontyQueensland
Reviews.Content: I am actually still sitting in my suite as I write this review so compelled am i to say what a disappointment this hotel is and has been. This is my third time here and I should really know by now but I am ever hopeful. This experience is the icing or the straw! I have booked three rooms for my colleagues and myself. The Marriott has recently undergone "refurbishment" and whilst I am sure some like this, I have to say it is cold, sterile, impersonal and uninviting. Rather like our welcome (or lack thereof) upon arrival. When you book online there is a lovely line about "we are already preparing for your stay". Marketing speak. Not truth. Walk your talk, train your staff, each and very one. Alfredo's Restarant in the alleyway next door is its saving grace & of course it's location in relation to Sydney's icons BUT three out of three times I have been let down by a lacklustre service team (there are always one or two exceptions) but this should be the majority, and a general air of superiority that the Marriott can rely upon its brand and not make the effort. Wrong. I am 36 years of age, run a company whose staff travel to Sydney a lot. They state similar experiences when staying here, for instance on being "served" in the restaurant for lunch, "it was like there was training going on, some were good, others didn't know what they were doing". Marriott at Circular Quay just lost my business. What a shame, but I have an inkling, they won't really care. If they do, it will be a first.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Chefjeffsd
Reviews.Content: Great location, super staff, quiet rooms. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Central advantage”
Reviews.Author: Foowashere
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in an Opera View Room. A pleasant room, marvellous bed, and a very good view on 19th level. Close to Circular Quay and the stunning Opera House. Minor gripes- shower door was faulty and we could not get ABC Classic FM radio despite it being listed. Had to ring to find out where our bags had got to...but once alerted that was fixed. As I had pre paid and had no other expenses, it would have been appreciated if we had been told on arrival that the long check out queue was an experience I could have avoided. But overall a friendly reception staff , wonderful sleep and pleasant surrounds make this a sound choice of hotel for visitors. We especially appreciated the great advice on eateries from the front of house staff member on duty. We recommend nearby Selah for a memorable lunch and Aria for a pre-performance dinner of distinction.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, a little dated, great location”
Reviews.Author: Biff3ridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. The lobby is really dated though rooms seem to have been updated and are more modern. Best feature : location. Lots of restaurants around Circular Quay and the harbour. Easy taxi rides too as it's almost centre of the city as well. If you're into running - you can cross the harbour bridge, around the opera house and through the botanical gardens. Room service pretty slow and pricey. Price overall competitive with Four Points Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KentPaul
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times primarily for the location. They are in the process of refurbing the rooms (they were during my last trip in March so they may have finished now) and they try to keep the noise disruption to a minimum - they do it when most people would be out during the day. A bit annoying when you have just landed and want to sleep a long flight off though. Location is key. 2 minutes walk from Circular Quay, 5 minutes from the Opera House, 5 minutes from the Rocks and in the CBD makes it ideal for both the business traveller and tourist alike. Some good bars and restaurants in the vicinity but better to travel a little further to get a variety. Breakfast over the road is good, variety of shops up the hill to Pitt Street Mall is only 10 minutes away. Reception staff very good and have been very helpful. Rooms OK but small. If you want a view get a high floor room overlooking the harbour - quite spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “not five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: joy9198
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights with coporate rate which is resonable in high season. However it is still expensive concerning its facility. the location is good, close to harbour. but there are few restrurants. I have to take taxi to world square to have dinner. It is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The location is value for your money”
Reviews.Author: hotelanatomist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott Circular Quay in August 2011. Great location. Short walk to Circular Quay station, buses and shops. Close to harbour Bridge and Opera House. Ideal spot for visiting Sydney CBD and hotspots. A good deli / cafe across the street for breakfast. Breakfast was included in our stay. It was quite good, a wide spread. Being a vegetarian, as always, my choices were comparatively limited. We stayed in a standard room with a King bed. Average rooms for a 5-star hotel. Small windows. Small bathroom, only a shower, no bathtub. Comfortable bed. Front desk staff were polite and efficient. Best of all, internet was free. All we needed to do was to sign up for the free Mariott Rewards Program online. A very helpful addition to the stay, considering the exorbitant rates charged by most hotels for internet, in this wired and digital age.

Reviews.Title: “This hotels caters for seniors”
Reviews.Author: Hardiman_11
Reviews.Content: We have been here twice now since they renovated and if you are an Australian senior they will give you a 15% discount on food. The Buffet at lunch which was $42,00 in june has gone up to $ 45.00 with 15% discount. The hotel is nicely situated as its close to the Quay for catching a ferry over to Manly ,the Zoo. Watsons Bay, Parramatta, Darling Harbour and buses to Bondi Beach. The Opera House is 7 mins walk the Rocks area and CBD is also close and a flat easy walk. Price wise you cant do better in Sydney for position and standard.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa11658
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Sydney Harbor at Circular Quay couldn't be located in a better spot. Near bus, train and water transit. Walking distance to everything!! Starbucks right around the corner for us Americans! Lovely rooms, spotless housekeeping and great views. (Beds could be more comfortable though - maybe its an American thing).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay right on Sydney Harbor”
Reviews.Author: kaotic363
Reviews.Content: Within 1 block walking distance to the Sydney Harbor, this hotel is perfect for sightseeing. The rooms are newly renovated and the service staff was also quite friendly. Of course, one will be expected to pay top dollar to stay in the hotel due to the location. The breakfast was on the very high end of $35 and room services was also very high as well. My recommendation would be to have your meals elsewhere to save some cash. Otherwise, I would fully recommend this hotel as being a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice renovations”
Reviews.Author: jut1702
Reviews.Content: hotel is close to everything,shops,circular quay,etc.check-in staff were very friendly and efficient.Newly renovated rooms have a modern feel,although our city side room was quite small.Our bathroom had an extra large shower,but no bath.Room was clean and bed really comfy.Extras like the ipod dock were good.Buffet breakfast was the best,coffee order took a while but worth the wait,so much food to chose from,staff were friendly and attentive.All in all a good weekend in the city,would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Trvlbug1974
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel of choice whenever I need to be in Sydney cbd and the sole reason is because of it's location. The lobby looks a bit tired during my last visit in May 2011 but they seem to be refurbishing so maybe better now. They used to provide drinking water near the reception which is a nice thought but no longer available. I got a refurbished room, smaller than the old rooms but the use of space is more functional. They have also added ipod docking which is very useful. Avis car rental has a booth just outside the lobby of the hotel, very convenient when I need a car to drive out of Syd. Hotels in Syd CBD does not provide free parking for guests but getting around in the city is no problem - reliable public transport. There is a cafe stand right outside the hotel serving good coffee. Open only in the day time till late afternoon. There's a convenience store just opposite the property, not sure if it's 24- hour but it opens till really late. Circular Quay is 2 minutes walk from the hotel - the train station & ferry terminal are there, you can see the bridge & Syd Opera House. Plenty of nice bars & restaurants along the harbour. There's also a McD (opposite the train station, next to bus stops). Captain Cook Cruise's booking counter is also there near the ferry terminals (I recommend the Dinner Cruise, the view of the Opera House from the deck of the cruise is just beautiful). Harbour Bridge (try the climb) & The Rocks is about 5 mins walk from the hotel and a must see. Plenty of restaurants & quaint shops in The Rocks. Also within walking distance, 15 - 20 mins will take you to the shopping district of Pitt St Mall & George St where you will find Myers & David Jones. Bondi Beach, Coogee Beach, Manly Beach, North Shore, Watson Bay, Darling Harbour all a short train or bus or ferry ride from Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: carolina456
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing and shopping. When you book you can choose your view. Nice pool and good restaurant. Valet's were excellent and provided good advice.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by Marriot”
Reviews.Author: MelV1973
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms were very comfortable - great bed. Room service was prompt. Very helpful and kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great business and day trip hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTVR
Reviews.Content: Finally!! An international hotel chain in Sydney with ambiance and service. Stay in the Marriott recently over night whilst on business and, I can tell you this is up there with the best hotels in Sydney CBD. Well appointed recently refurbished rooms with great amenities. The beds are fantastic and comfortable. Location is 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay station in the heart of the CBD. If you like to use the gym you will be blown away by the options at the Marriott. Full service gym with all the equipment you need and more. Shame about the limited pool, which although inviting doesn't have a lap pool option. Room service, standard fare although hot and fairly quick. I have also stayed in the following Sydney hotels; Four Seasons, Holiday Inn at the Rocks, Medina, Kirketon, Rydges, Hilton, Sebel and the Sheraton and this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Swift2097
Reviews.Content: Another very good Marriott hotel. Being a Platinum member I had a suite. Stayed for a night but was very comfortable. An office to work, separate bed room, luxurious bath room with a jacuzzi. Will stay here again. Convenience store near by

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: perth_oz888
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel on business. Undoubtedly, the location is fantastic. It is a short walk to the Opera House, Harbour bridge and the historic Rocks area. The Circular Quay train station (easy airport train transfer) and ferry terminal (for Manly beach) are also closeby. The hotel has been recently refurbished and has comfortable beds. The toilets are modern but housekeeping was a major disappointment. The bath was not cleaned thoroughly and I found hair in the bath and used cleaning glove on the bathroom floor when I first entered the room. The reception staff was apologetic and promptly moved me. Breakfast was ok and proper coffees can be ordered (although it often takes awhile). Ok to stay in if the price is right and you are not expecting 5 star accommodation like the Westin or Shangrila.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: HonestAndFair11
Reviews.Content: My husband is a platinum member of the Marriott which means we get an automatic upgrade and access to the club lounge and floor. From the moment we entered, the staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The rooms have recently been refurbished so they look wonderful. The club lounge is stunning and has great views of Opera house. The canapes were exceptional and plentiful. We will definitely stay there again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place after traveling for 15 hours!”
Reviews.Author: kfheller
Reviews.Content: We had just gotten off a plane after traveling for 15 hours and were desperate to check into a room. We were ecstatic when we were told that our room was available to check into at 10:30am! Room was small but clean and modern. It had a great view of the opera house, which seemed like an appropriate start to our Australian adventure! The hotel is also in walking distance some of the main attractions. Breakfast was included in our price, which was also very good. If there was anything negative about our stay, the indoor pool was freezing cold and the hot-tub was being filled and non-functional during our stay. All in all, it is not the most amazing hotel that we've every stayed at. But the service was excellent, staff was quite friendly, and I would really recommend this place if you are just getting started in Australia and need the basics for a few days while you're jet-lagged.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: AlbusD
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Sydney in September with this hotel. Facilities and level of service is what you would expect from a Marriott property in Asia Pacific. Location is the main draw since it is less than 100m from the Circular Quay where you could get to visit the main tourist attractions and other places of interest. It is a short 15min walk to the main shopping area in Sydney. The size of the room was not large but comfortable and rather modern after the refurbishment. The only complaint i have is the lack of storage space for clothes and things. Prices at the only resturant is pretty steep. Breakfast was A$35 and we would not have taken it if not for the fact that it is included in the daily room rate. They do have a great dinner deal on Sunday evenings where you can have a steak and a glass of wine for A$29. All in all, it is a good hotel in a great location! i probably will return since it is a short taxi ride to my office.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for visiting Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Martinkingsci
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Marriot hotel: big, slick, comfortable, proffesional and smart that has benefitted from a recent makeover / upgrade to the rooms. E.g iPod dock, big flat screen tv, new leather furniture, great beds etc. Not cheap but no need to travel to get to the sights. My wife and I have stayed here twice (so we must have liked it the first time) as a stopover sightseeing break while travelling between Australia and the UK. It is an ideal base for a sightseeing trip because it is just a few minutes stroll to Circular Quay, for ferries and harbor trips, The Rocks (tourist bars and market stalls, The Botanic Gardens and the iconic Sydney Harbor Bridge. Go for a pre-paid breakfast deal, stoke up the calories for the day, go for your sightseeing trip and stroll back to the hotel to collapse. Ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: pftambur
Reviews.Content: I will admit up front that I am a top tier Marriott Rewards Program member who paid for 5 nights and used points for two additional nights for this family vacation. This was also my first visit to this property. So, with those qualifiers, this was a great property in a perfect location of the city with very clean and comfortable newly refurbished rooms. I drew a room on the 28th floor overlooking both the Sydney Opera House and Harbor. Because of my Elite Marriott status, I was given access to The Executive Lounge, which served a full breakfast in the morning and snacks, cocktails and desserts in the evening. The entire Executive Lounge staff provided an excellent level of service, including tips on the city that would match what your energy level was on a given day. As for location, this hotel is one block from the Ferry, Train and Bus terminal at Circular Quay (15 minute train ride in from the airport at 1/3 the cost of a taxi). It is also 1 1/2 blocks from the main Ocean Cruise Ship Terminal, 4 blocks from the Opera House and 2 blocks from the Rocks. I rate Sydney in the same category for expensive hotels and meals as I would San Francisco, New York City or London. So, be prepared for a wonderful, but expensive vacation. Almost forgot that if you are any level of member in the Marriott Rewards Program, you receive free Wireless Internet in your room during your stay! The only down side we found were the hotel elevators. Besides some long waits, the elevators would at times blank out all floors when you were riding up and take you back to the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niels_Maaike_NL
Reviews.Content: Over a period of 3 weeks, I stayed a couple of times at this hotel for business. The hotel is just like any other marriot I have been: great service, good size room, clean etc. The location is great, especially after a long day in the office you are very close to some amazing sites in Sydney (i.e. opera house / harbor bridge) and very close to the ferries that can take you to some nice beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished and sparkling. Ideal location to Opera House”
Reviews.Author: WollongongSheila
Reviews.Content: The Wotif rate of $250 for a city view room was good value. The room on the 22nd floor had a view out to the mountains over the city and although is inferior to a harbour view represented a good deal. Within walking distance of the Opera House, Rocks and Circular Quay Station even with sore feet. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. Unfortunately no alternative to the doona which are always too hot for Australian conditions. Why don't hotels have a spare lightweight blanket. It is either a sheet and turn the aircon up or doona and turn the aircon down. Not environmentally friendly at all. Staff were friendly, efficient and obliging. Make the most of the makeover!

Reviews.Title: “good overall”
Reviews.Author: purcitron
Reviews.Content: pros: location & location, clean, good view, down pillows & blankets cons: small room (2 queens, too hundrd dollrz), bathroom was sub-par (poor sound insulation from rest of suite, noises from faucet & drain on floor, tiny shelf inside shower, not much storage in room (shelves, drawers, etc) other: free, but complicated internet use

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION! GREAT VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: lisa2011ny
Reviews.Content: Stay here for the view and stay here for the location. My family and I arrived in Sydney at 8:00am and were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready. We had a wonderful view of the Opera House. The hotel is located on Pitt St just a 10 minute walk to all the great shopping and a 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour. You are steps away from Circular Quay and the ferries. The Opera House and the Harbour Bridge are 5 minutes on foot. The room was modern, clean and comfortable. We used the pool, sauna and gym and were very pleased. The price was very reasonable and if you are travelling with children, you will appreciate a room with 2 double beds. It saves you from having to book 2 rooms, as is sometimes necessary when travelling outside the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Atcretired
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Sydney, close to the harbor, shopping, and resturants with great views of the opera house. A bit pricey, but all of Australia is pricey because of the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: carolw060
Reviews.Content: Great location for a weekend in Sydney. Chose a king room with a view of the Opera House. View was spectacular. Ate in house on the Friday night and enjoyed the all you can eat seafood buffet. The staff were attentive but not instrusive and their advice helpful. We visited the Powerhouse Musuem and saw a show at Star City took a walk to the Opera House after dinner. Found a quaint old pub in Pitt St for afternoon drinks.All things we never usually do in our own city but becasue of where the hotel was located it made for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jw2626
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is about standard for most big city Marriotts as far as quality and amenities although it was disappointing you had to pay to use the internet. The Executive lounge made up for it for those lucky enough to get access! A great benefit. The best part of this Marriott is the location. It is within 5 mins of the ferry terminal, the bus stops, the train/subway station - all of which will get you everywhere you want to go. Very close to the Opera House. And for the money relative to other nearby hotels the price was reasonable esp. if you get access the the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for visiting Sydney”
Reviews.Author: gebell
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay at this hotel while passing through Sydney. It is located a couple of blocks from the harbour and an easy walk to the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. There are many restraunts and sites to see surrounding the hotel, and no need for a car to enjoy the immediate area. The concierge and staff are very helpful in assisting with arrangements should you like to arrange for a tour or get transportation for regional activities. This is my first choice of places to stay should I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: tennismomof3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop upon arriving in Sydney. We had booked two rooms, one of which was ready, so they allowed an early check-in. The rooms themselves were acceptable; it was obvious that they were used frequently, but they were very clean. The beds were soft by our standards, but otherwise comfortable. Our rate included breakfast and we found it to be a nice buffet typical of hotels at this level. We appreciated the friendliness of the morning staff. We ate one dinner at the hotel, the Sunday night steak dinner, and found it to be a good choice after a day at the Blue Mountains. The concierge was also helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. The location was so close to the Harbour which made for easy sightseeing. With only 3 days to visit the Sydney area, location was a prime consideration when booking. We walked from the Rocks to the Botanical Garden, took a ferry out to Manly, and enjoyed one of the "free" walking tours that started by the commerce building. We really enjoyed our time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MelbPk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Walking distance to Circular Quay, Opera House, The Rocks. It is very convenient to the first stop of Sydney Explorer bus and easy access a to the train station to catch train to the airport. We were fortunate to have a room with window facing the Opera House - must have taken enough photos of the Opera House to last a decade :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully renovated rooms but underwhelming in service”
Reviews.Author: lucidlilies
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the rooms recently renovated which is great since it looks more modern and clean. I had city views which was actually very nice - one side of the room was almost all window so the view of the skyline was pretty spectacular (even without the bridge and the opera house) although I was pretty high up (in the 40's floor). One thing to note about the renovation is that the flat screen TV is HUGE. I mean seriously huge - a bit ridiculous considering I didn't use it much. The money saved on getting a slightly smaller TV could have been put into the bed. A bit stiff and lumpy for my liking and at the price they charged, they should seriously consider putting in a big fluffy feather bed topper like they do at the Sofitel. The bathroom was a bit awkward in how it was laid out but it might have just been my room. The shower was behind the door which was a bit weird as I almost missed seeing it and at first glance I thought I only had a bathtub option. The shower is pretty small and I'm not a huge person by any means. A rugby player would find it uncomfortable but since I'm pretty tiny in height and size it was ok. As others have said before, sign up for the Marriott rewards which can be done online before getting to the hotel. I think you can even do it when checking in. By having a rewards account (it's free!) you get free internet during your stay. This really is a cost savings since the price of hotel internet access in Australia is highway robbery. If you are there on business and you need to do some printing, you can do print jobs at their business centre. The first 20 printed pages are free (no double sided printing of course). What the hotel made up in the renovations, it lacked in service and charm. Don't get me wrong, there were a few lovely people who worked there and were very helpful (especially the evening concierge). But a few bad experiences ruined the bunch. First the morning concierge was completely rude. If there is a queue, it is common sense to acknowledge the people in line, to say "I'll be right with you". People are more inclined to wait patiently. But the concierge did not acknowledge me and after standing there for 10 minutes I asked for a map so I can work out directions myself. He threw the map at me without a word. Thanks for the attitude mate. To round out the experience, I wasn't told (nor was it on my reservations) that my rate included the buffet breakfast upon check-in. I didn't know until I got the receipt shoved under my door the night before check-out and saw that the rate said "including breakfast". You would have thought that the person checking you in would tell you this. It's in your best interest to ask upon check-in so you don't needlessly pay for an extra meal. Would I stay here again? Yes, I would give it a try again. The rooms were spacious, clean and modern and the location is great. The location is close to the touristy sites since it's across the street from Circular Quay. Very easy to walk to Pitt Street Mall and the shops. Across the street from the train station which is convenient if you are a tourist looking to get on the city loop. But I had to knock down a star for the service - hopefully the next visit will be better!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: AussieBlazers
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this hotel and others in Sydney. Without doubt this is my favorite due to it's great location and service. The concierge lounge is one of the better Marriott lounges and always seems to be staffed by very capable and helpful staff. The only downside is that the elevators are incredibly slow. During the morning peak I have waited almost 10 minutes to get Dow. To the lobby (yes I timed it!)

Reviews.Title: “It's an ok hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: howard_and_bec
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference with 12 colleagues, and was hoping for an early check in. That didn't happen and my rom was eventually around 3pm. The beds are comfortable. I was on the 12th floor, so no view to speak of. I had 2 gripes: 1. I called room service on the 17th august and it took about 45 mins to get a response. All I was after was some cheese and i was told that room service had just closed, and that they only had the night menu available. Anyway if they had answered then phone when I first called, then room service normal menu would have been still operating??... They eventually delivered some cheese, but no crackers. .?, couldn't be bothered calling back to request more. 2. The shower leaks water and I almost flooded the lounge area. 3. Very average mini bar, cheap Chinese peanuts, terrible cheap mini bottles of local wine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jqin
Reviews.Content: We got a winter promotion deal of $199 per night and stayed at Marriott for 4 nights in mid August. The location is perfect, 2~3 min walk to ferries, buses (including free tourist shuttles), and trains (including CityRail to airport) and a few min walk to the Opera House, the Rock, Sydney Harbour Bridge (next to the Rock), and Royal Botanic Garden. We were also able to walk to Darling Harbour (15 min) and Chinatown (< 30 min). The room is modern and clean. Beds are comfortable. Service is great too. They mistakenly charged us for a bottle of water from the mini bar (We bought our own food and water and stored them in the mini fridge which might have caused some confusion) but have gladly removed the charge. Marriott Rewards members (free membership) also get free wifi. We are a family of four (kids aged 15 and 12) and were not able to book a single room in a lot of hotels. But we didnt have any problem with Marriott. This hotel is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Service, Perfect location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: SundysWT
Reviews.Content: My famiy was 3 weeks into a 7 week around the world Trip. We just had Spent 2 hard driving weeks in New Zealand and took a week in Sydney to recharge. Our experience at the Marriott was phenominal. It is a great hotel in a great location with all the ammenities you would expect. However the game changer here was the wonderful staff. Sally Glen, a sweet Charming lass for Scottland and Jimmy Hofilena from the US were two of the best people we met on our trip. We met both on the wonderful concierge floor of the hotel. It overlooks Sydney opera house and the Bridge and is wonderful. Sally and Jimmy were both incredibly friendly and made us feel so much at home. Jimmy went above and beyond by bringing american flags for our 17 and 18 year old kids on the 4th of July. Sally and Sally both led the hotel in personal service. Rodi was also great and is a credit to Marriott. We stayed at a lof of hotels in our life but it will take a long time to top the wonderful service we recieved at the Marriot. Great timefor all. Thanks Sally, Jimmy and Rodi. The Sundermeiers

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sydney Harbour Marriott”
Reviews.Author: CITravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Sydney Harbour Marriott on a special rate for Marriott rewards members. As before, service was great. We did not eat at its restaurant at all because right beside the hotel is a good breakfast cafe. Additionally, there are many restaurants in Circular Quay as well as other parts of the city to choose from. Although we did not book an "Opera view" or a "bridge view" room, our city view was O.K. The only thing I wasn't comfortable with was there was hardly any storage space and no bathtub. I don't consider this a negative, though, since the room seemed newly-renovated and more "modern" than it was the last time I was here. One negative for me, however, was that the pay phone in the lobby wasn't working (there used to be 2 phones before). When I informed the front desk I was told that they had called the service provider several times, but they never came out to fix it. But this is no big deal because when you walk out of the hotel, there are 2 pay phones on the sidewalk - you just have to deal with the traffic noise. Lastly, if you are a Marriott Rewards member, wi-fi is free. Overall, I'm quite satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location...outstanding Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: maestromuffin
Reviews.Content: the title says it all - one block from circular quay! GREAT beds and pillows - and the concierge recommended us to a lovely restaurant just steps from the hotel. got the room on priceline - and it was still expensive - but worth it. by the way - for Americans...Australia is expensive!!! but if you know before hand, you can plan accordingly! 4 dollars for a coke at 7-11!!! also - go in winter(their winter) we were there at the end of july, and again in august - and the weather was 72 degrees during the day, and 62 at night...beautiful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruise departures”
Reviews.Author: 2Astor
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is in a great location. We were upgraded to a view of the Opera House and were able to view "our ship coming in," a Royal Caribbean cruise. It was a short walk to board the ship. The indoor pool and hot tub were great. "Magic" who runs the gift shop was very helpful and friendly, offering us a 20% discount. It's an easy walk to the Botanic Gardens, the Rock area , and the ferry terminal to the Sydney zoo. For concierge members, the breakfasts and dinners were wonderful, including drinks and dessert in the evening. We used Marriott points for our stay and since it went so well, we later booked our children a room here. Their experience was great too :) We did have 1 negative experience here. Upon arrival in a taxi, a few bellmen unloaded the taxi overlooking my husband's briefcase. Luckily he realized it before the taxi departed. So...always double check the trunk!!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Theresafromnorway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days last summer on the first leg of a month-long tour of Australia and New Zealand. Arrived at 8.30am and didn't expect to be allowed to check in, but my room was ready so they said that was fine. I was dying for a shower, had travelled for 36 hours from Norway and was also exhausted. I had booked a room with city view but took a chance and asked if they had any rooms with a view of theOpera House. That demanded an upgrade, an extra $40 a night but I reckoned it was worth it. I wasn't disappointed!! The view was AMAZING!! Couldn't quite see Harbour Bridge but hey, you can't have everything! The room was spacious, light and airy, soft tones, well-maintained, nice big spotlessly clean bathroom with all amenities, plenty of cable tv channels, and the bed was heavenly - quite literally the best night's sleep I had had in ages!! And of course, I saw the Opera House and that was a real treat. I showered and went diwnto breakfast - what an amazing array of hot and cold dishes, cereals, pastries, made-to-order omelettes and great eespresso coffee! Service was impeccable. As the days went by the waiting staff started to recognise me and would take the time to chat and ask me how my stay was going. Got loads of insider tips on places to see, things to do, and places to eat. The hotel is 2mins walk from the CBD, 5mins to the Opera House, 5mins in the other direction to The Rocks where the outdoor market is on Saturdays and where there are restaurants galore. In other words, you have everything on your door step. I LOVED Sydney andthe Marriott hitel - can't wait to visit them both again soon.

Reviews.Title: “nice place nice location”
Reviews.Author: HepburnSpringsTed
Reviews.Content: alot of good cafes and restaraunts close by playfair & fine food store good breakfast and coffee ,good coffee surprisingly hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on numerous occasions for business trips. I really enjoy the proximity to the train station - 10 min walk, the ferry - 5 min walk, gads of restaurants, and running in the botanical gardens and opera house area - 10 min walk. The hotel itself the rooms are very clean and nice, the staff is very helpful and friendly. I stay in a lot of the marriotts so use the lounge frequently and the staff there is awesome. this is a nice central location to explore sydney and all the usual tour groups make stops here for pickups. Always felt that it was a little pricey at this hotel, but upon checking others in the area and at this star level, felt that the value was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: likecomfy
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location, walking to the Rocks, Sydney Harbour, Opera House, Ferries, Restaurants. The staff were super-helpful, and nice. This hotel has an early arrival lounge offering coffee, tea, cookies, internet or even a shower if we wanted until our room was ready ( we arrived at 7:30am on an international flight, and used this area for a little while till we had energy to go out and sightsee). The room was clean, quiet and comfortable, the bed was heaven! They have a hair dryer in the room and the usual little travel toiletries. There is a hot water pot with complimentary coffee and tea. Our rate included breakfast which we looked forward to every morning- It was amazing, so many options and delicious.I didn't use the gym but my family tells me it was nice and had a dry sauna and pool.There is an Avis rental desk in the lobby. I was actually sad to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Lozza36
Reviews.Content: This was my second time I have stayed in this hotel. last time was back in Sept 09. The room then was very dated and old. I must say on this visit the room was very nice and clean. Looks like it has had a makeover. I would reccommend. Close to Circular Quay. little walk to Pitt street mall but close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, old public areas”
Reviews.Author: KKSurrey
Reviews.Content: The Marriott (previous life The Renaissance) has changed little on the outside. The foyer and meeting rooms are dated, but walk in to the rooms, and the have had a great make over. Beds are extremely comfortable and this is one of the few hotels that I have been in recently that has true "digital" television reception. Breakfast was typical buffet style, nothing exceptional but more than adequate. Location is great if you need a position close to The Rocks and Circular Quay. Enjoyed my stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: BigBlack
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: 15-17 June 2011 Nights: 2 Room type: Opera View Level 23 Price: AU$319/night Location: Great location close to Harbour, Opera Hose and transport Check-in: Easy and fast Internet: Medium speed and free if you sign up to Marriot Rewards Bed: good, I slept well Storage: limited, enough for one person Bathroom: good, clean Shower: Good, great pressure and big enough View: city buildings and Opera Hose Air Con: good and quiet TV: 42" didn't use Coffee/Tea: Yes, but didn't use Room Service: Fast and correct, not very hot Food: only had room service, standard hotel fare Mini Bar: Yes, standard Noise: I had a room that was right next to the lifts, but had no noise problems Cleaniness: Clean Staff: Friendly Comments: Refurbished room that looked great. Bathroom only 90% refurbished, but everything worked and I had good sleeps. I found the lifts to be very slow, had to wait 5 minutes a couple of times during my short stay. I would stay again if required.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: stay1301
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three days for business and absolutely loved it! The buffet breakfast provided tasteful food and the location is excellent! The staff are first class and the beds were so comfortable, I had trouble waking up & getting out of bed! A definite thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kram13_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms have been refurbished and are looking very fresh, they also have 42inch tv's. The location is within minutes walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House

Reviews.Title: “Great location, could do better”
Reviews.Author: sweetiedarling1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times over the years as the location is a 30 second walk to just about the best harbour in the world. There has been some redecoration to the rooms. We got a twin which meant that there was no space for any chairs except one little perch. The colour palette is neutral which is basically a bit underwhelming; as are the toiletries. We found it very hot under feather bedspreads and set the aircon accordingly. Apparently, we didnâ€™t set it well enough as it snuck back up and made us sleep badly being over heated. We paid 250 AUD booking directly on thier website, which is pretty expensive I think, but that included the buffet breakfast. Parking is an extra $45! Check-in was very fast and polite but they resisted all attempts to give an upgrade to a room with a harbour view without wanting something like another $30-50. As it was we got as view of the harbour bridge that was OK. As we were short of time and it was convenient to do so, we had the buffet dinner with a couple of glasses of wine for around $145 all up. All in all, itâ€™s Ok, but do they donâ€™t seem to recognise or â€˜rewardâ€™ years of membership to the Marriott Club.

Reviews.Title: “Annual pilgrimage for Easter”
Reviews.Author: paul_and_family
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbor every Easter for 4 years running so we can provide a little longitudinal perspective about this hotel. Part of its attraction is the excellent location, next to Circular Quay for all tour transport needs (including a train to the Easter Show) as well as the ideal opportunity to include the Opera House and Botanical Gradens on your morning walk/jog. I definitely recommend upgrading to the Executive lounge - free cooked breakfast available for the whole family every morning, and lovely drinks and hor douvres in the evening. Our family with 2 kids aged 10 and 7 also really enjoyed the heated pool on the cool evenings always finishing off with a hot jacuzzi soak on their well-equipped gym floor. One change we did notice this year was a much lower profile of their buffet restaurant - it was closed for lunch on some days of the Easter weekend. Also, the annual Esater egg hunt at the restaurant which my kids had been involved in over several years was not scheduled this year, much to their disappointment. Staff can be a little officious at the front counter, lacking the smiles you see at other properties, but the other hotel staff make up for this. Housekeeping is very efficient and reliable. We are likely to continue oue Easter pilgrimages here, but some improvements in the areas I have highlighted in this much-loved property might not go astray...

Reviews.Title: “Let Down By The Simple Things”
Reviews.Author: Sooziq77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Opera View suite over the weekend 8th til 10th July 2011. Staff are the saviour of this otherwise average accomodation. You need to remember that this is a 5 star hotel, so for 500+ a night I would expect the detail that this type of rating demands. The valets were excellent & very effecient. The checkin staff, whilst happy enough, were let down by the fact that they found it difficult to follow up on requests made of them. Not returning booking confirmations, expecting us to chase them for room menus after repeated requests. Even having an extensive cocktail menu, but not being able to make a lot of them because they did not have the ingredients over 2 nights [Friday & Saturday??]. Not what I would expect if I am paying a premuim to stay there. Rooms are newly renovated & clean, but the mini bar & room amenities are not up to scratch for the price. Would I go back? With the proximity of other well know 5 star hotels within 500m for the same price, probably not. If you've already booked here, don't panic, its not too bad I suppose..... :/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ruthmarti
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 3 nights. The location is excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the morning and were given access to the early arrivals lounge. I would recommend getting a rate that includes breakfast - the breakfast buffet was incredible! The walk to Circular Quay was about 2 minutes. My only complaint is that we were quoted a rate for 4 with breakfast. We made it clear we were traveling with our son and his girlfriend. They ended up charging us for 2 breakfasts since our "kids" were not under 12.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Roadgeeks
Reviews.Content: Stayed several nights service was excellent and the room had all the amenities needed for folks on long trips: iron and board, clothes lines in shower, etc Brunch not cheap but very good way if you're hungry. Location is fantastic very close to Sydney Harbor and all the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, refurbed rooms and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Adz2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and was accommodated in one of the hotels suites on the 32nd floor. I have to say that this is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in. The service offering from their staff was excellent, all of them were respectful, helpful, happy and always asked if there was anything else they could assist with. The room was excellent, with a large king bed in the bedroom and ample room to move in the lounge room with a great view of the harbour bridge. The bed was to die for - absolutely fantastic and the bathroom one of the biggest I have encountered in hotels in Australia!! Room Service food was really good and reasonably priced and they have a huge selection of items for both breakfast and all day dining, with a typical limited selection for late or overnight meals. The hotel is very well positioned, right near the Quay and within walking distance of the CBD, public transport and nightlife! If you are a Marriott Rewards member - you get free internet - even if you sign up on check-in!! Overall, as my first stay at this property - I was extremely happy and would recommend to all! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hoofie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel prior to a trip to the US. The room was fantastic and the staff wonderful. The Hotel facilities were very good although as usual in a hotel like this the prices of the mini-bar and room service would make your eyes water. The concierge and bell services were very good; I used them to book a limo in advance from the airport and they could not have helped more. The only downside is the view; there is a another building in front of it so some of the views could be limited. Location wise though, it is great for Circular Quay and the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the whole experience”
Reviews.Author: alanv4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 and as on previous occasions this is a very good hotel. Having Gold status meant an upgrade to the executive floor and use of the executive lounge. The staff in the lounge are very attentive and go out of their way to provide a great experience. The comments about the size of the lounge by others is endorsed, however if you arrive at the peak time, our experience is that many executive lounges in the hotel chains have difficulty accommodating everyone - this hotel is not much different in that regard. Breakfast was good and the room was (in Marriott style) wonderful. Another nice touch was the early checkin - very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Amazing food & beautifully presented rooms”
Reviews.Author: vjay77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference so I'm not sure what the rates were. But the service was exceptional. The rooms were comfortable & very well presented. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best conceirge lounge ever”
Reviews.Author: dawnaross
Reviews.Content: This excellent location, divine staff, wonderful views and incredible fully equiped concierge lounge make this one of the best Marriott hotels we have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: CJMC
Reviews.Content: Was accompanying my husband on a business trip. we stayed on the 26th floor in a bridge view executive room. Room facilities were all the usual, kettle, ironing board, desk and a wonderfully comfortable kingsize bed. The bathroom was all new and great, however I disliked the bathroom very much. There was no bath and although the room itself was all new and lovely the shower door was only half way across the shower area and therefore water got all over the bathroom during your shower which made the room slippy and dangerous. The room service was prompt, pipping hot and delicious. The concierge was a great help booking day trips/harbour bridge climbs and arranging local dinner reservations (we went to cut in the rocks). Our flight back to India was late in the day so I did ask for a late check out which they arranged for 2pm at no extra cost, a nice touch I thought. The location was fantastic for sightseeing and for evening strolls along the harbour side. I would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Quiet nice and a stone's throw from Circular Quay/the sights”
Reviews.Author: Osdanuwati
Reviews.Content: Saw no remodeling during my stay. The lobby is quite nice, the rooms are great and very modern and all was as good as one could hope. Great location, right around the corner from Circular Quay/the Rocks and with them, the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. All the ferries, tons of restaurants, the theater district and gobs of shopping are all within a short stroll.
