Reviews.Title: “Service lacking and $14.95 for chips and water.”
Reviews.Author: chris82kelly
Reviews.Content: After our flights to NZ were cancelled due to ashcloud on my girlfriend's 30th birthday, I jumped online and booked a mystery 5 star hotel to ensure she still enjoyed her birthday. After the dissapointment of our cancelled holiday plans, I expected to be treated with exceptional service with a 5 star hotel. Upon arrival, the bell boy dissappeared and we had to get our own bags out. At check-in, we were told we should have printed the booking confirmation (made 45min earlier from the international airport on my laptop) and the booking was not showing up in the system. The only room available did not have a king bed and we were offered a "gesture of good will"...be upgraded to the top suite worth $800...if we paid another $100. We did not accept and were then provided with a room with a king bed. The room was nothing special, small and not immaculately cleaned. The following day we ordered a serve of chips and some water in the foyer which cost $14.95. Hardly worth it for a small bowl of chips and water. For a 5 star hotel, I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Top class!”
Reviews.Author: Davidsons22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly located and is of a very high quality. Our family of 4 had booked a single room with double double bedding. Including a full breakfast buffet in your package is especially good value. When the type of room booked was unavailable on the day of our arrival, hotel management had no hesitation in upgrading us to a wonderful suite for the same price. We loved it and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsPirateLord
Reviews.Content: At first we were a little unsure about our choice to stay at this hotel, but it turned out to be a great choice. There are four of us in my family and this was one of the very very few hotels in Sydney that didn't have a problem with all four of us sharing a room. When we arrived we found out that the hotel was undergoing renovation. As a Marriott Gold member, I have access to the executive lounge. Unfortunately, the executive lounge is located in the part of the hotel that was undergoing renovation. They told us that we could have access to the area near the restaurant on the 2nd floor where we could get free drinks. The staff on the 2nd floor were fantastic! We sat down to have drinks and were immediately offered drinks. We asked if they had any fruit and one of the staff members ran off to go find us some apples and oranges, which I don't think was a very easy task. A really sweet woman named Josephine brought us drinks and couldn't do enough to make our stay enjoyable. She asked us about our stay, brought us snacks and drinks even during non- happy hour times. Another one of the staff members, a nice woman named Rosalee told us they were offering complimentary buffet dinners at the restaurant for Marriott Gold Members. Luckily, two of us hadn't eaten dinner yet and we received two completely free $45 buffet dinners! None of the staff members seemed to have a problem bring all four of us drinks and snacks, despite the fact that I am the only one who is a Marriott Gold Member, and only really supposed to bring in one guest. The executive lounge staff and ambiance was one of the many highlights of our stay at this hotel. Additionally, the location was marvelous! You couldn't ask for a hotel with a better location. It's within walking distance of everything! The opera house, restaurants, gift shops, the harbour... Despite the fact that it was raining our entire stay, the walks were enjoyable, and the location was very busy and nice. The concierge was extremely helpful as well. They went way out of their way to give us maps, brochures, and discount coupons to help us find things to do during our very rainy stay. They took their time giving us very detailed answers and clearly mapped out everything for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the staff...”
Reviews.Author: BubblesOO
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our recent stay here. After waiting a while to check-in I was not greeted pleasantly & no apology for the extended delay. The gentlemen then advised me that he could not find my booking even though I had booked direct with the Marriott. A room was found & we were also offered a more expensive room for an extra $100. I declined the more expensive room & we went up to our room. My sister suggested we have a look at the other room to see if it was worth paying the extra $100 so I called reception and they said they would get back to me in a few minutes...no call after 1hr so we gave up on the idea & went out. Our room was comfortable but could have been a bit warmer - we didn't seem to be able to adjust the temperature. We had a nice breakfast in the hotel the next morning where staff were very pleasant. Unfortunately we returned to find our room door fully open, linen removed from the beds & it appeared the bathroom was in the process of being cleaned but no staff in sight. A few minutes later housekeeping returned & asked if she should come back...we were too concerned for our belongings to say anything other than yes. We still had 1hr before check-out time! Fortunately nothing appeared to be missing. The hotel is in a good location & would have been a pleasant stay if staff had treated us properly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: hannahadelaide
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, very modern and comfortable furnishings and a very nice view, will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience was turned into a great one”
Reviews.Author: ahm3itravel
Reviews.Content: i was still breastfeeding while this trip was confirmed. so i brought along the breastpump and i expressed the breastmilk and kept them in the freezer in the room. after 2 days, i requested to change room and have left a memo to them to transfer the milk to the new room (as there was no room available while i was in the room and they promised to do it for me while i went to work). When I was back from work, the room was changed, my suitcases were transferred but my breastmilk bags with breastmilk were all lost. I checked with them and only to find out that they have forgotten to pass the message. I was truly freaked out as breastmilk was so important for my baby at home. The manager incharged was truly sorry and she asked if anything she could do to mend this. I said, I didnt bring enough breastmilk bags and i needed more. She went around searching for it (imagine a single young lady who is not married). When i came back from work another day later, she came to apologize again, gave me the breastmilk bags, and a toy for my baby!! Since then my stay there was exceptionally excellent!! They really made my stay a great great one!! Excellent & professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service, excellent views”
Reviews.Author: toastytravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here int he end of April, 2011 and had a very good experience. I was using Marriott points for my stay so I can't comment on the price of the room, but they offered me an upgrade to an "Opera House view" room at check-in for only $50 per night and it was definitely worth falling asleep and waking up to the opera house view in the middle of my window. The location is fantastic! I can't imagine a better spot to have home base. The front desk staff were helpful and the guy who works in the gift shop was surprisingly friendly, remembering me from having wandered in one day and saying "hi" to me every time I walked past. Most everyone at the concierge desk were helpful and generous with their time; Jonathan especially went above and beyond to help out. Truly, some of the best concierge service I have had. I had a few problems with the heat/air conditioning unit as I was cold at night and couldn't get the heat to really kick on consistently. Maintenance came twice but it never seemed to be fully working the way I would have hoped, but they did try to fix it. I am sure they would have let me change rooms if I had asked but I let it slide. The breakfast buffet was a little overpriced, but such is the case with restaurant breakfast buffets, so you should be expecting that going in. The hot tub in the pool area was either not really working fully or someone had altered the settings because there was almost no jet action to be found and the water was tepid, at best. This wasn't a huge issue for me, but I do expect a better hot tub from Marriott. There was some wild remote-control type device so I assumed that someone messed it up with the keypad rather than it being a permanent issue, but I don't know. As expected, wireless access is fee-based and was not the cheapest out there at .50 AUD a minute. Australia was expensive on all counts, though. I usually went to McDonald's nearby for free internet if I needed a long session. All in all, no really significant complaints and helpful staff with Marriott-level service made this a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Awesome! Great Great Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: BellamyD
Reviews.Content: Very attentive to all your needs and helpful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms, fabulous gym and great location”
Reviews.Author: brisbane21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference recently, and based on some recent indifferent reviews on tripadvisor was pleasantly surprised. I had two separate bookings (two nights in one room and another in a better room), and on request they upgraded me so I didn't have to check in and out during my stay (first tick). Beds were super comfy and the furnishings smart and modern. Views from the Harbour rooms are also great. The gym is the best in a hotel I've seen, and has multiple cardio machines (including rowers), free weights, barbells and benches. There is also a large pool with spa which I didn't try. The day spa treatments also looked good (again, didn't get to try them out this time). The restaurant has a fantastic buffet (great salad and dessert sections in particular). The conference used it for lunch only, but I assume the breakfast spread is as good. Considering the location (two mins from Circular Quay train station), quality of the rooms and amenities and the price you can get on aggregator sites like wotif.com, this is a great option if you want to stay somewhere luxe in Circular Quay without breaking the bank. For business travelers I see no reason why you wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Best and the Friendliest”
Reviews.Author: ozmann54
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to OZ for many many years both for pleasure as well as or business and the BEST hotel to stay at for the BEST value in Sydney is the Marriott at Pitt Street. If you are making your first trip to just needing a great comfortable bed in a secure hotel with people that CARE about you, then this is the place to stay. You are close to the Circular Quay, as well as the Opera House and just footsteps to The Rocks and all of the great nightspots in this area of town. If you are a Marriott regular then get ready to REALLY be pampered as the concierge floors in this property are one of the best in the chain!! The people that work there will remember who you are if you travel there more than a couple of times a year..which helps when you need some special favors. So don't take chances..do it right with The Marriott on Pitt Street is THE BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel fulfilled all our needs”
Reviews.Author: Linda33045
Reviews.Content: This was a first-time trip to Sydney for my husband and myself. The Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay had been recommended to us and it didn't disappoint. The hotel is very convenient to ferry service, as well as the city bus. It is not necessary to rent a car here, as the available transportation can get you to most of the favored sights. The hotel rooms are being renovated and are clean and comfortable. My only regret is that our room did not have a bathtub. Many hotels are removing tubs to conserve water and our bathroom had an open-air shower. I missed an occasional bath while on this trip. We did receive an upgrade to a room with a wonderful view of the Sydney Harbor Bridge. The concierge is very informative and helpful and the entire staff went out of its way to make for a comfortable, enjoyable stay, even surprising us with chocolate-covered strawberries and the Australian desert speciality, pavlova, on our last night!

Reviews.Title: “The presidential suite is stunning. Felt like a princess there.”
Reviews.Author: fitnessbabe2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay on the weekend - in their presidential suite. The suite was absolutely stunning with gorgeous views of the Opera House. It had 2 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, one of which had a spa bath. It was decorated in warm browns and bright yellows with splashes of red. Walking in the door, you have the large loungeroom on the left, complete with a sizable plasma screen tv. The dining room, kitchen and first bathroom are to the right. Walking up the stairs you find the second bathroom on your right and the two bedrooms to your left - spare (with 2 queen beds) and master bedroom - with king size bed, walk-through closet and master bathroom with spa. The suite is literally fit for a President, and I felt like a princess staying there. The Marriott also has a gym and pool/spa on the 4th floor. Both the gym and the pool are small but clean. And the spa is large, but requires a degree to turn on (it's not as simple as pushing 1 button). The Marriott's buffet breakfast is delicious and provides a great variety of hot and cold food. The only down side to the Marriott is the customer service. The room service food is good, but they got our order wrong (chicken instead of fish) and kept knocking on the door when they were told to simply enter. The parking attendants are also careless - I had my hands free cord ripped apart. Overall, I would give the suite 10/10, and customer service 5/10. If you are going to stay there, I recommend getting there by public transport to avoid the parking costs ($45 day) and damage risk.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler4971
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this Marriott and expected more from a highly priced hotel in a pique tourist area such as Sydney Harbour. When I first arrived they informed me that their executive club was under renovation and an area was designated on the second floor for us to use. This was not good for me since I was traveling with 4 other business colleagues and we needed an area to convene. We were allowed to use the business conference center but it was a mess. Soiled table, used coffee cups, water bottles were strewn about. They have renovated their rooms in a minimalist, modern style which, in my opinion, was not very comfortable or inviting. Yes, you get a beautiful view of Sydney Bridge but a view without a comfortable room isn't ideal. No bathtubs in the bathroom, just showers. Wireless worked only sometimes. Wired LAN connection was broken. When I called to have it fixed I was directed to a third party customer service group who informed me it was my computer that was the problem! I knew this was not the case since I was able to connect wirelessly all week in other places. The breakfast buffet was the usual spread of fruits, cereals, eggs, meats, cheeses, cooked to order eggs and was very pricey at 34 SYD. The lounge closes at 11pm which was unfortunate. We all wanted to socialize for another 30 minutes and have a nightcap after a lovely dinner and we were told to go to a bar around the corner. Not something we wanted to do so we ended up retiring early. The exercise facility is very good and open 24 hours. The concierges were very helpful and always very busy between the 3-7pm timeframe. So, it's best to approach them in the morning or early afternoon when you don't have to compete for their time. Bottom line, I expect much better customer orientation for a high end hotel, charging high rates than what I got. Would I go back to this Marriott? Probably since I have a huge loyalty to Marriott. But a few more of these experiences and I'll be frequenting the Hilton chain or some other hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: We normally steer clear of the big chains, but this was in a package deal and we had a nice stay. Very friendly service from all at the hotel. They didn't have much to offer as far as interesting dining advice, though. All were very safe choices - their clientele must not be very adventurous eaters. Speaking of which, the restaurant was very pricey and food appeared dull, so we always ate elsewhere. Nice fitness center with a hot tub. Our room had an Opera House view - others may also be able to see the bridge - I'm not sure about the higher-end rooms. Room was spacious with a nice bathroom and comfy bed. A little short on drawer space, but that's a tiny complaint. It's on prime touristic real estate, which is good and bad. But when you want to escape that area, all the buses, ferries and trains are just outside. Very easy to get to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Friendlytips1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for over 3 weeks while on business. The location is perfect in that it just around the corner from Circular Quay and at the end of the CBD...the area can get very quiet at weekends but you are so near transport to get out and about, its not an issue. I stayed in one of the newly decorated rooms with a view of the bridge and it was comfortable...bed was comfy - perhaps lacking in some storage when you are around for longer than a few days. Has a good gym and spa is good if not expensive; $70 for a pedicure as an example: a little steep given that I got another very good one about 5 mins walk about for half that so worth shopping around for spa treatments...the pool is lacking in any ambience in that it is inside a glass window with nothing to look at and you wouldnt be enticed to stay there. Mini bar food very expensive: there are mini shops across the road but they are equally expensive ($7 for small water and banana!) so if you are looking for snacks suggest a quick trip to Woolworths or somewhere to stock up. Food isnt bad is in the bar: ate in the restaurant only once and food was ok but not good enough for what you pay. bar staff very friendly as well as Adriana in the Spa. My main issues with this place is that it is souless but i suppose you can expect this from every large hotel chain in major cities: However after 3 weeks staying there I would still arrive to reception desk and would get looks like it was the first time they ever saw me. In addition, I would question cleaning standards to an extent....I tended to notice that they would hoover around things as opposed to picking them up: and tidy away paper wrappers plus the bathroom sink never seemed like it was really cleaned and empty shower gels would be left in the shower every day. When i called to complain and ask about the standards, I was advised they would advise the Housekeeping manager and ensure it didnt happen in the future..but nothing changed. I also did get to the Exec lounge on one evening and the toilet there was so dirty I refused to use it - I did advise the staff again on that occasion...taking short cuts regarding cleaning is a major faux pas in my opinion but am wondering if this is the norm as when I moved to an apartnment, I experienced the same 'cleaning' issues. Overall I would stay again but there are nicer places to rest your head. Internet was extra! For what i paid (company rate) I think it was good value but not worth more than that

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Shee80
Reviews.Content: It was mothers day weekend, and my mum was visiting so we decided to head to Sydney for the weekend. We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights. From the moment I entered the hotel, I was impressed. The person who greeted us as we got off the taxi was pleasant and greeted us with a smile. I had my fingers crossed and was hoping we would be able to check in (it was only 9am), the person at the reception was pleasant and had a room ready for us, just as we had requested. We had asked for a higher floor, 2 double beds, 3 towels and an early checkin. Everything was exact. You couldn't get a better hotel closer to Circular Quay, a taxi stand, the circular quay train station, the ferries, bars & coffee shops were all close by. We enjoyed our refurbished rooms, and every moment we spent at the hotel. It truly was a five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nice Concierge Staff”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at this Marriott my expectations were low. All I expected was a traditional Marriott in a typical large city with the usual Marriott furnishings. The suite we had was a generous size for Sydney and eveything I expect from Marriott. What I want to comment on in this review was the wonderful concierge floor staff. Without a doubt when I travel I make it a point to stay on the concierge floor as it provides me a little more privacy, assistance when needed and breakfast away from the crowds. I also want to share with you that many people say that staying on a concierge floor as a tourist is a waste. I find that the services on a concierge floor when I traveling with friends or family on vacation is most benefitial. At this Marriott the ladies went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The ladies took care of our dinner reservations, gave suggestions on places to go and stuff to see, and even helped us get the specific room we requested. There are many wonderful hotels in Sydney, but the concierge staff at this hotel were impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult review to write”
Reviews.Author: Australiadreamer
Reviews.Content: As I said in my title this review is a little difficult to write. Overall the hotel was great but I did have one issue that for me was major. Let's start with the positive: 1. you can't ask for a better location 2. The concierge was very helpful 3. The bell staff, the restaurant staff, and the man in the gift shop were very friendly and personable 4. The breakfast buffet was great 5. Dinner in the dining room and room service was also great 6. The room and bathroom were clean and newly renovated 7. The hotel was very quiet 8. The view from my room overlooked the harbor Opera house Here are three slightly negative things: 1. There is very little storage in these rooms. There is only one closet and it is on the small side. There was only one drawer that was usable. 2. We could not regulate the temperature in the room. The thermostat would not adjust. 3. The safe did not work. In fairness to the hotel we did not say anything to the staff about the thermostat or the safe so these items might have been easily remedied. Even without them working properly they didn't really affect our stay. Now for the one negative item: When I booked the hotel (through a travel agent who used a travel booking agency) I booked a wheelchair accessible room. When I got to the hotel they did not have me in a wheelchair accessible room. When the woman at the desk tried to change my reservation to wheelchair accessible room she discovered she could not do this because the floor on which the wheelchair accessible rooms are located was shut down for the week I was there due to renovations. No one had informed the booking agency that the wheelchair accessible room would not be available for the week I was going to be staying there. Even though the agency had reconfirmed my room a week prior to my arrival. To compensate me they moved me to a Opera house view suite. The room itself was great and is wheelchair accessible except for the bathroom. It made for an awkward three days using their bathroom. On the third day evening they installed a hand-held shower hose on the sink which made washing so much easier. To compensate me for their mistake they did reimburse me for my dinner meals and for two nights of my stay. They did not reimburse me for my breakfast because that was included in my hotel room rate. In my opinion the upgraded room, reimbursement, and the installation of the shower hose was adequate compensation and if I go back to Sydney I will have no problem staying at the Marriott again. I will just be much more vigilant about double checking that my room is wheelchair accessible. I recommend to all those who require wheelchair accessible rooms to check several times with your hotel to make sure that the room they have you booked in is wheelchair accessible. Overall the Marriott is a great hotel. The public areas are wheelchair accessible. I cannot comment on the accessibility of the rooms because as I stated above I did not stay in one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but never been treated so poorly”
Reviews.Author: DSaenz
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. It's great for those who like to take walks and go out at night because everything is in walking distance. The facilities are excellent, the room is very nice. However, the way the staff treats you is surprisingly bad, they always make you notice how busy they are, you don't even finish your sentence and they would hang up the phone, they interrupt you while you talk, its really frustrating. We talk to the manager and she had the same manners. Even the bellboy on our arrival asked us to carry our bags ourselves. The consierge never answered the phone and he even didn't badder to call us back. When we left the hotel we found with surprise that we were not the only ones who complain. Another guest checked out shouting out of frustration when was asked how was her stay. We were there for our honeymoon, and is a decision that we'll always regret. We chose the Marriott because in Lima, Santiago, Miami, Quito and other cities we have loved them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel. One of Marriott's best. Stay here if you can.”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaJack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. They just get everything right. If you are traveling on business, and have a choice, stay here. If you are traveling on a holiday and can afford it, look no further. You can't do much better unless you stay at the Four Seasons nearby, and then only if you get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: susansmithe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights the end of March with my adult son. The rooms were very nice, clean and modern. We had a room that was newly remodeled on an upper floor with a view of the Sydney Harbour. Since we arrived at about 10:00am our room was not ready. We had access to the 2nd floor lounge, to change and freshen up. They held our luggage and put it in our room when the room was ready, while we went out sightseeing for the day. Check in went quick and was easy. We didn't eat in the hotel. There are several good coffee shops for coffee and breakfast all around the hotel. WiFi is not free, but McDonalds is only a block away and they have free WiFi. We ate at a very nice Italian restaurant next to the hotel which was recommended by the concierge. It was small but the food was very good. They also have a gentleman playing the piano, nice atmosphere. The location of this hotel is the best. Train, bus and ferries are all about a block away. Sydney Harbour, The Rocks, the bridge, all walking distance. Many restaurants in the area. I would definitely stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fabulous facilities”
Reviews.Author: zanphee1
Reviews.Content: The Marriot is in a fabulous location, a short walk from circular quay and ferries to various locations in Sydney. We walked everywhere during our stay. We had a corner room which overlooked the city, it was very roomy, huge in fact. The room was spotless and the bathroom was immaculate (it looked like had recently been renovated). In conclusion we would definetely stay there again if we returned to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Sydney- Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: caskel01
Reviews.Content: Location, new refurbed rooms, location and location. This Marriott is great. Sure the staff have the same issue you will find with most locals in Sydney - "I'm to good to be working in a hotel and you are not important", but the property more than makes up for it. If you are staying in Sydney ignore the other TripAdvisor suggestions, this is where you want to stay. For Sydney it is well priced and the rooms are very plush and upper floors have good views on both sides. Concierge is ultra helpful and the trinket shop inside has decent stuff and the guy running it loves to bargain so you can get better prices than out on the street. For tourists, I suggest using the ferries to see Sydney. The Manly ferry allows you to see all the harbour and good views of the opera house. Walk the park up the hill from the Marriott for great views, good greenscape, and to meet others. If you are a solo traveler there are several others walking around looking for someone to take a pic, have a bite with, or just get to know someone new with casual chat. The park is great for this.

Reviews.Title: “At the Heart of Waterfront Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Aurora_Guy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Marriott hotels around the world, and I would certainly rank the Circular Quay property in the top six or seven in my experience. The lobby simply exudes a trendy, modern feel with some period surroundings to reflect the historical area. It is not far from the ferry terminal and the Sydney Opera House. Rooms are decorated in a comfortable, modern style with flat-screen TVs, glasstop work space, and the legendary Marriott bedding. Bright, big windows offered me a view of the bridge and the harbour. The housekeeping staff should be complimented. The public areas, the concierge lounge, and my room were virtually spotless. All the staff I encountered were efficient and professional. From check-in to nightcaps, everyone seemed genuinely concerned about the guest experience. A service manager even approached and asked questions on the elevator one afternoon. The lobby's Macquarie Lounge serves what must be some of the world's most expensive drinks, but you have to admit the surroundings are world-class. Tourists, business travelers, and air crews from the four corners of the world come and go around the clock. Even on the busiest of weekdays, though, the hotel's atmosphere is very relaxing. Outside of lunch at the lounge and the usual breakfast and appetizers in the concierge lounge, I failed to take advantage of the kitchen's skills. The Circular Quay Marriott is a premium property in a premium location, but I would suggest keeping an eye on specials. Whether romance, finance, or anything in between, this place can serve as a wonderful venue. You can feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: TravelSimone
Reviews.Content: As far as a Marriott goes, this one is appropriate for its location- slightly upscale for a prime location in a fantastic city. The service at the door and reception was friendly and efficient. We had a number of Marriott gift cards in USA$ to use at check-out, and the staff handled the hassle of many gift cards in a foreign currency as if it was no bother. The room was large enough, clean and with nice and comfortable furniture. The bathroom was well-appointed and roomy. The views from the room were excellent. The location cannot be beat for a tourist- right near Circular Quay. You can easily walk to many, many tourist sites, and the public transportation (ferries, buses, trams) were a block away, so getting anywhere in Sydney was a breeze. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great service for a platinum member.”
Reviews.Author: triplover04
Reviews.Content: I have been staying from May 1st until May 9th and my sister is still there until may 20th. We are platinum member and we were told at our arrival that the hotel is renovating and the lounge is not accessible. What a surprise, they did not tell at the time of our reservation if not, we would stay at another Marriott. The second surprise is we were told that there is a light snack from 5:30PM to 7:30PM but when we arrive at 7:00Pm, staffs told that there is not more food. Everything is closed. Not really convenient. The next day, on all of the following day, when we came down the 2nd floor at 6:00PM, there is no more place. I was told to squeeze in near the hall if I wanted a place. What a service, this is not what we call a 5 stars hotel. I am so disappointed and many more incident happened during my stay (example: luggage that takes at least 25 minutes before it gets to my room, i could of bring them myself. I have to call the bell desk to make sure they did not forget . Actually, I think they did etc...). Besides the service not that great, the reception desk (some of the employee seems to not really appreciate we ask questions. Not all but some of the employees.) were not responding fully to our questions. I was one of the worst stay at the Marriott I had. We did complain (to the staff that was on duty of our concerned) but nothing was done since they do not seems to care by responding " I will mention it to my boss" but the following day, nothing was taking care. We are on vacation and we want to enjoy our stay in Sydney. The only positive part is that we got upgraded for our room since we have insisted to have an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location and great service”
Reviews.Author: pjnvikes
Reviews.Content: We had a phenomenal stay at this property, for 4 nights, in April 2011. The stay was excellent, in every way, and I'd highly recommend this property, especially based on location, alone. We were able to walk to all the key attractions in downtown Sydney, and able to quickly walk to both the ferry and train stations, for other attractions. As we utilized Marriott Rewards points for our stay, I can't speak to price/value. The hotel restaurants and bars were very nice, also. The only downgrade I would give is the pool area, which was cold, small, and did not offer lounging chairs to relax / hang-out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, NIce View but not the location for leisure traveller.”
Reviews.Author: Bibster2005
Reviews.Content: It's right at the tip of Circular Quay, walking distance to Opera House and the Rocks. Nice hotel but not friendly front desk staff. Rooms are big and if you are lucky, you might get a view of the bridge. If you are into shopping and nightlife, this hotel is not for you. Pitt Street Mall is about 10-15 mins walk and another 5-10 mins walk to Chinatown. Circular Quay train station is a stone throw away so it's handy and lots of little cafeteria where you can catch a quick bite for breakfast or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, terrific location & wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Mia K
Reviews.Content: It has been a few years since I've stayed at this hotel & once again experienced a wonderful stay. I booked direct with the hotel for a saturday night - the "revive" package that included breakfast, valet parking, 2 bottles of wine & a lovely gift package. We arrived at 12 noon & were able to check into our room on the 22nd floor - Opera House view. The room was spacious, modern, recently renovated & very quiet. Buffet breakfast was typical 5 star, good variety & included porridge with a gorgous berry compote as an accompaniment - just the thing for a chilly autumn morning! Service was excellent from check in to check out, staff were polite, friendly & helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Good position to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: janethomas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott over the Easter break. We stayed last year in one of their regular rooms. This time we upgraded to a one bedroom suite. Overall, our stay was good. The hotel is in a good position for visitors to explore the city. Our suite was quite new and comfortable for the 4 of us (2 children). The regular room was a bit tight however. We had a deal which included breakfast. Breakfast was good but there was always a line of people queuing up. I guess it was b/c the hotel was quite full during the Easter break. Service at breakfast was very good, my favourite was the cup of cafe latte I had each morning. A good hotel to stay at in Sydney, not overly luxurious but catered to our needs. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: babsdog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over-priced and is under renovation which they do not tell you when booking. We booked an executive room which is supposed to be on a higher floor, there are 32 and they put us on floor 15 with no view but still charged us a premium rate. This was a renovated room and the shower would not drain properly. The entire stay was one disappointment after another. Stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service to a Silver Elite member”
Reviews.Author: Guyana1234
Reviews.Content: $A479 a night. Not cheap. Only told construction on floor above when I checked in. No upgrade for an elite member..not even access to Lounge. I always get when at a Sheraton and I have more points with Marriott. Very disappointed at this lack of service while paying a lot for a room. Next time a different hotel for certain. One that treats its frequent stay members with class.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great location -- but don't forget your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: This is an easy review to write: it's simply another fabulous Marriott. There simply are no complaints. It's right downtown, near the harbor, about $45 from the Sydney airport. There's a Starbucks on the corner, tons of shopping; about a hundred restaurants within walking distance; and when it's time to go the highway is an easy jump away. The staff was great, the concierge helpful, and the serving staff in the lobby bar charming. I was able to use the Executive Lounge on the 30th floor on this trip, and I can report it's worth the effort. Good snacks, a solid breakfast, and wines and cocktails in the evening overlooking the harbor. Just don't forget that all this glamour and service comes at a price. A big price, at least on my travel budget. But hey, you're in Sydney, watching the moon over the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the service!”
Reviews.Author: mmodlt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the week-end recently with 5 year old son for his birthday. Looked after from the start with upgrade from City to Bridge view room on a high floor. Guest services even delivered a dessert platter and koala toy for the birthday boy! Concierge hooked us up with some discounted aquarium tickets and all was good! Rooms have been recently fully refurbished, bed very comfortable and everything we needed was only a phone call away. Had the buffet breakfast each morning which gets pretty busy at peak times. Food tended to run down quickly and waiting for an omelette took over 10 minutes the first day. Quality of food was good, though, and staff will make an espresso at no extra charge. Location is brilliant with an easy walk to the Circular Quay ferry terminal, train station, The Rocks and even over to Darling Harbour or shopping in the city. All in all, a very comfortable and satisfying stay. Would stay here again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location...”
Reviews.Author: Tigeroldboy
Reviews.Content: Well after a 14 hour flight I was apprehensive about the location but did not need to be, 2 mins from Circular Quay and the Rocks. Very spacious room, huge comfortable bed perfect to recover from jet lag. No free computer access, $5 for 20 mins. Staff very friendly and helpful. A fantastic experience for us both

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaceys1
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable, spacious room with a fantastic view of the Opera House and Harbor....We had dinner in the restaurant the first night there and it was delicious..we stayed here for 4 nights and can't say enough nice things--concierge completely helpful and I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheerfulChickie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March 2011. I had come from working in Melbourne to Sydney for a short detour vacation before returning to the US. Sidney is much bigger than Melbourne and so much more to see and do. This hotel is an a great location, just a few minutes from the Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, shopping district. You can even walk to Darling Harbour and Chinatown if you don't mind a good 30min hike. I paid a little extra to have the room with a view of the Sydney Opera House. Now that I know what the view is like (you see it from the back side of the opera house), I recommend you save the money and just walk there and see the real thing. The quality of the view was not work the extra 30USD or so that I paid per day. The room itself was large with large working table that was faced to the window so you can look at the view while working if you have to do some work (which I did). I was there alone, but the room could easily fit 2 people. The bathroom was large with separate tub and shower. The furniture looked a bit outdated (like 80's style) and not as luxurious as the 5 star I had just stayed in for work at Melbourne, but I also didn't pay as much per night here. I am a Marriott gold member, so internet and breakfast was free for me. The breakfast buffet was typical english breakfast. They didn't change the food most days, so got alittle boring but it was decently good food for starting out my day (of alot of hiking around the city). The hotel staff is exceptionally nice. I couldn't figure out how to get my access card working for the executive lounge and the sent someone to come with me to the elevator and showed me. The staff in the execution lounge also made effort o greet me and ask about my day without being too impeding on my privacy. Just friendly. I would recommend this hotel for location alone if you can get a good rate. It's not a super luxurous hotel although it is rated a 5 star (I would stay somewhere else if you're looking for luxury). Also skip paying for the opera house view and just walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Check in staff need customer care training”
Reviews.Author: kintailnz
Reviews.Content: Checked in to this huge hotel to find ourselves in a low level small pokey room with view over roof of buildings. Was also disabled room which fortunately neither of us are, so we didn't need to huge sliding toilet door or the seat in the wheel-in shower. We asked at reception for a change of room. Not ONE other room free in the whole of the hotel. Every single room was allocated to someone else and they had ALL specifically asked for their particular rooms. A blatant lie as we were meeting up with a big conference group, none of whom had asked for specific rooms. Went to bed and the side of bed my husband was sleeping on was disgustingly smelly. It was horrible. He ended up at the end of the bed!! All very romantic. Next day we were thouroughly fed up but only there for 2 nights so not worth the fuss. Moved (again at request) to another adequate room. Barman couldn't tell me if a chardonnay I had ordered was an unoaked or oaked - I don't particularly care but clearly he didn't have a clue what I was talking about. Great for all their international guests! Horrible hotel, bad staff, Substandard rooms. Needs an overall overhaul!! Friends recently went to Sydney and there was no way I could recommend this establishment to them!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the staff....”
Reviews.Author: booboo8
Reviews.Content: Had nice (refurbished) big room overlooking opera house. Room a little TOO full of furniture but nice, nice big bathroom. Was near LIFTS, so noisy, but not too bad. Comfy bed. Main problem with place was the staff and the quality of the breakfasts. Staff seemed to go out of their way to be unhelpful and rude esp on reception, we were NOT the only from our group to find this! THESE should be THE most helpful and smiley. Breakfast was a joke one was questioned as to WHAT kind of breakfast we would be having EVEN though breakfast was included for our tour group. The juices tasted watered down, the food was of poor quality, cheapo bread for toast etc. Coffee was vile, we gave up and ate at Starbucks around the corner! Wifi was not free had to purchase card for 30mins (could log off and on) from surly staff on reception

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Location in Sydney - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew PB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 13 nights in Jan/Feb following the same length of stay at the same time last year. I had an Opera House facing room - 2725. Susan in reservations kindly arranged a XX25 room for me before I left the UK, as I was staying quite a long time - a XX25 room gets a better view of the OH. Near the lifts but this is not a problem. She also got me a late check out of 2pm on the day I flew home again very helpful. Floors 29 down to 19 have been refurbished and are a considerable improvement on non refurbed rooms so try and get a higher floor as possible. I found all the receptionists, particularly Gabrielle. very helpful and efficient as were all the staff. The main minus on the room was for me the lack of drawer space - simply not enough room for clothes if you were on a 3 week holiday. Breakfasts were ok but pricy at $35 - still no hash browns for breakfast! On Sundays evenings they do a steak and free drink for $29 which is good value. There is also the Custom House bar at the back (outside) of the hotel. Good pub type meals - fish and chips are great - good atmosphere outside in the evenings but some nights are busy with business locals. Probably the main plus point of the hotel is its fantastic location very close to Circular Quay and the ferries and rail station. The Opera House, Rocks and central Sydney shops are all within 10 minutes walk - the Harbour Bridge a bit further. The best hotel location in Sydney in my view and I have been coming to Sydney for 25 years. The hotel is not perfect but I would say is better than last year because of the refurbished rooms and the lifts seem to be quicker. Great views from the Opera House view rooms even if the Opera House is round to the left (looking out the window) and also of Circular Quay and the ferries. I have stayed here for nearly 4 weeks in just over the last year and find it comfortable and a good place to stay and I am quite particular Not faultless but its location allows you to forget minor inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay there again if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinedil
Reviews.Content: Misrepresentation , misinformation and mistakes all around , didnt give any part of my stay at this hotel a 5star feel. Waiting for ages at reception for check-in and checkout. Unhelpful reception staff . I was told the internet in my room was free but was presented with a bill for it on departure. My breakfast which was sponsored by my conference organiser was then put onto my bill as well and it was only after I brought the conference organiser around to the reception clerk did he admit that the breakfast should have been part of the package. I've since been told that I'm being charged for a partner breakfast which is absurd given I have no partner and had breakfast alone. Disappointed and digusted with the hotel overall , i will never stay there again , or recommend it to anyone. If you do decide to stay...do so at your own risk ..and double check EVERYTHING .

Reviews.Title: “WELL LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: nnmercman
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault the location of this hotel. We were offered an upgrade to a room with harbour/opera house view for an additional 50aud per night (we were there for four nights) but decided not to take it up as we spent little time in our room. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Prices in Sydney and Australia in general are expensive for Brits so be warned! There are plenty of eateries nearby the hotel and would recommend the Rocks area, although no difference in prices the ambiance is better. Taxis are available at the front of hotel but we had a pre booked shuttle service for the airport (via Travelbag package) which was cheap and convenient. Can't comment on the price of the hotel for value as we'd booked it as part of a package.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay very long!”
Reviews.Author: jhoward16
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the food is good BUT do not go to this hotel if you plan to stay for more than a day. The room is so poorly set up that you have no place to unload a suitcase and will wonder if anybody has ever used the bathroom. There are virtually no draws, little hanging space, no space in the bathroom and the bath towels are miles away from the shower. Two people staying for two days or more will be a disaster. I suggested that the hotel manager and his/her spouse spend a few days living in their own hotel rooms. The problems are so obvious and easily fixed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Keith75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for experiencing the harbour side of Sydney. We arrived very early and were given access to a well equipped courtesy room while we waited.The room on the 29th floor was clean.well appointed and had all the facilities needed.The staff were helpful and courteous. Our only criticism was of the evening buffet which was low on quality meat and was rather expensive in relation to other eateries in the area.Dishes were not replenished very quickly or efficiently

Reviews.Title: “Good Lobby and Concierge - Shabby Room and Service - overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SurbSi
Reviews.Content: We wanted a family room for three nights; even though we booked several months in advance we could not get a family room - so maybe they do not have any. As a result we had to book two adjoining rooms we paid approx $2400 AU for three nights - room only. So for $800 per night (400 per room) I had high hopes ,,,,, As we entered the hotel we were greeted by a polite and enthusiastic concierge, and led in to the impressive (though 80's dated) foyer. The reception staff were not overly welcoming, friendly or particularly polite, and could not manage a greeting or a please/thank you - they looked as though they just could not be bothered. Our room was on a high floor (8 I think) - the hall area was tidy and fairly modern, so I was surprised when I entered my room(s). The rooms were small, the decor faded old and shabby - paintwork was chipped and bashed, furniture was broken and tatty - e.g the tv cabinet the doors had been broken off, not replaced, and the screw holes filled with some cheap and nasty filler. Most premium hotels now have flat screen TV, not the here - just crappy old CRT. We did have quite a good side on view of the Sydney bridge. The beds were comfortable. The wallpaper was brown, drab and old. This was not a typical Marriott - I stay in many Marriott hotels on business and many are excellent - I do not mind paying for quality and service, but felt that this Marriott offered poor service, value and accommodation. I checked on breakfast and it was $35 (1/2 price for kids) - at $100 for breakfast on top of $800 for a pair of tatty rooms was too much. If you do have to stay here then check out the Alpha cafe immediately next door to the the hotel - great food, great service, run by Thai's, lovely fruit salad, excellent coffee, raisin toast or full cooked breakfast - we could feed the family at a quarter of the price of the hotel breakfast. What could they do better... Make family rooms available Offer rates including breakfast Train the desk staff Renovate the rooms to match the premium rates

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- perfect location for Sydney sites!”
Reviews.Author: 3Kings
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to explore all the sites in Sydney. Can walk to ferry to access all areas. Close to double decker bus and close to walk to many places like the bridge walk, Opera House, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location Rules, But Read Your Bill Carefully!!"”
Reviews.Author: Foodie8_4U
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ready for a major overhaul...but it is clean and has one of the best locations in Sydney. The proximity to the major hub (CQ) is really awesome. The staff is friendly (remember....this is Australia and they are awesome people) but they are not necessarily competent. When checking out I was charged for parking and specifically for parking a BMW...funny thing is, I took a TAXI. I spent more time than I should have convincing them that I had no car (even though I had booked the hotel shuttle to the Airport)...it was a young staff with no training and clearly this is one of Marriott's training properties. I am a platinum level Marriott member and I have seen this before. As they say in Oz...no worries!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hayleyg1982
Reviews.Content: this was the first hotel on out trip around australia and after a very long flight from london, it was lovely being able to check into such a great hotel. we were in a harbour bridge view room. the room was very clean and comfortable and the staff couldn't have been more helpful! the hotel is in a great location- only about a five minute walk to the opera house and bridge and perfect for getting buses to bondi beach and for restaurants and shopping

Reviews.Title: “The location is the best attribute”
Reviews.Author: WittyCutie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott Sydney Harbour was the first segment of our trip accross the outback. I stayed there because I usually know what to expect from a Marriott. This was not the top of Marriott standards, but not the worst either. The good thing was that, as a gold Rewards member, I was able to use the Executive Lounge. That is definitely a BIG plus. Apart from the breakfast, and the snacks, there is FREE wireless internet in the lounge (in the rooms, you have to pay to use internet). So, uploading our pics and keeping in touch with family was easy. The hotel is a short walk from the Circular Quay station where you can catch ferries to Watsons Bay, the Zoo, Bondi Beach, but most importantly to the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge and all the restaurants that line the Harbour. We had a room in floor 24 and could see the Opera house from our window. That made our stay much more pleasant. Most of the guys at the concierge were useful and had lots of tips, but one night, there was a newbie who sent us on a wild goose chase after a restaurant where one of his colleagues had made reservations for my friends and me earlier in the day. The hotel apologized and send me a free bottle of excellent Australian wine to compensate me for spending an hour looking for a restaurant in the wrong part of the town. The staff is friendly and eager to serve. This is a Marriott after all, and they know about customer service. So, would I go back again? Yes! although I'd make my bookings much earlier. We started to book our vacation in September 2010, and by then there were no availability for New Year's eve. So, we had to make Sydney our first stay and leave to Port Douglas on Dec 29. If you want to be in Sydney on Dec 31, and stay in a good hotel that's near the Harbour (so you can watch the fireworks), it's best if you make your bookings by June, cause after that, you're unlikely to find a decent room, and not in the harbor area, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful lobby, average rooms and fixtures”
Reviews.Author: voyageuse_81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central location, with a wonderful view of the Opera House from the executive lounge on the higher levels of the hotel. Pros of this hotel, apart from its location, were: 1. Beautiful lobby area - feels wonderful and luxurious to walk into/out of. 2. Very comfortable bed furnishings. However, for the $310 standard room price (even with a Marriott Gold Card!) there were far too many letdowns for the price: 1. Air-conditioning simply didn't work in our room. To be fair to the hotel, I didn't request a room change, as I was too busy while I was there and by the time I came back to the hotel each evening, I was exhausted. 2. Bathroom, although clean, was really old and could do with a total upgrade. The shower actually feel disgusting to walk into - things were rusty and tiles had that grimy, old look and feel to them. Not pleasant! 3. No buffet dinner! We were disappointed by this - but the a la carte dinner was okay - not amazing food, but pretty good. 4. Super expensive Internet. I think in this day and age, hotels should not be charging $9 per hour for broadband Internet access in the rooms. Room service was also okay - obviously super expensive, but okay food. Overall, I would stay here again based on the great location, good breakfast and overall nice feel of the hotel, but would NOT pay as much for it ever again given the standard of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. What really impressed us was the early arrivals lounge. We arrived in Sydney at 8a.m.after an overnight flight and went to the hotel to leave our bags. Although our room was of course not ready, we were able to use the early arrivals lounge to change, shower and have a cup of coffee so that we were able to go out straight away feeling human and hit the sights of Sydney. A really useful facility.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: lukmi
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the Hilton the night before, I personally felt it was just below par. The room I was given was really great I must stay, roomy and modern, clean and well-appointed - definitely worth the money. The location is good if you're a tourist, seconds from the Opera House, although there's not as many restaurant and cafes in that part of town (apart from the pricey ones at the Rocks - a tourist-trap), compared to Town Hall. The hall and main lobby could use a little revamp, it looks a bit tacky and 80s like. Staff were polite and helpful, especially the luggage guys. Overall, it isn't bad at all, just not my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views!”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastRain
Reviews.Content: We paid a bit extra for a room with views of the Opera House and Botanic Gardens. Absolutely stunning! Would definitely recommend paying extra to stay in one of these rooms. It was a nice hotel and a nice room. We only stayed one night so we didn't get a chance to experience their restaurant. The concierge was helpful and the location was fantastic. Close to Circular Quay which is really convenient if you need to take a ferry, train or bus anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good business”
Reviews.Author: benhmorris
Reviews.Content: The service is average at best, and the rooms are not what you would expect for what you pay. The best thing about this hotel is the location..... personally though i would pay the extra few $$ and stay at the Four Season down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the 5 star we expected”
Reviews.Author: lexibrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the kids for 3 night prior to our overseas cruise. GREAT location- just steps from Circular Quay which is why we picked this hotel in the first place. As for the room _ Very smal and disappointingl.Linen etc Had been updated but hotel is somewhat tired. Shower appeared mouldy due to black deposits on tiles. Shower door didnt close prperly and so water from shower pumped over the floor when you bathed. Bar was busy when we visited but ......over 15 minuted to get our night cap, waitress was very appologetic but really not good enough when you stay in 5 star accomodation. Must say both Concierges were amazing- nothing was too much trouble when we had tours to book, arrived early etc. Pool is not as great as pictures look and we had to wait over 1/2 hour to get towels to dry the kids with even afttr another guest made several calls to reception for same. As a package would we visit again - no way. Our City view room at the end of the hall was a view of a shorter buildings airconditionaing syster ( yuck!) The Marriot let us down- we wil stay with the Hilton or Hyatts from here on. After all for 5 star money you expect a 5 star hotel not thsi type pof tired substandard establishment

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: swyzzel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week. It's what you expect of a Marriott. It's clean and the staff is friendly and very helpful. Nothing spectacular about the hotel save the location. It's right on the wharf. Not even a full block away is the Harbour and the Opera House. Everything is walking distance. I met colleagues for dinner only a couple blocks away at Felix and then the Ivy. The Rocks are right next door and the Botanical Gardens and Museums are a skip away too. Overall great location. There's a 24 hour restaurant on the wharf. The ferries are great to go everywhere - Toranga zoo, Manly Beach. Sydney's a beautiful place and I can't wait to go back. The Marriot is a comfy stay. I will say the rooms are a bit small and antiquated. But the staff couldn't be more helpful for directions and I loved the black out shutters in the rooms. Quick tip - there's a Coles grocery store for eats a couple blocks away from the wharf cheaper than any of the city convenience stores.

Reviews.Title: “Again--The Location”
Reviews.Author: Dunn45
Reviews.Content: We walked everywhere from this location. The room was very good with the exception of the small TV. The staff was very helpful prior to our arrival. They helped us in setting up a Bridge Climb and a tour of Featherdale and the Blue Mountains (too bad that it was so cloudy that day). We ate at the Executive Lounge every day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ssbeagle
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is in a great location for visiting Sydney, Australia. It is within easy walking distance of the Botanical Gardens; Circular Quay for ferry service, restaurants; the Opera House; Sydney Bridge; a market place; shopping; and you can even walk to Darling Harbor if you like a longer walk. The view from our room (I had requested a harbor view) was spectacular. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff were varied in their responses to guests. Dining at the Marriott was very expensive and we chose to eat most meals off the property after we paid $28 for a small pizza from room service (we were too tired to go anywhere). With tip it was over $30. For breakfast there was a Starbucks a block away and a very good cafe on the quay about 3 blocks away for all meals. The room was quiet and the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: kiddo75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our visit to Australia - at the beginning and end of our trip. The location really can't be beat, with only a 1 block walk to Circular Quay and ~4 blocks to the Opera House. The rooms are unremarkable (typical Marriott), decent size for a city like Sydney. What sets this hotel apart is the service. We used the concierge service and the executive club many times every day and they could not have been more helpful! We were traveling with a 1-year-old and the executive lounge staff were always playing with her or asking if we needed anything for her, it was really amazing. I've never had service like this, even when I've stayed at 5-star resorts. By the time we stayed here on our return leg, it felt like coming home again. I can't speak to the value of this hotel as we used Marriott points to pay for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Average”
Reviews.Author: widtml
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review that the hotel is very average and overpriced. I am particularly annoyed that at every turn there are additional charges. There's no wireless internet and there is a charge for wired internet. I also did not feel the need to pay additional money for a harbor view room and had a city view instead. Food is expensive and average in the hotel and unnecessary given there a lots of good restaurants in the area so don't eat at the hotel. Lastly if you need to use the business center to print out your boarding pass for a flight you'll need to buy an internet access card from the reception desk. The location is good but there are a lot of hotels in the area to choose from so I'll try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel is overpriced and average”
Reviews.Author: ARoomWithAReview
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business trip and stayed in a city view room since the Harbour Bridge and Opera House are within walking distance; I didn't see the merit in paying an extra $200/night for a view of them. Given the accommodations and the average level of service by the staff, I feel that I may have overpaid for the city room too. The walls of my room had black scuff marks on them. The TV was old (and confusing - if you pressed the power button on the TV itself to turn it off, the remote wouldn't turn it back on). The tub had big gouges and permanent scuff marks in it, making it appear perpetually dirty. Water from the tub/shower can be heard draining through the large grate in the bathroom floor - so loud that I guarantee it could be heard out in the hallway... speaking of that, I could hear every passing guest and noise from the hallway in my room. Wired internet costs $19.95 per day, which is crazy when many hotels offer it for free. I traveled with a friend, and on the 2nd day of our visit he misplaced one of the two room cards. We went down to the front desk to request a new card. They programmed a new card for him - and then about an hour later, they disabled my card. This started a cycle in which we repeatedly visited the front desk to report that one of our cards wasn't working, they issued a new card, and then disabled one or both of our working cards within a few hours. Every time one of us left the room, we had to check our card to see if it still worked or if we had to make yet another trip to the desk. I expect room service and hotel restaurants to be overpriced, but $99 per person for a buffet in the hotel restaurant? Lastly, I know that brewed/drip coffee is hard to come by in Australia, but for an American-owned hotel in a tourist area, which likely has its fair share of American guests, to only offer single-serving instant coffee packets in its rooms is disappointing. There were several positives - the location is excellent, walking distance to the Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Royal Botanical Gardens, room service and housekeeping staff were extremely friendly, there's a taxi rank just outside the entrance so you can always get a taxi, and there is a nice little cafe and a convenience store just across the street from the hotel's entrance, so getting a quick latte and a snack or picking up forgotten toiletries, etc. is easy. Finding affordable meals in the evening can be difficult - one should be prepared to pay anywhere from $26-$45 for an entree (excluding sides, drinks etc.) if you visit any of the restaurants along or near the water. After paying exorbitant prices for dinner several nights in a row, my friend and I visited the concierge one evening and asked for suggestions for a more affordable place to eat. He promptly grabbed a map and began circling the most expensive places around the Opera House, completely disregarding my request - after several frustrating minutes he finally explained that there really aren't any inexpensive restaurants in the area. We ended up at the Paragon Hotel around the corner where we had an OK meal for much less than we'd found elsewhere (but note that this place isn't a proper restaurant, it's a pub). For a quick and affordable lunch, there is a food court in a building around the rear of the hotel. We traveled to the Surry Hills area of town at one point and had excellent, fairly cheap Indian food from a little dive there, and I hear there are much more affordable places to eat in North Sydney if you happen to be there. I highly recommend taking a walk through the botanical gardens - they are beautiful with sweeping lawns and wide walking paths, and look out for the enormous bats roosting in the trees. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and might recommend this hotel to others for the excellent location, but personally I'd probably try a different hotel in the same area next time around.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: GDHSPS
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel a month in advance for the honeymoon suite. At the time of booking I emphasized quite a number of times that this was for our honeymoon and was assured that arrangements would be made. I arrived with my new wife in her wedding outfit and the staff commented on how lovely she looked - yet they did not make any effort to check that the room had been done up. Got to the room (which was an expensive harbour facing suite btw) to find no decorations no champagne in the room. Had to actually ring the guest services to request for champagne to be brought up! Can't express how disappointed my wife was. The rooms are well maintained but they are old and outdated. The TV was a 30 inch 20 year old unit - unacceptable for a 5 star hotel. View was good though of the Harbour Bridge. Upon checking out the next morning - we had an issue with the charging of the credit card - I am happy to assume that it was a misunderstanding and will not dwell on it. However what was shocking was that during checkout they did not ask us how our stay was! Nothing - just silence and a want to just charge the card. I was so disappointed by the whole experience and am afraid to stay at a Marriott hotel again (it sounds like their bookings team is not in Australia). A 5 star hotel in location only and nothing else - compounded by the fact that every other hotel overseas on our honey moon gave outstanding service and went the extra way when they could see it was our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good locatiobn”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynMusician
Reviews.Content: For proximity to the harbour and views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House, this is an excellent choice. The rooms are pretty standard Marriott fare (although the refurbished rooms seem more spacious with the removal of the large TV armoire) but the are certainly clean and comfortable. The staff were all very helpful. There is a weird elevator layout, but that is hardly a deterrent.

Reviews.Title: “A nice treat for my birthday”
Reviews.Author: GemmaZ
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place to stay in the heart of Sydney. After a disastrous would-be flight to Sydney for my birthday (never ever fly Tiger Airways EVER!) my husband and i were forced to travel for 10 hours by car after our flight from Melbourne was cancelled. We arrived exhausted and weary to be greeted by the lovely valet and a gorgeous room with amazing views over the harbour. This was a mystery hotel we booked on Wotif.com, and it was worth it. The bar downstairs was great, the pool was lovely (a bit chilly but it was June) and for a cheap feed try the Ship Inn just in front of the hotel. When leaving we had to wait some time as the valet guys had parked our car wrong, we were getting a little anxious as we had another 10 hr drive ahead of us - but management apologised immediately and came back with some lovely De Borteolli wine for us as a thanking for waiting. If we ever get to Sydney again, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: matt10e
Reviews.Content: As everyone would agree this is a great location for you are near Opera House, Harbor Bridge, Circular Quay, the ferries, bus, and train all within a blocks walk, We also walked to the Rocks, and even the Mall. We arrived early and they got us in a early arrival room to relax and check emails. They got us in around noon which is a couple hours early, Brought our luggage up, Every day room was perfectly clean, with fresh everything. Front desk helped us with luggage that did not show up on our flight, received it the next day, they brought it up to our room as soon as the airport delivered it. We were on the 31st floor with great view of the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, perfect location, good price”
Reviews.Author: ElenaKo
Reviews.Content: My stay in Sydney was a great combination of business and pleasure, so I really wanted to stay in a hotel, located close to the harbour. Marriott was just the right place â€“ just 5 minutes walking distance from the harbour, a very clean and tidy room, delicious breakfastâ€¦ and the price was very good for the quality that was offered. If I go to Sydney again, I know were to book a room!

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott Sydney Harbour will never see me again!”
Reviews.Author: eak72
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel ruined my weekend from the moment we checked in and they couldn't give us the room we had requested to then miraculously finding a cancellation that would be suitable. Still no Harbour View though. Then after complaining were placated with a comp visit to Executive Lounge which frankly needs a good refurbish. Staff at this hotel were not friendly and had no idea how to be hospitable. Must be a miserable place to work. I give this hotel 1 star for the coffee machine in the Executive Lounge. A highlight for me.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Bev15842
Reviews.Content: Our comfortable and well-appointed room was on a high floor with a view of the Harbour Bridge. The location of the hotel was within easy walking distance of the Opera House, the Bridge, the ferries, the train, the area known as the Rocks, many restaurants, city tour bus stop, and the Botanical Gardens. Although there was an area where you could use the computer at cost, there was a more reasonably priced Internet service across the street in the convenience store. Although I cannot comment on a monetary value as we used Marriott loyalty awards, I can say that the value in having a dedicated and helpful concierge was priceless. He, Jonathan, helped us straighten out our reservations and itinerary in NZ at the time of the earthquake- an invaluable service. We were directed to reasonably priced restaurants with character and charm, advised of several tours, and in general, we most helpful. A day trip to "boutique wineries" was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for business and not leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller43
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good size, nice and clean. The bed is comfortable. However, little things such as bathrobes are not provided. The pool is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Marriot Harbour at Circular Quay was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: delilah528
Reviews.Content: On our Honeymoon we traveled to Australia and started in Sydney Harbor, we stayed at the Sydney Marriot Harbour at Circular Quay and had an amazing time. We received a complimentary bottle of champagne and the staff was helpful and friendly. We ordered room service once or twice and everything we ordered was delicious. Every morning we enjoyed a breakfast buffet and made to order entrÃ©es cooked by world class chefâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Liltraveler47
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was great. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. Our rate included breakfast on the 2nd floor which was very good. It had a little bit of everything. The waiters were very nice replenishing your coffee or orange juice as soon as they saw they were empty. The hotel staff was very nice and accommodated our every need. Our flight did not leave Sydney until late on the last day and they allowed us to stay until 1pm before checking out and then gave us the key to their executive waiting area which provided us with a comfortable place to stay while we waited. It had a bathroom with showers and all the necessary toiletries needed. It also had a TV and a computer for our use. The location of this hotel is awesome. It is in the middle of everything. Just a block or two from Circular Quay from which you can take ferries to anywhere. Also close to the Harbour Bridge, shopping, restaurants, etc. You won't go wrong if you stay here. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, closer to city attractions”
Reviews.Author: Vijayer
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel, though on the little expensive side. The rooms were comfortable, clean. The best part is, its closest to the Sydney opera house and the harbor bridge and many other attractions. Its a very good place to stay if you wanna explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical Marriot but not an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned an adventurous honeymoon in Australia, New Zealand and Fiji. Our first hotel stay was at the Sydney Harbour Marriot - we stayed there based on TripAdvisor reviews and it's close proximity to the Harbour. This is your typical Marriot that you would see anywhere in the world - very clean, nicely decorated, modern, etc. Unfortunately there were 2 areas where we felt they fell short. Firstly their concierge's were not as helpful as we had hoped. Only traveling with LonelyPlanet books, we were hoping for a lot of insight into Sydney and the "must-do"s for our 3 night stay. Their recommendations seemed to be driven by the price of the tour, not necessarily the quality of it, and they also gave us inaccurate information about the local transit system which left us stuck at a train station with a ticket that got us nowhere that we wanted to go. We figured it out but it would've been nice to have some solid direction in the first place. To be honest, we got better recommendations from the front desk clerks. Secondly, our room rate included breakfast. When we reserved the room, we selected that there would be 2 people staying and even mentioned it was our honeymoon to give them yet another clue. Yet, they still neglected to tell us that the breakfast that was included was only for 1 person, not both of us. We weren't told this when we booked, when we checked in OR when we actually told the waitress that we wanted breakfast for 2 that was included in our room rate. We found out when we got our bill slid under our door. After complaining, they did offer to remove the charge for 1 of the extra breakfasts but we were still left with a $30+ AUD charge for another. With all of the traveling we do, we expected a little more out of the Marriot and the services they offer, but overall it was a great stay - mainly because of the location. You can beat it - it's close to the ferries and there are several bus stops and train options close by. The harbour, gardens and the government house is a short walk away, so all in all I'd still recommend the hotel, just make sure that you get your tour/local info from someone else in addition to the concierge and keep an eye out for the breakfast inclusive room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
