Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for three nights, the best part of the hotel was its location. Kind of amusing I am a Platinum memeber of Marriott rewards, and booked a club level room with an opera house view,and was told when we arrived that we were upgraded to this room. This seemed to happen in several hotels in Australia we did get the room we booked, but were told we were upgraded. The hotel was ok, the location was its best part. It was central to the ferries and buses, there were all kinds of resturants within a 5 minute walk. The casino was an easy 10 minute walk from the hotel. It is a large casino with many shops and resturants. We did stay on the club level and did have a buffet breakfast and snacks later in the day, it was very nice to have this available especially with the prices of food in the area resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott should be ashamed of the service offered, especially by Andrew [--] (Director of Security & Safety)”
Reviews.Author: jennygloeckl
Reviews.Content: Marriott should be ashamed of the service offered at Sydney Harbour! Service is slow and some front office staff is unfriendly. One of the porters droped my bag with my laptop inside. When finding out that the laptop is broken, the Director of Security & Safety, Andrew [--] first off all did not have the time to talk to me. After pressuring front office staff he talked to me for 5 minutes saying that he connot do anything about it exept of following his standardized procedures of investigation. No apology, nothing! He talked to me in a disrespectful manner, showing no sign of intrest in my matter. When leaving the hotel and waiting with my luggage to depart the hotel, he walked by me looked at me and said nothing! After ensuring me he will contact me within 7 days, after 2 weeks I still have no answer! Being a loyal customer of Marriott this should not happen and people like that should not be employed by a high quality service provider such as Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: AlegreVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: Circular Quay is a football field away. From this decent sized room there is a peekaboo view of the harbour and Opera House. The room is absolutely fine. Comfortable king bed with duvet, iron and board, no robe or slippers, quiet, $20(24 hours) Internet, tube TV, safe, coffee, mini bar, three phones, separate shower from the soaker tub. If there is a complaint it is the shower grout is due to be changed. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ok but I would not go back (until refurbishment) â€“ carpet nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was close to Circular Quay and easy to get to from the airport (train station is 2 minutes away) and is close to the Rocks and the ferry stops. It is very expensive for what you get. We arrived very early and the staff was nice enough to give us our room straight away so we could get some sleep after a long flight. The room was very big but looked old, the bathroom was large (but strange shape) with separate bath and shower but it was screaming refurbishmentâ€¦Also I immediately felt there was something wrongâ€¦basically there was this very strong smell of chemicals and it came from the carpetâ€¦it really affected my breathing especially when spleepingâ€¦I had a terrible first night so I spoke to reception about it: the problem is caused by the chemical they use to spray the carpet which I did see and smell myself checking out the cleaning staff supplies. Itâ€™s toxic!!! I asked not to spray that toxic stuff anymore in my room, I was even shown another room, but the smell was everywhere! So they gave me a little ozone machine which made the air better (almost breathable...), but still was not sufficient. I tried to stay out of the room as much as possible! Also the TV is not flat screen (not even 80 year old people have dated TVs in their homesâ€¦) and moreover it had a setting issue: it kept blocking programs and channels every 10 minutes so you had to switch it off and on again! I called reception and asked them to fix it in the morning which they did. Location is great if you want to be close to The Rocks, the Opera House and the ferries, but it is not too good for the city centre or the harbour (itâ€™s a long walk to the city centre and from the city centre you can take the monorail to the harbour: lots of restaurants open in the evening). We had breakfast included and it is worth it (even if staff is a bit slow in regards of filling the empty bowls at the buffetâ€¦), the restaurant is the best thing of the hotel. When I got back Marriott sent me a survey about my stay and I expressed my dissatisfaction. The hotel manager sent me back a letter advising that the hotel will undergo a refurbishment beginning next month which will bring the hotel up to 5* Marriott standard. Until then, I wouldnâ€™t go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, small room!”
Reviews.Author: aussieNSWcouple
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Mariott hotel is the LOCATION! A few minutes walk to Circular Quay, Opera House, Harbour Bridge etc etc = fantastic! We got a terrific a deal that included full buffet breakfast and valet parking. The staff were very professional and courteous throughout our stay. Check in and check out were smooth and trouble free. We were a little disappointed at the size of the room however. The bathroom was small but modern however the bath had a plastic shower curtain (wasn't expecting this in a five star hotel!) The room was tidy and smart however the pillows on the bed were pretty bad! Overall, a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Should Be Ashamed”
Reviews.Author: AFS5
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with our family while traveling in Australia. Although the location is excellent this was one of the worst Marriott properties I have ever been in. The rooms are indeed small and outdated. In addition the service was horrible. As a gold Marriott rewards member I had to even beg for a late checkout (just for an extra hour) and similarly when asking for other simple things the default attitude was always no. I would never stay at this property again given the quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “The executive lounge is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mensch999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the PERFECT location; and the service is fantastic. The new Marriott beds and TV's haven't made it down under yet - perhaps why others have said it is dated. As a Platinum Elite Rewards Member, we have become accustomed to the benefits of the executive floor and lounge; this one is amazing. The service (especially from Rosalie) was much appreciated, and the breakfast, evening snacks, and desserts were certainly appreciated in this very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAKABURA
Reviews.Content: Great Location, had a very easy check in process. The Location is brilliant .. The service was prompt and the quality of the rooms were very nice. The Bathroom was big with a separate glass enclosure. Had a breakfast outside the package at 20$ a special price we were told , it was quite adequate , although would we nothing in comparison to an Asian Hotel. The service at the restaurant could be better , but i am perhaps evaluating it on Asian standards when making that comment. By aussie standards it was excellent. Check out was quick and easy..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Surfrats
Reviews.Content: Location is within easy walking distance of excellent restaurants, harbor ferries, the botanical gardens, the Opera House, and the Rocks. Arrived in Sydney on an early flight from Los Angeles (6:10 AM) and no non-smoking rooms were available at that early hour. Reception staff was very friendly, efficient, and welcoming and directed us to the hotel's "Early Arrivals" suite that has coffee, tea, showers, and a plenty of seating that is available to all who arrive before their rooms are ready. We checked our luggage with the bell captain, had some coffee in the Early Arrivals suite, and took the harbor cruise. Although rooms are not guaranteed until 3:00 PM, the desk clerk suggested that we check back at 11:00 to see if a room was available, which we did, and it was. The room was spacious, well appointed, although a bit dated, and had an excellent view of the Harbour Bridge. We were particularly pleased with the concierge named Jonathan. He made excellent reccomendations for restaurants, in particular, The Chop House on Bligh Street, and Guillaume's in the Opera House. Another great suggestion was the Flying Fish in Darling Harbor. He was also very accommodating, making all of our dinner reservations, giving us maps, and outlining activities and providing excellent directions as well as arranging for transporation to the airport on our departure. Don't miss either the Botantical gardens or the wonderful zoo, that has spectacular views of the Sydney skyline.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but hotel rooms bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: marsc76
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights for work meeting. Hotel is in a good location. Rooms bit old and run down. Bed was hard as a rock and did not sleep for the 3 nights. Breakfast was nice however dinner was very slow in the restaurant and was very empty. Staff very friendly. Sheraton although on the other side is much nicer and more comfortable and better restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel...”
Reviews.Author: BusinessClass3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days in this superbly located hotel close to absolutely everything. However, this hotel is showing it's age and reminds me of how the Wentworth used to look like in the 1980's. This hotel needs a major overhaul. We were allocated the most unattractive room that was fitted out for disabled travellers. Despite this, the bed was comfortable and room clean. We did ring for room service which was prompt and the burgers were delicious. I also found the service in the main bar cheery and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: larsus
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the hotel is was the end of Winter, which means for Syndey they "only" have around 20C Degrees. My first impression of the hotel was really good. In front of it a lot of nice cars like Porsche, Mercedes and others. When than checked in which took around 5 Minutes, we had a prepaid room so I only needed to sign and that was that. We got an early check in (at 8 o'clock in the morning) Really great! We then arrived in our hotel room, it was an appropiate size and really nice. The Tv was not a flat screen Tv but still had a good selection of channels. The bathroom was really nice, looked really clean and the bath tub was really nice and wide. We pre wanted bath robes and slippers we clicked them at the online service this hotel offers, but no bathrobes or slippers were in our room. I called the "at your service" service and asked them for a couple of bathrobes and slippers and five minutes later we had them. We also ordered a tooth cleaning set and a shaving set. Both sets were free. All in all the hotel is a really nice one, if you dont mind an analogue Tv or having to call reception to get aminities it is a really nice one. It could get a new look on the outside as the outside is not that nice. Than they should have free Gym trainers and maybe have a sun deck were the sun actually gets to, all those little things and a few more minor things make my review a 4 Point one instead of a 5 point one. On a personal scale I would give it 4.5 Stars. If I return to Sydney I know were I will stay. If you do book this hotel see that you get the pre paid option as that one is a lot cheaper :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location to see sights of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most of the major hotels in Sydney - but the Marriott has the best location of them all (apart from Park Hyatt!!) We got a random wotif deal where you don't know the hotel before you book. Caught the train from the airport right to the door (Circular Quay station). Easy 2 minute walk with bags from there. Rooms are ok, quite nice but not 5 star standard. Nice bathroom. Also had problems with aircon, even on full cold the whole weekend the room was just bareable to sleep in (very stuffy and warm). The gym is a full gym (for office people during the week) and is one of the best I have seen in a hotel. Nice bar in the foyer with great service. But really, stay here for the location. Close to Opera House, ferries to Manly, Harbour Bridge, the Rocks, restaurants, theatre. You name it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but in need of a makeover...”
Reviews.Author: OutdoorFreak
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location - right by Circular Quay - but the decor is really, really dated. It really needs renovation. The air con was broken in the room we stayed in so it was difficult to sleep. When I asked for it to be looked at after the first night, the temperature actually increased to around 30 degrees, which, as you can imagine, was unbearable. On the positive side, the gym is fantastic. The pool on the other hand is tiny; not possible to do laps, really just for kids to play in... although there is a "proper" spa pool to use after your workout. Next time I'm in Sydney I'll be looking for a more modern hotel in the same area...

Reviews.Title: “it's what you would expect from marriot”
Reviews.Author: greeny24
Reviews.Content: it was a very nice hotel, i even got a room with a nice view. obviously a great location for all circular quay and the rocks area activities. very easy to take the train to/from the airport. the staff was not as friendly here, but nothing to ruffle my feathers over.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Sydney Harbour has the best location in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: bluewater113
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter, and I stayed at this hotel for five nights last January. We were using Marriott points for our rooms and were given two rooms with a city view. We asked to be upgraded to an upper floor with a view of the harbor and the opera house. We were willing to pay extra for it. For an extra $50 a day we were well rewarded. Our rooms were on the next to the top floor overlooking the harbor as well as the Royal Botanical Gardens. Prince William was visiting while we were there, and we watched a 'picnic' in his honor at the Gardens. The hotel is being refurnished. The first rooms we were shown had not been redecorated, but the new ones were. Much nicer and larger, too. The hotel was much like the Marriott in Boston where we have stayed many times. All of the workers at the hotel were friendly and accommodating. We could walk to almost everything, and cab rides were short. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WIBadgergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Marriott Sydney Harbour. Perfect location - just a short walk to the harbour and a beautiful view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Rooms were cozy and perfect. We enjoyed every bit of our stay! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dynamite2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Harbour for 3 nights and everything was perfect. Loved it, fabulous location! I must admit that I have no idea about the charges for the internet, breakfast, and so on, i just slept there, used the fitness room and the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Stay at the best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: burger01
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived everything was taken care of. Staff were amazing with their attention to detail, friendiness, and professional service. The room we stayed in was very clean, in good repair....everything worked ! Room service was also great, we very much enjoyed a late night club sandwich after a big night out. Thanks Sydney Habour we had a great time in your hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sandnsun61
Reviews.Content: We splurged on 2 nights at the Marriott Circular Quay executive level room for our last two nights in Australia and it was work every penny. As already state, the location is second to none. We enjoyed the food and service provided in the executive lounge and honestly, although we payed a higher room rate for an executive room, we might have saved a bit on food expenditures. Sydney is a pricey little city, but we loved it. From the Marriott, we walked over to The Rocks for an incredible twilight Harbour Bridge walk ... what an experience! All in all, a great Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: 10Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott for four nights...in twin room as there was 4 of us...we had a welcoming stay, the staff/conceige were extremely lovely and so so helpful, the hotel in itself was one of luxury, the location was the bonus, so close to the transport facilities, buses, ferries at Cirular Quay and trains...we caught the train from the Airport...too good. We had breakfast only on one of the mornings and it was lovely and the variety was endless. The only minor downside is that we thought the room was a little bit too small but we managed. Would definately stay there again just simply for its location and overall luxury feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: soum03
Reviews.Content: Must recommend this one to anyone who wants to stay near the city ....awesome location ....meters from the circular quay railway station , bus stop , ferries...stayed with family ..got a king bed and a rollaway bed (complimentary !) ....break fast was included and was great.....service was very good ....loved the valet parking ! Overall i loved my stay at the hotel and would love to recommend it to anyone with a family :) Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel very close to harbour with fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: Minniebrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night last week and were upgraded to a suite room which was very nice! We had a nice view of the opera house & harbour from our room. The hotel was great and breakfast was also nice. Do yourself a favour if you are staying here and go to Cafe Sydney which is in the Customs House right next to the hotel...best food I have ever eaten!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: nic0ls
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel in a great location. Concierge help and information was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cinedra
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the location (1 block from harbour) and the service (got upgraded to a 1bdrm spa suite on arrival). They did have a small suite for early arrivals or late departures to stay if you had to check out of your room (had internet, TV, bathroom, shower, coffee) which was a plus as our flt left at 7pm and we had to check out of our room at 1pm. Good concierge service, nice pool jacuzzi, and gym for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Non Smokers”
Reviews.Author: p2roger
Reviews.Content: Spent the Queens' Birthday weekend there, never ever again. Stick with what you know either the Stanford or Amora both near the Quay. Booked with Watif .com @$289/night, that's OK. When we got there to book in we were told that the room was a smokers room and that if we wished to upgrade to a non smoking room we would have to pay an extra $100. I think this tactic is outrageous, if not legally questionable certainly morally wrong. They have 6 lifts only two working which resulted in waiting 30 minutes to get down to breakfast. Some people were using the service lifts, would love to see what WorkCover have to say about that. The room stank like an ashtray and the decor was stained and very tired looking. BEWARE YOU DON'T FALL FOR THIS TACTIC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View, ambience and comfort...”
Reviews.Author: FearlessAbhay
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for more than 2 times...I was always given a preferred room on top floors. View of Sydney city, especially Harbour Bridge and Opera House, was fantastic...Relaxing in the rooom was the mossssst peaceful moments ever i spent...Thanks to JW Marriot staff and their cooperation in all aspects..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Glitch33
Reviews.Content: I stayed for ten nights on a business trip. No great surprises for a Marriott hotel. My room on the 18th floor was apparently upgraded to a Harbour View - see the picture. It was a neck craning exercise but I could see part of the bridge. You need your room key to select your floor in the lift. Good for security but it's a bit fiddly and sometimes take a few attempts. The room was comfortable. A good sized desk for working. A big chair to dump clothes on and a kingsize bed. The bed was great and gives a good sleep. Plenty of room in the wardrobe with lots of hangers. I could have done with a bit more drawer space for my length of stay but not a major problem. I don't know why hotels don't make lighting controls easier. There are a couple of lamps around the room and it would be better to have all controls by the bed. There was a good size TV with plenty of channels but no BBC World! The bathroom was size adequate. A very good powerful hot shower and fluffy towels. The big mirror steams up but with my face that's probably a blessing. Everything was kept very clean. Checking in and out was slick and efficient. I had problems with my internet connection (due to my company security policy) but the Philipines based Domoco help desk were excellent and got it working. I had to use the laundry service during my stay. All very efficient but expensive. I only used the restuarant once for breakfast on the first day. A pretty good buffet but at A$35 it is expensive. With the current exchange rate of about 1.66 against the weak British Pound I couldn't justify that price for a quick pre-work breakfast. On top of the that the coffee was awful. Only go if you are really hungry and not a coffee drinker. There is a cafe right next door that was popular and did a good looking English Breakfast and decent coffee for a fraction of the price. I didn't eat at the restaurant in the evening. The bar in the lobby is pretty quiet and no atmosphere. There are plenty of better, cheaper bars in the immediate vicinity. There is another bar attached to the hotel - Custom House Pub which is more lively with outdoor seating and heaters.It had a good selection of beers and bar food. The chcken satay was enormous and tasty. Only problem is that you can only get to it by walking around the outside of the hotel. My colleagues were on the executive floor and I was lucky enough to join them in the exec lounge most nights. A worthwhile upgrade. The free drinks saved me a fortune! One of the key benefits of this hotel is the location. It is 100m from Circular Quay so you can easily walk to The Bridge and the Opera House. The Rocks is a few minutes walk away and from the quay there are frequent ferries to lots of places around the Sydney area. I would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service”
Reviews.Author: LisaMu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott and were pleasantly surprised by the great location at the Quay. Also our room which was classed as a city view room, also had views of the Harbour Bridge and Lavendar Bay. Breakfast selection was great, particularly the freshly made omlettes, yum. Also super comfy beds. Totally recommend the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hniki234
Reviews.Content: This was our third and last stop on our honeymoon. It was a great location and a nice, comfortable room. We booked a room with an Opera House view and the view turned out to be pretty good. It was definitely not a crane-your-neck-really-far-and-you-can-see-it type of view. Honestly, the best aspect is its location, though. It's on Pitt street which has plenty of shopping, and it is only a short walk to Circular Quay. And, the 30-40 minute walk to Darling Harbour wasn't bad either! I would recommend this hotel to others. In fact, when we travel to Sydney again in the future, we will book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: JochEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel near the Opera house and harbour is absolutely superb and well worth a visit. The service is excellent, the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable with all the home from home comforts. There are rooms with views of the opera house available although we had a city view. The location is excellent and the staff very helpful. The fitness centre is excellent with very friendly staff althoug I would have preferred a bigger pool. That is my only criticism. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The very best of everything”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Mintus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 2704 with a view of Sydney Harbour (the opera house and circular quay). The upgrade to this room was well worth it. The hotel really has the very best of everything...feather and down quilts and pillows that are incredibly comfortable (as are the beds), great amenities, amazing service (particularly the concierge Wilson who was so helpful in recommending great places to eat...highly recommend the Neptune Palace for Chinese Malay style cuisine a couple of doors down from the hotel towards Circular Quay) and a great location...just a couple of minutes walk to Circular Quay. I got a deal on the Marriott website for 3 nights for the price of 2 making it great value. The room, whilst small, is very well furnished and laid out. The cocktail lounge is a lovely place to have a quiet drink or coffee and the room service is quick, efficient and friendly. The staff and surrounds really make this an amazing place to stay. I also had a hot stone massage in the day spa which was well worth it! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastD2105
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for eight nights in early April. The location is fantastic. Close to the ferry docks and easy walk to the Rocks and downtown. The staff here are excellent. especially the restaurant and the concierge lounge. The rooms are typical North American Marriott style - great beds and pillows. From what we heard of other hotels in the area, the Marriott at Circular Quay is the best choice. We would stay there again if we go to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect week of vacation”
Reviews.Author: JackEauClaire
Reviews.Content: Quite simply a perfect week-long stay in the middle of everything Sydney has to offer. Friendly and efficient staff. Impeccably clean. Less than a block from the hub of mass transit, including ferries, buses and trains. It was the perfect place to spend our last week downunder.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great beds - small room”
Reviews.Author: GDBW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night in transit for an international flight the next day and found the room and bed to be very comfortable and very clean. The room was a little tired around the edges and very small. We thought the room to be reasonable value for money, and enjoyed having late-night cocktails in the lounge downstairs. The live music provided was very good, however, we felt it was too lively for late in the evening ... more mellow, slow music would have suited the late evening, relaxing period. This hotel is very close to Circular Quay train station ... we were very easily able to wheel our suitcases from the station to the Hotel ... it would have been pointless taking a taxi the approximately 200 metres. There are lots of different eateries around catering to all tastes and budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ladybug006
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here & were very happy as the location was so central to the harbour. We were able to walk everywhere. Our room was spacious with just a glimpse of a view. The desk service was great & we enjoyed the lounge for afternoon drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Location - excellent in all categories”
Reviews.Author: kjrvmsi
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and a bit of a hotel snub but I was super impressed with my 6 day 5 night stay at the Mariott Sydney Harbour Circular Quay. I arrived the hotel at 8am via a 15 hour plane ride from LAX and the staff checked me into my room immediately (even though the normal check in time is not until 3pm). The room was well equipped and you can order robes and other amenities by calling the the front desk. The bath room was spacious with a tub and shower stall. The hotel is also very quiet - you don't hear any noise in the hall way at all or the people in the next room (unlike many other large hotels. The location was the best part of the hotel. It is walking distance from everything (opera house, the rock, harbour bridge, china town, QVB shopping center) and the train station Circular Quay stop is right around the corner. In fact we can see the opera house from our hotel room. If you are a Mariott hotel elite members you also get access to the executive lounge which is open EVERYDAY. Many of the mariott hotels in US close the executive lounge on weekend. This was great because it allows me to grab breakfast on site without having to leave the hotel each morning. The executive lounge also has complementary wi-fi service. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, worth every penny...”
Reviews.Author: kfr-usa
Reviews.Content: The staff go out of their way to nsure satisfaction, the weekend buffet is fantatsic. The hotel's location is pefect and within walking distance to evrything, a shrt ferry ride takes you to Manly beach .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Manya22
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great staff. Was upgraded to room with a view. We really enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: colg1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. The location and staff make it special. What a great location. This is just a block off the harbor, about 2 blocks from the Rocks and 3 blocks from the Botanical Gardens. Room is typical of a US-style hotel room, which means it is big enough for a family of four. The view of the harbor from our room was amazing. Food is first class, especially the breakfast. The hotel staff are very nice and gives 5-star service (including storing our bags for 4 days for free). Kid friendly. Use their concierge staff, who are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location...”
Reviews.Author: sbajb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here twice. Both times we have had really good experiences. The first time we were traveling with our teenage son, and the second time we were alone. The Marriott Circular Quay's best feature is the location! :-) The first time, we have been on an extensive trip thru New Zealand and Australia and called the concierge ahead of time to have some intricate plans followed. They consisted of picking up members of our family, taking them from the local cruise ship terminal, on a tour, then on to the airport, additionally... picking up our luggage and storing it at the hotel, until we would arrive a few weeks later. When we arrived from the driving portion of our trip, weeks later,weary from the road we had all but forgotten about our bags....we arrived to our room, and our bags we waiting, just as planned without a hitch, with a note from the concierge...saying welcome to Sydney. The service of the concierge at the Marriott Circular Quay is professional and we called on them for their services a few times during both of our stays. They offer quick advice and are very helpful. They allow most things to be billed back to the room, which is nice when you dont carry a lot of foreign currency. On our first trip we had booked two rooms on the concierge level. At check in, the manager on duty asked us if we would like to upgrade to a "duplex". Naturally, we said of course. What a great surprise. The duplex was actually a 3 bedroom suite, which included a large living/dining room, kitchen, 2 bathrooms and large grand staircase. The view was fantastic of the harbour,and Opera house. With the duplex came perks such as, access to the concierge lounge, a gift basket and other things of that nature. Unfortunately, on our second visit, we booked our room using Marriott points and there were no upgrades available(either with cash or points) at check in so we were relegated to a standard room. After the duplex that was a let down. The location of the hotel is top flight. Within walking distance to shops, restaurants, bars, and all the touristy things you would want to do in Sydney. Sydney reminds us of a "clean", compact San Francisco. It has a great charm to its waterfront area, and the cafes are not to be missed. Although we didnt utilize it, many of the restaurants are open 24 hours. Whether it is for coffee, tea, or a quick sandwich, a walk along the area adjacent to Circular Quay is a great way to spend at least one day. There are a lot of souvenir shops who seem to be undercutting each other in the area. The hotel has "free" WiFi in the concierge lounge but charges an astronomical 25.00 a day for it in the regular guest rooms. It you are in a standard guest room, save your money and go to the Starbucks around the corner where the Internet is something like 6.00 an hour, or do what the locals do, and sit outside the Mc Donald's and borrow it for free! We were surprised that the Internet in the lobby of the hotel is not free either. If you didn't bring a lap top the hotel has a business center and sells cards for the internet. The food at the hotel is really good. We especially like ordering room service and it was delivered quickly and served hot, and as ordered. The selection is good and the prices were reasonable. The gym at the hotel is really pretty good. But be forewarned there is not an outdoor pool, and consequently, there is not anywhere to sit if you are interested in sitting in the sun. You will have to save that for the cafes on the wharf. There is an onsite Avis car rental/return which is really very convenient. On our first trip we had scheduled to rent a Hertz car but when we saw that they had an Avis on site we changed our reservation. You can actually return the car to the valet at the hotel. 1, 2, 3 and you are done. They will even take the car and get gas for you, if you like. At the suggestion of a local we took the bus to Bondi beach. DON"T. Its a long crowded ride, and makes dozens of stops. If you really want to go, take a cab. The high-light of our trip this time was seeing AC /DC. They were amazing. What a fantastic show! WE, and about 60,000 of our best friends rocked out. They played all of their hits and it was an incredible night. We had hired a car thru the concierge and he did a great job of waiting for us. Over all the hotel is really nice. The elevators can get backed up but that seems to be our only real complaint.

Reviews.Title: “OVER PRICED -AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: janebUk
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Vacation club owner and am very familiar with the Marriott Brand Worldwide. I have to say that this hotel lived up to no expectations. The rooms were average if not a little small. The Room service was expensive and the choice limited. The Bar meals also too expensive and far too long to arrive(and undercooked) Charges for Wi Fi in the lobby was the last straw! All in all we felt ripped off with the whole thing not even a complimentary newspaper. Mr Marriott hang your head in shame

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: rexbarker
Reviews.Content: I expect something speciall from Marriott when I'm paying quite a bit for the room. Yes it's full service Marriott but the room was average in size and no balconiesetc and if you want a decent view you have to pay an extra $100 / night. Good location for tourist things, bt that's where the good news stops!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Heleniii
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really disappointing- jaded, dated decor, disinterested reception staff and not much use paying for a view when the windows are so dirty. No newspaper (as requested) and an extra charge for using a Visa card. Only good point was the location. Much better value at the Westin (and no I am not paid by them!) What a contrast.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jvo621
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbour for 5 nights, March 11-16 and were extremely happy with our stay. The location cannot be beat! One short block to the harbor and all of the sights there â€“ the Harbour Bridge, First Fleet Park and all of the street entertainment, the Opera House, Royal Botanical Gardens and Circular Quay and the ferries. Also adjacent to The Rocks which offers lots of dining, entertainment and shopping options. You can also walk to Darling Harbour and QVB if you donâ€™t want to take a bus. Another bonus is being very close to the bus stops and the train station, all located at Circular Quay. The hotel room itself was practically perfect! We had room 2008 with 2 double beds, and it was very roomy with a large bathroom- big tub, lots of counter space, well lit and excellent water pressure. The bed was so comfortable! Another review here mentioned that the room need refurbishment but I donâ€™t agree at all. Maybe the furniture wasnâ€™t brand new but it was relatively new, well-appointed and in excellent condition. Not a flat screen TV, as also noted in another review, but not what I judge a hotel by. Very clean, and the room was always quickly made up. The only shortcoming is there are only 2 dresser drawers, but, I always pack a supply of those wire dry-cleaner hangers and hang every thing up! The closet does offer 10 wooden hangers by the way, generous. You may want to bring your own hair dryer though, the one they have didnâ€™t do a very good job on my thick hair. All of the employees were consistently in good spirits, smiling and helpful; which I value in a hotel. We were always greeted with a smile when we left and entered. The front desk clerks were very helpful in providing information and assistance about the area. Our room wasnâ€™t ready of course because we arrived early morning. But we walked around the area which was welcome after a long flight, we had an excellent lunch at the CQ CafÃ©, and went back to the hotel at 2pm and found our room ready and our bags, which they held for us, were already in the room. I suggest changing your money there too. They donâ€™t charge a service fee as do all of the other â€œMoney Changingâ€� locations all over the city. Bottom line: Stay at this hotel! We will if we ever go back. No reason to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but there is better value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JandJAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We usually stay elsewhere in Sydney but could not get into our preferred hotels for this trip. The hotel is in a great location at Circular Quay - perfect for some of the excellent restaurants that abound in Sydney. The hotel is a bit 80's in decor in both the reception and the rooms. The rooms were comfortable if dated - CRT TV in dodgy dark wood cupboard. The bathroom had a separate shower which is much nicer than the usual shower over the bath. The sheets were nice but the towels were not - way too small! The extra cost for an Opera House view was not warranted. In our case - the view was rather oblique and whilst you could see the Opera House it was pretty much a city view with harbour glimpses. The service was excellent and all in all it was a pleasant stay. Would I stay there again? Yes, but only if my preferred hotels were not available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location however misleading image for room with direct view of Opera House misleading.”
Reviews.Author: JBCO
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel rooms are now a little dated, its location is ideal and service generally good. Unfortunately the surcharge for a room on the upper levels with a direct opera house view was in part misleading - particularly when compared with the view on the Marriott's website as well as other websites. It's a great view as long as you stand directly at the window. What set a poor tone for the stay, was the response from the Front Desk Supervisor about the room. Despite some sound professional service by his team members earlier in the day, the supervisor's response was crude and the situation poorly managed.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott formula executed with excellence”
Reviews.Author: mickmacs007
Reviews.Content: The Marriott formula is very well executed at this hotel. Given that the formula brings many common features like room size, beds and concierge services, Marriott operated properties distinguish themselves based on location and service. The Sydney Marriott is very well located and service is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: We travelled from the US and stayed here 2 nights. This is a nice hotel, but it really is just an "upscale" Marriott, so 5 stars is a bit of a stretch. As with all Marriotts, the beds are very comfortable. The hotel was clean. Service was pretty good, but when we arrived and were supposed to have "early check in" after being on a plane for almost 24 hours alltogether, they did not offer us use of the Exec Lounge even though we had an Exec level room. When we left they DID give us that opportunity and were totally, totally inflexible on any kind of late checkout. We did eat in the restaurant one night and was most unimpressed. Our view which was to be the best offered was pretty nice, but agian it isn't a direct view. Overall I just thought this hotel was overpriced. As is just about everything in Sydney, so the truth is I would probably stay here again. Comfortable, beautifully decorated, clean, maidservice very convenient, absoultely EXCELLENT location.

Reviews.Title: “Got there in the end!”
Reviews.Author: beansontoast11
Reviews.Content: As a treat for our final 2 nights in sydney I booked me and my girlfirend into the marriott on circular quay. When we went to check in we felt a little out of place as we had never experienced 5 star before. We arrived before our room was due to be ready and asked if we could leave our bags, the bell desk happily arranged to take our bags and said that they would take them to our room when it was ready. Upon arriving at 3pm to check in we were told our room was not ready yet, so we were given a pass for the executive suite so that we could freshen up and relax if we wished. When we returned to finally check in , we were pleasantly surprised to find that we had been upgraded to an executive room and were on the 31st floor (out of 32) we had a fantastic view of the opera house and access to the executive lounge throughout our stay, nice touch! However when gettign to our room our bags were not there and so we could not change in order to go out for dinner, so we left it a while until eventually our bags turned up and we could get changed and go out again. The bed was the comfiest we have experienced and absolutely huge. Good selection of channels on the television. The only draw back to our stay was the random noises from the toilet and the shower deciding to gush water sporadically! Other than that a lovely stay at the hotel and a great way to finish off a brilliant holiday in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew PB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 13 nights in January/February in an Opera House view room (2225) so think I have a fairly good' grasp' of the hotel. In my view by far the best point/plus of the hotel is it's position which must be the best at Circular Quay. The ferries, restaurants and Opera House are only a few minutes away. Whatever faults the hotel may have and it does have some, they are in my opinion more than outweighed by its wonderfully convenient and central location. My Opera House view room was as far down he corridor as possible to get the best view of it and the ferries at circular quay.It is worth pointing out that the Opera House is not directly ahead looking out of the window but in my case was to the left and the general view is not helped by high rise buildings. I have attached 2 photos of the view from the room but with the zoom lense probably make the view seem better than it actually is, by taking out the high buildings. However I consider it well worth the extra cost. Not only great views of the Opera House and some of the ferry wharfs but also out in the direction of Manly - obviously, the higher the floor the better the view. I was very happy in my room for nearly a fortnight but I would say it is in need of a refurb. Perhaps a little dark and certainly the television needs upgrading to a flat screen. A comfortable, large bed although storage space for clothes was somewhat lacking. I did get back to my room at 4.50pm one evening not long after I arrived and was amazed that it hadn't been made up. In fairness it was made up immediately after my call and afterwards I completed a card on which you can specify what time you would like your room made up. In future it was made up every day without fail within my requested time so a negative turned into a plus. They do have a good system here where basically you only have to telephone one number - 9, for any service you may require - i.e room make up, room service etc. I had a few meals in my room and the service was quick and efficient. Breakfasts were good but not cheap at $35 - why don't they do hash browns for breakfast?! A very large restaurant which is needed on occasions when do they do have large coach parties in. One morning and only one morning it was absolute chaos with the staff simply being understandably unable to cope with sudden influx of about 80 for breakfast. Try and get a window view table - not a great view but nice and quiet. I would recommend the Custom House bar which belongs to the hotel - at the back beyond receptiol, particularly the al fresco section on the street. Great atmosphere and good, cheapish food - fish and chips were wonderful. This is a large and very busy hotel and there can be frustrating delays normally at peak times for lifts which you don't generally experience at similar standard hotels. There are three computers with internet access in the business centre - $10 an hour. However for at least a week one was out of order which I found completely unacceptable. I appreciate the responsibility for them is outsourced but a hotel like this should have the clout to get the wretched thing repaired inside 24 hours. I have now stayed here twice in the last 14 months and would do so again. I would class it as around a 4.5* hotel with it prime benefit being its brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on my honeymoon and it was very nice. The hotel itself had a great location. Literally 5minute walk to the harbour. We got one of their suites which is located on the top floor (32 floors to be exact) however the room was so small...I couldnt believe for a suite..it was just your regular hotel room. The only bonus to the suite was they offered free breakfast which was great. The hotel staff was great. Unfortunately I have family in sydney so I didn't get to check out any of the restaurants around there because my family didn't leave us alone the whole 5 nights we were there. However it was still a great hotel and even though the room was small...I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: sackabone
Reviews.Content: Excellant location.Great clean and tidy hotel,only downside was paying the extra money to upgrade to a opera house view.Wasnt a good view and not worth the extra $400 paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Travels2010
Reviews.Content: Our purpose for the visit was to catch up with relatives in Sydney, and show the kids the sights of Sydney. The hotel is is a perfect location if you are travelling using the ferries, buses and trains to get around. We deceided to upgrade to the "Club", wish although nice does seem to get very crowded as it is quite small, and the views from it are somewhat limited. The rooms were very much Marriott style, BUT could be viewed as needing modernising. The Opera House view was the focus of the room, and although partially blocked by the neighbouring building, it did live up to expectations. We ate in house, and we found both the buffet dinners and breakfasts were excellent , especially the seafood. We also used the pool area which was very good, and was really enjoyed by the kids and adults alike. We really enjoyed the lobby bar each night on our return from sightseeing, where the staff were friendly and attentive. In summing up a very nice hotel in a location that can not be beaten, at a price that does break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scooterguy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, which were all over the place, I was concerned on what we would be getting. To my pleasant surprise, we had no problems with this hotel. We arrived mid-morning and they had rooms available, even upgrading us to a room with a view of the Sydney Bridge at no extra charge. The desk clerk was polite and efficient. We were on h 16th floor and the elevators all seemed to work fine. Our room was clean and comfortable, and included an electric "tea pot", for lack of a better term (it heated water) for tea or instant coffee, a mini-refrigerator and a snack-bar (which we did no use). We asked to have the beverages removed from the fridge, and in few minutes, two staff were at the room to take them out. The bed was very comfortable. We could not have had a better location. Circular Quay is only a 5 minute walk! There was a convenience store directly across the street from the hotel entrance. We purchased some milk, cereal and plastic bowls and had breakfast in the room each morning. Room service breakfast is extremely expensive: $28AUD for a continental breakfast! Food is very expensive in Sydney. We found food courts to be the best deal, especially for lunches. There is a food court across the street from Circular Quay which is open only on weekdays which provided a great variety of food at reasonable prices. There were two kiosks nearby which sold bottled water for only $1AUD. The Circular Quay deli on the same side of the street as the ferry terminal was also a good choice. Given the variety of the prior reviews, this hotel and staff exceeded my expectations, even though I would not consider it to be five star facility.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Harbour Marriott - Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanSusan
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel in an executive room at the end of January. We arrived early after disembarking from our cruise ship and although there was no room available, we were directed to an arrivals lounge set aside for executive room guests. Our room was ready by 1:00pm and it was a large corner room. The room was spotless and welcoming although I think that the rooms in general are ready for a refurbishment as the decour and overall feel of the rooms is not in the same class as other hotels in this price range. An example of this is the large clunky cabinet that houses the old fashioned TV. The rooms are a little dark. The location of this hotel cannot be bettered as it is minutes from all of the main attractions / shopping areas of Sydney. Another advantage for executive room guests is the executive lounge. Someone has already mentioned that the lounge is not particularly large but we never had a problem getting seats at breakfast nor at 5:30pm at "happy hour" . We were told that if the lounge was full at breakfast, then staff would give guests a voucher to have breakfast in the main dining room on the first / second floor. The executive lounge has the longest "happy hour" that we have come across starting at 5:30pm and closing at 9:30pm. Once again, we never had difficulty getting a seat and the service in the lounge was excellant. The views from the lounge are limited but I belive that originally the views were wonderful and unobstructed until an insurance company built a very large building in front of the hotel thus severely restricting the views. This hotel is very good but I think that it will need to refurbish the rooms and moderise them in order to stay competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnbernhardt
Reviews.Content: What more could you want in Sydney. Close to the harbour and city. Gorgeous hotel with wonderful staff. A true experience...

Reviews.Title: “Sluggish service and offensive smelling room”
Reviews.Author: PandA2035
Reviews.Content: After a sluggish check in we headed up to L24. The odour was overpowering as we departed the lift and simply offensive in the assigned and unimpressive room. Our first call to reception confirmed we were in a non-smoking room as requested and they offered to send a staff member to investigate. After a wait a staff member arrived with a can of air freshener and explained the whole floor was a smoking floor. We again rang reception who offered to send someone up with a key for another room on another floor. After a long wait, we headed down to reception and requested a refund as we were very frustrated and disappointed with the service. We were offered an upgrade eventually but we weren't keen to stay a moment longer and went home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms but sufficient”
Reviews.Author: rabbitt1995
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.... Walk into lobby and OMG! Marble everywhere, huge lobby... Room was not what I expected... Small but sufficient... I would highly, highly recomend these two places for dinner; Gaucho Grill & Lowmbrau...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here just for the pillows......”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtraveller13
Reviews.Content: The best place ever for pillows! Location excellent and we found the staff courteous and helpful, the concierge especially. Our room was probably coming up to needing refurbishment (but spotlessly kept) and if you have a room that has a connecting door, any noise filters through quite badly. I had a top-class massage and facial.All-in-all had a very good and restful time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: RPMNashua_NH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay in late November, 2009, and for its location alone, I highly recommend it. So many places that Sydney tourists want to see are close by! The hotel was a standard Marriott. Nothing extraordinary, but I had a nice clean room, there was a grand lobby, good restaurants (on the expensive side), etc. The gym was kind of small, but decent. I really enjoyed my stay, but at the risk of being repetitive, it was primarily because of the location. Don't get me wrong, the hotel was very nice, but it is fairly expensive, so I would expect it to be nice. It was similar to other Marriott's I have stayed in, which is not a bad thing. It was good, but not extraordinaily so. Did I mention that is situated in a great location? :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Blanca36
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was everything that we expected from Marriott.....quick, professional, friendly service and an above average atmosphere. We had an end room on the 16th floor a little larger than normal since we had a third person on a roll-away bed which was there when we checked in (and an early check-in with no problems getting our room right away). Great location near the Opera House, Harbor, etc.... Plenty of restaurants nearby to chose from and the train is one block away to access other areas of Sydney or the Blue Mountains, which we toured. The in-house restaurant was very expensive to us (I guess with 5 people and the U.S. dollar being pretty weak) when we check on a seafood buffet on Christmas Eve and was told $110.00 per person. Ouch. Didn't eat there. The pool/hot tub facilities are nice and sauna was great. Hot tub had some jets inoperative and was small for a Marriott in my opinion but it wasn't too busy. Gym was fantastic and locker rooms were clean and modern. We stayed a week and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Sydney Harbour - Oct 2009”
Reviews.Author: SamrahQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night coming from Hamilton Island and leaving for London the next evening. The concierge was very helpful in providing information on the best tours and areas to walk around on my short stay. I was able to keep my luggage at the hotel the next day after checking out, as my flight was not till the evening. Ideally, this hotel is more suited to business/ older travellers, but i appreciated the grandeur of the hotel on my lonesome. I ordered breakfast room service, although quite expensive, its worth it as you get a huge selection, there was enough to feed 2!! ... I asked for an Opera House view and on this alone, i have rated 5 out of 5. For my first time in Sydney i couldn't have asked for a better view :)

Reviews.Title: “No big deal”
Reviews.Author: Natdl11
Reviews.Content: We had asked for early arrival and that pretty much became non existant when we arrived early. We then had to wait in a room for early arrivals that was not all that impressive. After paying all that money Wii-Fi was not even free! It was a clean room and the bed was really comfortable. The location was great too. Right down the road from The Rocks, The Harbor Bridge, the Opera House, The Museum, and the Botanical Garden!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel with an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Speedywheeler
Reviews.Content: Within a short distance to the Opera House, the Circular Quay docks for the various Sydney ferries, and the Rocks shopping area, this hotel is in a fantastic location. Our room was spacious and confortable, and the staff was extremely helpful, especially the concierge who made several wonderful recommendations on things to do while we were in Sydney. The buffet breakfasts were the best that we had on our three week trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - short walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: BrusselSpr0ut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the first 4 days of our 2 week trip to Australia, using our marriott reward points. The hotel is what you'd expect from a 4 star marriott in a major metropolitan city: grand lobby, lots of marble, separate concierge stand with lots of helpful info. The rooms were updated, bed was very comfortable. We decided not to spend extra $ or points for the opera house view since we thought we'd rather GO to the opera house than view it from the room... good decision. We really didn't spend much time in our room at all, so a room on a high floor with a different view of the Sydney skyline was fine. The best part of this hotel was the location - it's literally 1 block from circular quay, the ferries, the many outdoor brasseries, the opera house, the botanical garden, the quirky rocky streets of former convict neighborhood "The Rocks" and all the pubs and cafe's you could ever want to explore. The only downside for us was the somewhat long taxi ride from Sydney airport. Our drive in took over an hour and cost 60 AUS$. I think we hit morning traffic. The taxi back to the airport was only 45 AUS$. At the end of our trip we stayed for a final night at the other Marriott in Sydney (by Hyde Park) and it was not nearly as nice -- rooms were not updated and the location was quite a distance from most of the attractions/sites of Sydney. If you're deciding between the two, definitely go for the Harbour Marriott in Circular Quay!

Reviews.Title: “looking a little tired”
Reviews.Author: melb0urnegirl
Reviews.Content: Sayed here for work and thought I might start adding my local experiences - this hotel is looking a little tired, rooms look dated and the club lounge was very sad compared to the Intercontinental's. It does not even have a view. On the flip side the service is very good, they allowed us to come back later in the day and use their "early arrivals lounge' to have a shower and get ready for our dinner reservation even though we had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne_G
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney to meet in the middle for a family get-together on Boxing Day. Reception is like an airport checkin - with all the noise and crowdedness. Breakfast was ordinary - I don't expect stale croissants from a 5 star hotel. You'd be better off staying at the Four Seasons, Sir Stamford at Circular Quay or the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryanmo
Reviews.Content: The worst 5* hotel I have ever stayed in. I booked 2 non-smoking room, however was checked into a smoking room. The whole floor had the most terrible smell of stale smoke. The bedroom honked. The sheets bedding,: everything had a strong aroma of stale smoke. The windows were sealed, so it was impossible to get any fresh air in. I immediately called reception to complain. They promised someone would call me back in "2 minutes". No call came back - so I went to reception to demand a non-smoking room as I had booked. The receptionist told me 'touch, we're full'. I advised them that if that was the case then I would bring the bed into the lobby and sleep there. Also, I was part of a trade mission and I advised I would advise my colleagues to check-out. The manager than appeared, and lo-and-behold, he 'managed' to find us 2 non-smoking rooms. No word of apology. Aside from that. The hotel looks dated, the rooms are 3* standard at most. Old and tatty furnishings, incomplete mini-bar. poorly equipped bathroom. Having paid oer $700 for the 2 rooms, I felt ripped off. Terrible place. Only positive is the location, but I'd rather be in a nice hotel with decent service ina suburb rather than this flea-pit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: jets63
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights including new years eve, we were upgraded to a suite and the staff and manager Kumar were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overhyped”
Reviews.Author: ccki
Reviews.Content: Opera House view for over 300 bones a night and opera house only visible from an acute angle of the room. At check in employees were pompous and not helpful. Then at check out tried to wrangle me for a $100 phone bill. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else-like the Hilton on George St-for the same price better service, amenities and executive access. Will not stay here again, nor another Marriot for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Ran down and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Tk100964
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel in August, mainly because of the location. The experience was a disappointing one. We booked a hotel transfer from the airport and had to queue 1 hour at immigration. The hotel driver who waited for us was clearly in a hurry and without even greeting us, he took our suitcase, rushed to the car and drove like a crazy maniac to the hotel. Not good. In the hotel, we had to queue have an hour for the check in. I am a Marriott gold member but we were put in a ran down room without a view. Though, the exec lounge at the top floor is nice and very enjoyable. During the last night, the neighbours in the room next to us held a little room party. I called the reception several times for an intervention. Nothing happened than security coming to the room and politely asking them to be quiet. They were at least with 6 people in the room but security did not do the necessary intervention. The next morning, I discussed it with the manager on duty and they decided to drop half of the roomrate for that night. A gesture, but not to change our opinion. As a gold member, I am usually very satisfied of the Marriott hotels. Though, this one is clearly an exception. They will not see me there again ! There are better choices around.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible elevators”
Reviews.Author: linteater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Marriott points. They told us they were upgrading us to a premium room because of my husband's status, but that we'd have to come back later when the room was ready. When we got back, I think they forgot because we ended up with a regular room without a view, which would have been fine, but then why tell us they were upgrading us? The location is wonderful. It's a short walk to Circular Quay, where there are a lot of shops and ferries departing, and about a 15-20 minute walk to the Opera House, beyond which is a very nice garden. The staff was very helpful in getting taxis and giving suggestions on places to eat as well.I didn't have time to try their fitness center, as the Quay had a lot of joggers and I prefer to run outside. The thing that breaks the deal is that the elevators for the hotel are just terrible. There are six elevators, which you'd think would make the wait time reasonable, but for some reason I think they only ran one at a time. (I don't think any were broken, as it would be a different elevator every time, but maybe they were) After a long wait just to get on the elevator, it wasn't uncommon to have 10+ stops just to traverse 15 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Becky15349
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a week's stay at the Marriot Circular Quay, and it was excellent. The service is very good, the rooms were very nice and had nice views, and the executive lounge is fantastic!! We highly recommend the executive lounge - the food is excellent, the service impeccable, and the cocktail hour is quite fun. My husband was there on business and I accompanied him, and I personally enjoyed this hotel because of the proximity to the quay because I frequently took ferries to the beaches and to the zoo - and also because of its promixity to the Royal Botanic Garden, which is a place you must visit while you are in Sydney. Overall, this hotel was excellent and I would recommend it to others looking for a hotel in the city with a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: texaslake
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to take the train to from the airport, get on the ferries to wherever--we went to the zoo, which had great views of Sydney Harbour. Not cheap of course, but worth it in terms of strolling along and just enjoying the view of the bridge and opera house. Had the breakfast at the hotel and the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Key To Any Great Vacation So Start Here”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9am and the hotel checked us in immediately. The rooms were average but I was upgraded to the concierge level because of my platinum status. The complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails were much appreciated. Beer, wine, alcohol and even champagne were provided. The staff is wonderful and the 24 hour gym is nicer than most hotels. The location is ideal because of the hotels proximity to the Rocks, Opera House, Botanical Gardens and Sydney Bridge. We took the city train from the airport for only $15 pp and its less than a block walk to the hotel. We took a bike tour the first day to get acquainted with the city. Don't miss Darling Harbor but eat at the Fish Market if you want good, affordable seafood. The Zoo is a great way to see kangaroos and koala bears but the wildlife park will allow you to touch them. Bondi Beach is a must see and take the ferry to Manly Beach for the views. Don't bother going to Hunter Valley for wine tasting as the better vineyards are in the Victoria region and don't go to the Blue Mountains unless its a clear day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with small lapse in service”
Reviews.Author: marcushall
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is on Pitt Street, a short walk south of Circular Quay and a short walk north of the Australian Securities Exchange. Check in took some time after the long flight from LA, but we were given access to a lounge to refresh ourselves. Once we checked into the room, we waited for over 90 minutes for the bellman to bring up our bags. I finally became so exasperated that I went to the lobby where I found them still on a baggage cart at the bellman's desk. I directed him to follow me to my room with the cart so that we could finally get access to some fresh clothes. Other than this unfortunate episode, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, view and service.”
Reviews.Author: Carly_808
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a three week long Australian adventure. Even though we did not look like the typical upscale hotel guest, with backpacks on and looking a bit jetlagged from a long flight, we were treated with superb service and felt very comfortable throught our stay. Upon arrival the bellmen and front desk agents showed a genuine sense of interest for our satisfaction of the hotel. All staff was very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a room with an amazing view of the Sydney Harbor Bridge. The sunrises were breathtaking from our room. Various forms of transportation and walking paths to explore the city are only a few steps away at Circular Quay, making the hotels location ideal. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone downhill in past 12 months, superb location though”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights in November 2009 for a mixed business/personal trip. I stayed here in november 2008 as well and this hotel is definitely sliding down hill. I will not stay here on my next trip to Sydney if I have a choice. THE GOOD: Check in was smooth and my room was ready before the standard check in time. The gym and pool are very nice. The location is superb- you are steps away from the harbor. If the breakfast buffet is included in your room rate, it is good- if not, it is a rip off. Internet works well. Check out was smooth. THE BAD: I found the service awful. My coworker left a package for me when she checked out. I asked the front desk for it- they sent me to the concierge. I asked the concierge for it- they sent me to the bell man. I asked the bell man for it- no luck. I went back to the front desk a few hours later and they finally found it- seriously though! The concierge is rude and not very helpful unless you have them do everything for you. I called to ask a question and was told they were busy so I went to the desk- there was no one in line. While I was speaking to the concierge, the phone rang, he took the call and told me he had to talk to that client and not me. They also do not have some basic things that a tourist would like including the ferry schedules. My bathroom had mildew in it. Internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel - it is set up to rip you off”
Reviews.Author: Con100
Reviews.Content: There were two positives for this hotel - the location and the quality of the room. Everything else was horrific and I travel a lot to many hotels! I paid a nice big price as I wanted to stay in a nice area with no hassles for my time in Sydney, but as soon as i arrived, I was being hit with 1) a credit card charge to pay the bill 2) internet at 20 bucks (fair enough, but not when you pay as much as I did for the hotel) 3) breakfast at 40 bucks for a very poor breakfast and because they were busy I was asked to wait for a while before I could order more coffee 4) a late check out charge 5) tips everywhere for everything - luggage, breakfast, etc., 6) extraordinary prices for drinks in the hotel bar (and i mean extraordinary) 7) all in all - well north of 200 dollars onto the end bill....for a two night stay!! Complete and utter rip off - when you pay top dollar (and I mean top dollar), most of the above should be included - at every stage of my stay I was under pressure to put my hand in my pocket or worse "get out of the hotel fast" as I wanted to avoid late charges. Reception were utterly contrite when I asked for help in locating a new hotel - which made me even madder and I am pretty mild mannered. simply I feel fleeced and ripped off - when I asked to speak to the manager - I never got to see him/her. Some Marriots are excellent, and this was why I stayed - never ever again - what has happened to Sydney and its friendly ways?

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location - Very Nice Lobby”
Reviews.Author: coolbreezesd
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for "safe bet", this would be a good choice. We paid $350/night and I expected a little more luxury. The location is very close to the Circular Quay (the transportation center) and all the other attractions. We had to work hard to get a partial Opera House View at the front desk. The hotel if very nice on the inside, but I felt the rooms seem dated and there was mold growing in our shower. I am a luxury traveler, if you are used to 5 star style service, design, and quality you will be disappointed. But, if you are looking for a standard luxury hotel, in a good location, and that is easy to say "Yes" to, you'll do just fine at this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location & Lovely Service”
Reviews.Author: nev_wayne
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriot for a business conference and stayed extra night. The hotel is perfectly suited, rooms very nice and clean, bed was terrific, no complaints. Had a no smoking floor and whilst had read bad reviews about a smell, found nothing or smelt nothing out of the ordinary. The staff were nice and efficient, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dhbrose
Reviews.Content: Great location. Helpful staff. Room was ready when we arrived at 11am from airport. Good size, very clean.. Avis is located at front of hotel. A few minutes walk to Circular Quay, and Rocks area. Main shopping is about 10 mins. Post Office and small cafe are next door but limited weekday hours. Cafe is good for a $10 Aussie breakfast of 2 eggs, bacon, and toast. Check out the Rocks for small cafe/restaurants and shopping and Sundays has a great outdoor market. Look for the G'Day Cafe in Rocks for reasonable light meals. Forget about Pia Mia Italian Restaurant. Very crowded and food and service were mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler34
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6 night stay at Marriott, and I have to give Marriott Sydney Harbour a first rate review. Location was great. As others have writen, it is convenient to Circular Quay, making transportation to other areas quick and easy. It is an easy walking distance to Quay, Opera House, Rocks, and Botanic Gardens. (The distances to these areas were judged to be quite walkable by my companion who is soon to have a knee replacement.) We paid just a bit more for rooms at executive level. I had a suite and my friend had a king room. Both had good views, and were quite clean and well-appointed. Though not as large as the suite I had in another Marriott recently, it was plenty big enough. The shower was great! On the 30th and 31st floors we heard no traffic noise, and I heard nothing from any of the adjacent rooms. Soundproofing seemed quite good. Beds were comfortable. It is true that the TVs were not LCDTVs, but I didn't go to Sydney to watch TV, anyway. ALL staff were unfailingly helpful and courteous. We especially appreciated being checked into our rooms quite early, at about 7:30 AM, as our arrival time had been moved up some hours by the airline after we had made our reservations. The hotel does have an early arrivals lounge, equipped with showers and other amenities. We made use of this service after checkout on the day we left, as our flight left Sydney rather late. It was great to have a place to freshen up before the long flight home! This service is another reseaon I would recommend this hotel. Wi fi access is free in executive lounge, but would not work with Iphones or Ipod Touch. Marriott tech assistance staff were unable to explain or resolve problem for us or for the several other guests with same issue. At first, we were compensated with a half hour of free PC access in business center, but they quickly changed policy and began to charge $5 a half hour. We then began using internet access ($4 an hour) at city market across the street. The breakfast in the executive lounge alone made it worth the ugrade, as most restaurants in vicinity were fairly $$. I am judging restaurants in area to be expensive based on my recent trips to New York City and Washington DC, while my friend, who is from San Francisco, also found Sydney to be quite expensive for dining. I think if NYC and San Francisco prices look cheap by comparison, then the costs will seem high to many Americans! Admittedly there is a McDonald's, Starbucks and Subway within a block or so, but excepting those places, which were not places we ate, I would say expect to pay more in Sydney than in major US cities for dining. There are a great many restaurants in easy walking distance of hotel. Ask about the freeshuttle service, bus 155, that will take you to Australia Museum and up and down George Street for shopping. The Queen Victoria shopping center is quite lovely, and was decorated with a 3 story Swavorski crystral Christmas tree when we were there. The Blue mountans were doubtless lovely, but fog was so thick the day we were there you could see nothing from any of the overlooks. Check weather before you go. (We were running out of time, so took a chance and went on a day when forecast was not so promising.) I would be very happy to stay at the Marriott again should I visit Sydney in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PShah16
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not that great. Not very big. However the location is perfect. It is minutes from Circular Quay underground Station. Can take the train from here to Sydney Airport which takes only 20 minutes. Can also view the harbour bridge from the rooms. Walking distance to the Opera House and the Harbour. Nice places to eat near by. Also near to the bus stops to go to the city. Take ferry to Manly Beach from Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim_QLD_09
Reviews.Content: My experice at the Marriott was absolutely amazing. My husband & I stayed here the first two nights of our honeymoon and we made the right choice. We got an upgrade to a room with direct views to the Sydney Harbour Bridge which sparkled all night. The service was fantastic across all departments. We spent 2 nights here and as we had never been to Sydney we had no idea where to find the good restaurants however we didnt have to worry, both nights we went on the Hotels recomendations and were not at all disapointed. This is a fantastic Hotel with 5 star service - this is very hard to find so I would recomend this Hotel to anyone without hesitation! Thanks again for making my honeymoon so very memorable & special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - breakfast was quite a zoo”
Reviews.Author: MVagusta
Reviews.Content: Standard Marriott predictability.
