Great location and depending on your room, you overlook the harbour and opera house, with plenty of restaurants around the hotel or a block or two away. Front desk staffs seem overworked and tired. Breakfast was quite lacking in selection and a bit of a zoo, it was really tough to get coffee or any sort of service, the juices (bottled or canned?) were terrible. The wait staffs seem to be really busy, not sure what they are doing because they are not serving anyone, it's a buffet. The valet parking was a pain in the morning, unless you call ahead and perhaps grease the parking attendants a bit, you have a 20 minute wait for your car. Finally, Front desk staffs seem overworked and tired.

Reviews.Title: “NEAR ALMOST EVERYTHING!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyingsteve
Reviews.Content: i visited sydney with friends in september...we stayed two three-day weekends at the marriott sydney harbour @ circular quay, and went driving to the blue mountains, the hunter valley wine country, and the coastal area to the north on the five days in between. in the interest of full disclosure...i'm pretty much a two & three-star hotel kind of guy... so i was expecting something much better than usual. WE GOT IT!! while the rooms weren't huge, there were three of us, and it was certainly adequate. on the first weekend, we took the upgraded harbor-view option...it was a larger room, with a larger bathroom, than the lower-priced 'city-view' we opted for on the second weekend...however both were sufficient, clean, and well-serviced. although we arrived in the early morning, the staff were able to accomodate us with a room. that same 'CAN-DO-SIR' attitude was the rule in every staffing area during both of our 3-day stays. the examples are too numerous to list...suffice it to say that for each 'opportunity' we had...a team-member efficiently found a solution... and that included the concierge calmly and expertly coordinating our efforts to locate a passport that had been lost in the city. he first quickly outlined the replacement requirements...and then directed an effective search... the document was recovered in short order. so...if the property was good, and the staff supurb, could anything top that. YES!!! the location of this mariott was amazing. it was a short walk, or a quick cab ride to almost everything you'd want to see in metro sydney. the trains and ferries to every- where were close at hand... and after we picked up our rental car, the marriott was easy to find...even driving back into the city from the countryside. you could see it from the sydney harbour bridge!!! (driving on the left is no big deal...'no worries' as they say) the only negative during our stay didn't come from the hotel...but is worthy of note. on arrival at the airport, we opted to take a shuttle operated by a company called 'easygo.' it stopped at the hotels of the passengers on board. we purchased a round-trip ticket, and per the instructions given, the concierge called the day before to set-up our pick-up for the homeward bound flight. that was done, i know, because he wrote the time on our tickets. that morning...the shuttle didn't show-up...and we ended up taking a cab. since there were three of us...the per/person fare turned out to be the same as we paid for the shuttle...and the cab was easier, and faster. the unfortunate part came at the airport...when i visited the 'easygo' counter to obtain a refund. they wouldn't issue one...and said that i had to 'APPLY' when i got home. suffice it to say that that's a bad policy...and the administration of it was even worse. i reported that to the 'help' desk at the airport, and the staffer there said that that was a frequent complaint about 'EASYGO.' i finally did obtain a refund, but with the help of the airport staff. go easy on YOURSELF...take a cab!!! so...to get back on topic... STAY AT THIS MARRIOTT!!! you can't go wrong. i fully intend to on my next visit...and there will be one since australia was a very pleasant place. just one thing... next time...I'll take a cab from the airport!!! 'flyingsteve' pompano beach, florida u.s.a.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: Ohiosoccermom68
Reviews.Content: We found a Qantas package deal in the winter and couldn't pass it up. We spent 6 days in Sydney with our 14 year old son and loved every minute of it. I had chosen the Marriott Sydney Harbour for its location, and upgraded for the Opera View-worth every penny (see photos from our window). I think we took photos of the view every time we returned to the room because the Opera House looks different in every kind of light. We were on the 25th floor and the elevators were not as bad as some reviews have said. Our room (2 double beds) was comfortable, not spacious, but we never felt crowded with 3 of us there for 6 days. The bathroom was very large. Everytime we came or went from Circular Quay, which was 1/2 block from the hotel, we were thankful we stayed there. We caught the Sydney Explorer and Bondi Explorer bus tours there and countless ferries to and from. We had purchased the Sydney Pass at the airport so the included Airport Link train took us to Circular Quay and in 2 minutes we walked to the hotel. We arrived before 9 AM but our room was ready (I had called a few days before to alert them to our early arrival). It was great to have a shower before we set out for a day of sightseeing. From the hotel we walked to the Rocks, Opera House, Botanic Gardens and Mrs. McQuarie's Chair, and downtown, all easy walks. We did book the Blue Mountain/Featherdale trip through the concierge and we enjoyed it very much. Featherdale turned out to be a highlight of the trip, even though we had already done Wildlife World and the Tarongo Zoo. Featherdale has the BEST koala and kangaroo interactions, and no charge for koala cuddling photos. We took advice from on-line reviews and ate breakfast at the local coffee shops, got free wi-fi there too! We did get room service twice-not cheap, but good food and we were too tired to go out. One bit of advice for families-it was hard to find informal places for dinner because the pubs wouldn't allow our son in. If you want to be able to explore Sydney on your own, and utilize the fantastic ferry system and transportation available, this location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent executive lounge, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mwilborn
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel at a desirable location. Rooms have been updated on Executive level 30th floor. Lounge is much better than US properties and compares favorably with Hong Kong and Singapore Marriotts although food selection is not as good. Only negative for me was gym...it is dated with inadequate locker rooms. Otherwise, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend--fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: froglady60
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:00 a.m. after an all night flight. No problem with early check-in. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable, and we actually could glimpse the Circular Quay area from our window. The concierge was very helpful with directions and maps. The buffet breakfast, which was included in the room price, was fabulous, with both hot and cold choices. We could walk all over Sydney from the hotel, including to the Opera House, the botanical gardens, and the Harbour Bridge. I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: luvgoodtravel
Reviews.Content: We went to Australia for the first time and started our trip in Sydney. We got in at 8:00am and were worried that our room would not be ready. We got right it, which was wonderful, wanted to take a shower and then get to exploring. If your room is not ready, there is a special suite available to relax and I think there may be a shower in there to use but I am not sure about that. We let them know about our flight ahead of time and I would imagine that they attempt to accommodate guests after long flights. Our room was nice, not very, typical Marriott room. The best part of the hotel was the location. You could walk to Circular Quay and the Harbor and the Opera House in minutes. There is a train station and a ferry station in Circular Quay which made it even more convenient to get to places like Manly Beach, etc. The first day we walked to the Harbor and checked out the Opera House. Don't miss the Opera Bar, especially on Sunday afternoons! We had an appetizer in the hotel lobby one night which was ok, perfect for what we needed but other than that, we did not eat at the hotel. We would stay there again, surely. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful, breathtaking view & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SWLewis
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Australia for our 30th wedding anniversary. We used our Marriott points for the room & paid for an upgrade to a harbour view room. The upgrade was worth it, to view Sydney Harbour and the Sydney Opera House at various times during the day from our room was breathtaking. The Marriott is located one block from Circular Quay, a very convenient location. Circular Quay is a transportation hub, where you can get water taxis, trains and buses. We took the water taxis to attractions: Darling Harbour, Taronga Zoo, The Sydney Aquarium, and Manly Beach. We walked a short distance to the Sydney Opera House, The Royal Botanical Gardens, and The Rocks. Chinatown, and Darling Harbour are a 20 - 30 minute walk from the hotel. The staff at the Marriott was very friendly and helpful. The Concierge was very informative. Based upon his recommendation, he booked us on a wonderful trip to Featherdale Wildlife Park & the Blue Mountains. He also had good recommendations for restaurants. Our room was a nice size and clean. I wouldn't say large, but was comfortable for the 5 nights we stayed. The room decor is contemporary, nicely done. Again the view was wonderful, watching the boats move through the harbour & the Opera House lighted at night was breathtaking. I would definitely recommend this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! PERFECT SPOT TO SEE SYDNEY!”
Reviews.Author: SydneySights
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 days at the Marriott Harbor and could not have been more delighted! They are so convenient to everything in Sydney...a nice walk leads you to the Harbor restaurants, the ferries, the bars (Lord Nelson's Pub was our fav)...awesome shopping, likie the QVB where there are more shops than money to spend in them! The room service was great, a little on the high side, but we enjoyed it anyway, and the concierge was so pleasant and helpful. We did the Blue Mountains tour (picked us up in a Mercedez) that he recommended and our guide was so funny and knowledgeable. We were so happy with their guidance because there are so many vendors pushing their tours, rely on the concierge!! IF you are looking for a huge room....look elsewhere. We had an executive room with the king bed, etc, but still found it to be small. But the king bed and sheets were so comfy, we just wanted to stay in bed all day! Dining at the wharf is really nice, great view of the Opera House and the Bridge and the prices are good. Try the 2 for 1 at the wharf restaurants and you will have a great meal at a great price! We did not do the Capt Cooke Tours because we spoke with people who were disappointed in the "bang for your buck"...tour was lacking in many areas...we did love the Whale Watching (ask your concierge for the best tour) and the nightlife was relaxing and fun. Loved the Featherdale Wilderness Park (included in the Blue Mtn tour) and got our fill of Koalas and Kangaroos....also ate kangaroo one night for dinner...doesn't taste like chicken, more like a good steak. Toranga Zoo is not to be missed,...word of advice: take the lift up to the top of the zoo and work your way down. All in all, we had a fabulous time down under and hope you take our advice and stay at the Marriott Harbor. The Aussies were very friendly and willing to help you if you are lost or just want advice. It made life so much easier and we could not have asked for a nicer hotel in a better location than this one. Would DEFINITELY stay there again! G'Day Mate! p.s. definitely go to Manly Beach...so much more to do and see than Bondi Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: qespittler
Reviews.Content: Great location! Walking distance to the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, and ferries. Staff was fabulous! We loved staying there!

Reviews.Title: “On the Level”
Reviews.Author: AileenCBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good experience. Free upgrade to a Harbour view didn't hurt eith. Property is showing signs of age, including old box TV's but it is a quaility 5 star experience. Friendly staff (and plenty of them), great lobby bar, and handy loction.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott, the McDonald's of the hotel world”
Reviews.Author: CharlesDP
Reviews.Content: The title of this review is not intended as a criticism of the Sydney Harbour Marriott. Rather, it is an observation I make on the nature of the accommodation and service provided. I was happy with the room I received, for the rate I paid, but the experience is not what you would call special. We stayed in an executive suite for 3 nights at $AUD 337 per night with the marriott gold card. The executive suite had a separate living area and had clear views of the opera house, story bridge and botanic gardens. There was plenty of natural light. The living area was comfortable with sofa and two chairs. I enjoyed sitting there and watching the view. On the 27th floor, where our room was, it was a genuine view straight out the window. I like a view and this was the room's strong point in my opinion. Overall, the room was large and comfortable and suited our purposes very well. It was starting to show its age, 6 years since opening, but was in good condition. It is not as plush as some other 5 star hotels and looks a little old fashioned. The bathroom was clean and functional but nothing special. The king bed was very comfortable and lived up to the hype of the Marriott Revive bedding. It was both comfortable and supportive and ensured a good night's sleep. The room had two TVs. Both were small and CRT. We didn't have a problem with it but most hotels have moved on to LCD or Plasma. So long as they keep the room rates low you can't complain. If i was paying top dollar for these rooms then I would have been disappointed. We found the executive lounge underwhelming. When you look at the website it appears to be a luxurious space at the top of the hotel. In reality it does not feel exclusive and you do not receive much service. The buffet where the breakfast and canapes are laid out is small and feels cramped. In fact, the lounge itself feels cramped unless you are lucky enough to score one of the lounge suites that they have. On Sunday morning it was busy and it wasn't very relaxing to eat there. For some reason they only give you small plates. I am not so desperate as to pile my plate very high but I like enough room on the plate to be able to use my cutlery and eat my food. We like a big breakfast and a wide variety of items. We were not satisfied with the lounge and ate in the main restaurant downstairs. The lounge does have some benefits. You receive free wireless internet and this was popular with many patrons bringing laptops. Unfortunately Iphones don't work on the wireless system. There is unlimited coffee and tea. The coffee appears to be decent quality and you can takeaway. We found the dessert quite good and visited after we had been out for dinner in town. When it is quiet, it is a pleasant place to lounge around in take in the views and enjoy the food. Depending on where you sit you can get views of the story bridge. In my view the lounge was not about luxury but was really about a value for money package that could be added on to your room. Consequently, the cheap feel and lack of service reflect the nature of the offering. If you add up all the things you receive it is probably worth the extra you pay. As gold card holders we only pay 50% of the cost of meals in the hotel anyway so it is not worth that much to us. If you were paying full price for all your meals it would be better value. The main restaurant was much better than the lounge. It felt spacious and had a better decor and atmosphere. We tried the seafood buffet and the a la carte menu. Both were good quality. The buffet breakfast was much better than that on offer in the lounge and had a fairly good range of hot items to choose from. I particularly liked the Hank's Jams they laid out each day with different jams on different days. This was an excellent idea. Overall, we received good service. When checking in I didn't receive that "warm, Marriott welcome." I wasn't perturbed but thought a little more hospitality was in order. Otherwise all requests were responded to promptly. After ordering turn down service on the first night it was provided without prompting every night thereafter. The service was efficient but lacked warmth. This comes back to my comment earlier about it being the McDonald's of the hotel world. We had problems with our room access cards on the first two days. At one stage they stopped working completely and we couldn't access our room. Security let me in but asked to see ID. This was reasonable but I felt like I was under suspicion due to the manner of the security guard in asking for ID. When I had the keys reprogrammed in reception I had to provide ID again. I appreciate the need to maintain safety and security but would prefer it to be done not so officiously. Interestingly, I didn't have to provide ID when I checked in to the hotel. In summary, this is a large hotel with efficient service. It can offer good value for money depending on the price you pay. We enjoyed our stay and found the Marriott to be comfortable. But we weren't charmed by the hotel or the experience. Instead, we got what we paid for which was a large room in a full service hotel at a good price. There is nothing wrong with this and I would recommend the hotel to friends and would probably stay there again. The Marriott is certainly in the second tier of 5 star hotels in Sydney and the price reflects that categorisation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: This is a typically high quality Marriott situation in a fantastic location near Circular Quay. Breakfast is rather over-priced but there are some much better options for breakfast with great views at restaurants along the quay side, just a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms. Awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: madebooCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Steps away from Circular Quay and the Rocks. Very nice rooms. Only problem we encountered was an elevator traffic jam on Sunday morning as we were checking in. It took us about 15 mins to get an elevator from the 6th floor to the lobby because all the elevators were jam-packed. Skip the expensive breakfast. There are many, many places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeS71
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great position. The views towards the harbor are excellent and the rooms and pool/gym area are great. The hotel would win a lot more with an improvement in the service level. We had from the beginning the feeling o a lack of staff, which caused delays in check-in, breakfast, and no personnel could be found at the pool area. Also more variety at the breakfast menu would be great and some better toilettries items in the bath. Otherwise definitively a great place and with some more attention regarding service top rate for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the Opera House”
Reviews.Author: carenrich
Reviews.Content: Loved the breakfast staff, meals and management. The hotel room was impeccably clean. Wintertime in Sydney was moderate weather so bring layered clothing.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: msudawg1
Reviews.Content: I felt as though I was family, and the location is right there at the Circular Quay. So where else would you care to be while in Sydney, right?

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good all round”
Reviews.Author: bongo77
Reviews.Content: Not to be confused with the other Marriott in Sydney. We found the Marriott Circular Quay quite nice. The heated pool is a little on the cold side and was pretty cloudy. All of the hotel is very clean and tidy. The staff are quite nice and helpful. We didn't have any meals there so I can't comment on that. Over all we where happy with everything with our 4 night stay. It is such a handy location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: slumped
Reviews.Content: Located just 100 metres or so from Circular Quay itself, the Marriott Hotel stands amongst other skyscraping buildings in a quite modern and upmarket part of town. Some rooms offer views of the Opera House but these are not fantastic - so don't pay the extra for the view - a standard room is fine! We stayed on the 24th floor (7 nights) and the room was standard Marriott fare - very comfy bed - mini bar well stocked - good curtains with little light getting through - clean and spacious bathroom with good hot showers. TV is not a Flatscreen - but offers a good range of channels - mainly all Australian with CNN being the main international channel. The staff were excellent - an assest to the hotel. There is a French girl who works in the bar area - very friendly and always smiling! Concierge were great in offering advice on trips etc. and the Reception staff were prompt and courteous. Restaurant Buffets were good - Seafood was great - Breakfast was good. All in all I recommend this hotel as a great place to explore Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but still overpriced compared to similar hotels in area”
Reviews.Author: cspoe7
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great for exploring Sydney, is very nicely furnished, and some rooms have nice views of Sydney (though you need to be on a very high floor to see them). On the downside, it is a bit overpriced compared to similar hotels in the area. Also, the water pressure was extremely weak (almost no pressure at all) which is not a great way to start the day. The last downer is the fact that, in 2009, Marriott is still charging for internet service -- not just charging, but exorbitantly so. It's ridiculous to me that lower end hotels give internet away for free and yet the expensive hotels are still not wrapping the cost in the price of the hotel (which most employers will reimburse for the cost of the room but not the internet a la carte). If you're willing to drop the money on this place, it is a nice place to stay, but it's worth doing some research at other places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: CITravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriott Circular Quay for 3 nights in July 3 and again for one night on July 12. We had an early check-in , which was convenient since our flight arrived at 6:15 a.m. Pluses: (1) the hotel is in a convenient location, close to the ferries, bus stops, train stops, and walking distance to the Sydney Opera House and "the Rocks." (2) The room was quiet, the beds were comfortable, including the rollaway. (3) The bellmen were super great. They were very helpful and you can ask them questions if the concierge is busy. (4) The concierge was also very helpful, making dinner reservations for you when needed. (5) Our room had lovely views of the harbor and the Sydney Opera House. Minuses: (1) the hotel seems to discourage 4 people staying in one room. I booked a partial Opera House view room for 4 through the Marriott web site, but upon check-in was told that the room I booked cannot accommodate a rollaway bed in addition to the 2 doubles that were already in the room, but for an extra $40 a night I can be upgraded to a room that can. The rollaway bed also costs $55 per night. These caught me by surprise since they were not mentioned at the web site. I ended up paying an extra $95 per night than I originally budgeted for, but since we were rarely in the room and only used it for sleeping, I did not see the need to book an extra room for my 2 teenagers. (2) We had dinner one night at the hotel's restaurant. The food was horrible and expensive, and were in small portions. The waiter was also inexperienced, and did not seem to want to serve us Miscellaneous: Taking a friend's advice, we did not bother with the breakfast buffet, but just had breakfast at the cafe right next to the hotel which was run by a Vietnamese family. The prices there were more reasonable. Additionally, although the check-in staff was very pleasant, a few did not know what travelers checks were (apparently these are not widely-used in Australia). If this happens to you, just pay in cash if you want to avoid the 1.5% credit card service charge, in addition to whatever transaction charges your credit card may have to convert currency to US dollars. Overall, though, we liked this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great View, Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: Nerzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in July. This hotel was perfectly located for city exploration. It is only 2 blocks from the bus and ferry hub of Circular Quay and the Rocks neighborhood. We loved that it was on a quiet one-way street in the heart of the city so close to pedestrian walking areas around the harbor. Had a great view of the harbor bridge from our room. The room was very nice and confortable, modern, with a fridge and safe. The rooms were very quiet, never heard any neighbors. The concierge was always very helpful with any questions and help we needed. The buffet breakfast was huge. It would have been unreasonably priced if it were not included in our room charge. I would recommend not eating there unless it is included in your room ($35.00USD per person). There is a starbucks one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmel_CA
Reviews.Content: The Marriott at Circular Quay has a fantastic location near the ferries at Circular Quay. It is also walking distance to the Rocks, the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens. We stayed there one week. Sydney is such a great city that it is very convenient to be staying at a hotel so well located. The room was very nice with a desk for business purposes. The room was large and the bathroom was big. We chose a "non-view" room which worked out well. We did not spend much time in the room with all there is to see in Sydney. We paid about 200 USD per night through Classic Vacations, a US Travel group. The breakfast was priced very high, and I went to places nearby outside the hotel after the first morning. Also, if you want the coffee normally received in the States, you need to ask for filtered coffee. Most places do not offer filetered coffee. There was a Starbucks a block away that served filtered coffee. We purchased Sydney passes for the week that provided unlimited ferry rides, the use of the Sydney and Bondi Explorer buses and local buses. The passes are somewhat expensive but very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in great location”
Reviews.Author: MonikafromSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid April. Our room was on the same floor as the Executive Lounge and it was great value for money. Itâ€™s one of the nicest Exec Lounges we have had access to. There was plenty to choose from for breakfast and the selection of hot and cold snacks in the evening was really nice too. The room had a comfy king size bed and a decent size bathroom with a shower cabin and a separate bath tub. There were not enough towels for both of us but housekeeping service always added a few more upon request. We loved the location â€“ so close to the Rocks and just a short walk away from the Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. From this Marriott hotel itâ€™s easy to walk everywhere. We strolled to the Darling Harbour and went to the Sydney Aquarium. It was also good fun to hop on any of the ferries departing from the nearby Circular Quay and explore the bays. I can recommend going to Manly to explore the neighbourhood and/or going to the Watson Bay for lunch at the famous Doyleâ€™s restaurant. One day we ventured out of town to see the Blue Mountains. I had booked a trip online with a company called Sydney Wilderness Tours and we really enjoyed the experience. I can recommend this particular hotel to anybody. It feels a bit business like at first but has lots to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot if you have some free time”
Reviews.Author: restandrelaxSydney
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel that has all the comforts and service you would expect from a 5 star hotel in a great location, pity I had to work the whole time!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Hotel Sydney Harbour - over-priced and poor service”
Reviews.Author: austravelth
Reviews.Content: As a regular customer of the Marriott Sydney Harbour, I have finally had enough. Firstly, they charge over $200 a room regardless if you are a major repeat client which is such poor value for money considering the property badly needs a refurb. Also, there are so many newer and more central hotels in the Sydney CBD which charge less and treat you much nicer. In my four years staying at the hotel, not once have I seen the GM and the staff turnover is so high that nobody ever knows me so I am always treated as a one-off guest rather than a valued customer. The final straw was a hole in my thin towel and a wake-up call that never happened - not very good for a so-called 5 hotel. 3 stars now and don't expect to be cared for.

Reviews.Title: “In a great location, walking distance to all major attractions and train station”
Reviews.Author: Rodney1
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay train station. Can take a train directly from SYD airport to this station. Very convenenient! One of the closest "good" hotels to Opera House, Harbor bridge, the Rocks and Circular Quay Harbor for Harbor Cruises....all within 8-10 minutes walk. Within a 15 -20 minute walk , you can get to Botanic Gardens, shopping, Wildlife Park, Aquarium and Darling Harbor. We arrived from US on a 6.30am flight. Hotel was able to check us in that early at 8.30am. Perhaps not always the case if they are booked up Had one issue as my wife and I each used Marriott points to cover our 4 day stay. They said all we needed to do was get our keys re-programmed to stay in the same room. No issue with that but they never cleaned our room despite repeated calls for room service. Had to call Manager to address when we got back around 11pm that night. They claim they were using two different systems and that is why it happened. Internet service is a rip off for those coming from US

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, average room”
Reviews.Author: ft800
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. Check in is at 3:00 p.m. and I arrived at 9:00 a.m. and my room was ready. Check in staff was friendly and answered any questions I had. Was put on the 18th floor with a partial view of the Opera House as a part of it was blocked by the surrounding buildings. Room was clean, but nothing extraordinary. Bed was worn (could tell people liked to sleep on the left side of the bed) and should be replaced, but was not uncomfortable. Had a tube TV but didn't really care as I only watched before I went to sleep. Bathroom was average, with plastic anchors left in wall and small spots of mold in shower. There was a button on the wall to flush the toilet which I didn't know if I should press it once to flush or to hold it down. Overall an average room which at least didn't live up to 4 stars. The staff was great and friendly. Each morning I past housekeepers who greeted me with good morning and have a good day. Front desk was pleasant and always asked if I needed any other services. Concierge was very helpful and friendly, directing me away from expensive stores, making reservations at restaurants and giving full directions on where I needed to go. The bartenders were very friendly and made sure my glass was full. I only ate the breakfast buffet on the last day of my trip, with the food being good and wait staff checking on if I needed anything. For location, you can not beat this hotel. People say its 2 blocks away from the Circular Quay train station, but it is only a half block, if that. Everything is within walking distance; Circular Quay trains, ferries and buses, The Rocks, Opera House, Royal Botanical Gardens and the CBD. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for first time visitors to Sydney. I would probably stay somewhere else on my next trip just to try another hotel. The people were great but the room was average.

Reviews.Title: “Central to All”
Reviews.Author: shttrdrvr
Reviews.Content: Massive buidling right in by the harbour. Took the train right from the Airport and walked a block. Had a great view from one of the top floors. Room was massive. The Gym is tiny, but workable. The elevator was hit or miss. When it was a miss, wow what a wait. Great staff and front office personnel were very pleasent, much like most everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Has all the modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: cateeliza
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 night in Dec 2007 whilst on a short trip to sightsee and go to the theatre. Staff were welcoming and the hotel had all of the conveniences expected of a 5 star hotel. The room was comfortable and clean, housekeeping service was excellent and hotel facilities were well maintained. Buffet breakfast was included in the package I purchased and the food was fresh and varied, although service staff in the dining area were not available when required to deal with problems with the toasters and supply of coffee. Overall it was a very comfortable stay and reasonable value for money, well located hotel within a few minutes walk of Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rate + Upgrade = Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Samba75
Reviews.Content: Booked a cheap internet and upgraded (Exutive room with city view) with my Marriott Gold Elite card with access to the executive lounge - so truly great value for money. Our travelling companion had to pay AUD 30.00 for the upgrade and was also happy. Excellent location, great executive lounge with nice evening cocktails and good hot breakfast. Large bedroom with very comfy bed - everything you'd expect from a Marriott. The view from the room was an OK city view, from the lounge it was amazing (pity the reception didn't offer us a better view for a supplement). The only problem - the service (except at the lounge) was truly non-existant. One lady in the lounge was great, but at the reception downstairs they seemed completely disinterested in the guest (even when they didn't know we weren't paying much) and the concierge was disastrous - and that was when there was one as most of the time the desk was unattended...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average quality”
Reviews.Author: EmmaSinagpore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right next to Circular Quay. Really easy access from the airport. It has an impressive lobby, but we found the rooms basic, over priced and relatively small. I was expecting better quality from a Marriott hotel. The pool is small and not very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay in Mar 2009 and was given a corner room on the Executive Floor with a view of the Harbor Bridge and Darling Harbour. Even though I was on one of the upper floors the view was obstructed by several of the nearby buildings. As some have mentioned, the room had dark tones/colors and was not brightly lit which made it seem a bit gloomy. Some of the furnishings had some wear and tear but everything was in working order. I found some leftover food and a half empty bottle of Coke in my mini fridge so I was disappointed with the cleaniness. The Executive Lounge offered drinks/coffee throughout the day, snacks and desserts with wine/beer in the evening, and breakfast in the morning. Nothing spectacular but not bad either. The Lounge offered some of the same views I had from my room but also views of the Opera House as well. So if you don't have any decent views from your room, go to the Executive Lounge and relax there while enjoying the views. The hotel is located within 2-3 minutes walk to Circular Quay. Very convenient for taking the boats or jumping on the CityRail. Plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Fairly easy walk to the Opera House in one direction or Darling Harbour in the other direction. The Rocks is close by as well. I received a very warm, friendly welcome when I checked in and the attendants in the Executive Lounge were very helpful and constantly checking on the guests and cleaning after us. I agree with other reviewers that the elevators were slow and having to use the card key confused many guests. Overall a nice hotel in a good location with decent but not great views and some short-comings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: studentsmum
Reviews.Content: There are many good hotels, alot of not so good hotels and then there are fantastic hotels, these are harder to find and worth recommending to your best friends. The Marriot Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay offers the traveller a refreshingly wonderful level of service and care that makes for a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for our kids' first trip to Sydney, central with views/pool.”
Reviews.Author: the_nz_halls
Reviews.Content: We were taking advantage of a Qantas deal to fly our two children free (aged 9 and 11) to Sydney, from NZ. I did a fair bit of research as we needed a hotel room which would sleep four and had a swimming pool and a view of the harbour bridge. The Marriott fitted the bill and I made sure to confirm prior to our arrival that we definitely wanted a good view. We were on the 26th floor, and we looked out to the harbour on an angle but with a good view of the Opera House (it's not front on as you'd have to stay on the other side of Sydney for that). The room was very clean and tidy and comfortable. Our deal included the buffet breakfast on the weekend mornings (not the weekdays) and it was fabulous and set all four of us up for the day, so that only a snack was needed at lunch time. The location was great, just a very short walk (3 mins) to Circular Quay where all the ferries are, and a couple of minutes walk to the new Overseas Passenger Terminal (fantastic views from restaurants there) and the Rocks, where the Hop On/Hop Off bus stop was. It was quite an easy walk to the main department stores etc although probably took about 15-20 minutes. We didn't walk to the Botanic Gardens (we drove) but you could walk quite easily and there's a great cafe there called The Pavillion. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the kids loved the pool - although if no staff member around (ie early mornings and evenings) you seemed to have to take your bath towels down which was a bit annoying. Otherwise they had other towels there. We were really pleased with the experience and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic concierge, somewhat disconnected staff”
Reviews.Author: SCupertino
Reviews.Content: The good: The location can't be beat - right on Circular Quay. Our room looked right out onto the Harbour Bridge - a nice view to wake up to. It took about 5 minutes to walk to Circular Quay once leaving the hotel. The concierge was extremely helpful and pleasant. Ice was always delivered quickly and without a charge. The pool and hot tub were nice. And, there is an arrivals lounge on the 6th floor - after a long flight, we arrived at 8am, and were given the key to the lounge where we could take a shower, freshen up, use the internet, and have coffee. The bad: The service from the staff at reception was below typical Full Service Marriott standards, in my opinion. The elevators were irritating due to the time it took to catch the elevator, and the need to always use the key card to access your floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JLInternational
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Marriott for 3 nights after our cruise ship docked at the Circular Quay. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from the overseas passenger terminal. The cab fees is $4 but we gave the driver $15 as he did not complain and helped us with the luggage. Bell services was great but the front desk can definitely use some improvements. Room is reasonable for a 4 star hotel but we did not have a harbour view. That would have cost us at least an additional $70/night for an upgrade. Internet is $20 a day from the room, but one can purchase a 30 minutes voucher for $5, or use the Internet cafe at the convenience store across the street. We did not use the restaurants in the hotel as there are great selections nearby, particularly by the Opera House watching the ferries and the cruise ship sail by. The hotel is ideally located at the Circular Quay. Great location for train , buses and ferries to Bondi and Manly beaches and is within walking distance to the Opera House. For $17 a day, one can purchase a day pass good for all trains, buses and ferries, a very good deal if you stay at the Circular Quay. Taxis are plentiful and costs us $35 to the airport. Alternatively one can take the train if luggage is not a concern. We were glad that we stayed at the Marriott as we able to cover a lot due to the location at a prepaid discount rate through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, excellent staff, won't stay anywhere else in Sydney now”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghAnna
Reviews.Content: We had booked an aparthotel for 10 nights. it was a disappointment so we looked for another hotel immediately. After a long haul flight we were not at our best but the staff at reception could not have been more helpful and welcoming. we were shown round the hotel. We needed some flexibility as our children were visiting us while we were in sydney. The hotel came up with an excellent solution and we transferred immediately. when we arrived with our suitcases we had been upgraded and were given use of the executive room . This was an unexpected bonus and for a longish stay made the visit unforgettable. If you were lucky you got THE table at breakfast with a stunning view of Sydney Opera House to your right and Sydney Harbour Bridge to your left. We also looked at the Four Seasons hotel. A lovely hotel but the gentleman at reception was frosty towards us and certainly not welcoming. The suite in tHe Marriott was of a high standard and all the staff were friendly, keen to help but unobtrusive. Excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “disinterested staff, shabby hotel room, would never recommend”
Reviews.Author: kimchi2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed there several years ago. It didn't live up to our expectations at all. The rooms were not ready even though I had reserved early check in, the room offered was smelly and rank. The furnishings were shabby and the room was not cleaned properly. We asked to be moved and then second room was only a wee bit better! The front desk didn't seem to know how to process the certificate I as awarded by my company and in conjunction with Marriott. Each day as I attempted to use my breakfast coupons, I was giving conflicting information by front desk and rest staff. The first concierge was not as his title suggested, but rather indifferent and rather abrupt with his answers- the second concierge's friendliness made up for all of the others. Overall I was not impressed by the hotel in anyway. Were I forced to stay there, I would only because I was forced, but I would never recommend this hotel to anyone else .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastick Location. Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasBaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Years 08. The hotel was right in Circular Quay, which is a block from the ferry's, subway, and buses. It is inbetween the opera house and bridge. We were able to walk to most of the major sights. The room was nice and modern. Staff was friendly. Bed was a dream. Cons: They charged us for ice, but it was minimal. The resturant was expensive. The are many great eatery's at the Quay within a 3 min walk. I would suggest to try those. Internet was not free. You can walk down to McDonalds and get it free.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: PinoyDutch
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel can hardly be better, one minute from Circular Quay and very close to The Rocks and the Opera House. Our room was of a good size and comfortable. The bed was good and no complaints about the bathroom either. However, there were a number of issues. Twice during our 7 day stay, we came home late in the afternoon to find that the room had not yet been made. After calling housekeeping this was resolved quickly but it should not have happened in a hotel of this caliber. Breakfast is just ok: standard international hotel fare but not outstanding in any way and at AUD35 per person somewhat pricey. The gym is very cramped and tends to get overcrowded. Hotel staff were polite but rather aloof. I give the Marriott Sydney Harbour 3 out of 5 for location and quality of the room. The lapses in service stop it from getting a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: TCSSouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel, and it was in a great location. Our room was of a reasonable size and clean. As much as the staff that we interacted with were very polite and friendly, it didn't feel like a very personable hotel. This hotel is in need of a refurbishment as it is quite dated, beds were not that comfortable, shower over bath with a shower curtain, bathroom was a bit daggy. Hmm 5 star....I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: neveragainMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Was extremely disappointed in our stay at this hotel. Despite the fact that I had rung the hotel to get a guaranteed double double room (ie two double beds) with opera house views, when we arrived we were told that there were none available. Whilst they did offer to upgrade us to a suite, when we inspected it, the room was small, dark and would have required all furniture to be pushed against the walls to fit the rollaway bed in. I don't want to spend this sort of money to stay on rollaway beds. They did eventually find us a room (after a further hour and a half wait) so we didn't get into our room until 5pm. After yet another hours wait, we rang down to find out where our luggage had disappeared to... fortunately it did eventually turn up. Location was great and doorman was very helpful, but just didn't make up for the disappointingly small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth Marriot”
Reviews.Author: yeye007
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as a family of four. We had a double opera house view with valet parking and breakfast for two nights. Upon arrival 10am our room was not available, valet service was excellent. The room not being ready did not concern us as we were going to the zoo. As soon as we walked out to go the ferry the hotel rang and told us the room was available. Good service. . When we returned front desk was very good on both occasions. The room was on level 25 and had a good view of the opera house. The room was very clean and comfortable, i liked the furnishings. Slight wear and tear to the furniture but you would have to be nitpicking. . On the second day had a swim in the pool which is nice. Spa was broken. Sauna was good. Asked for late check out and got one till 2pm. Breakfast staff and food excellent. I couldn't believe how smooth things went. Check out and valet service excellent once again. . Did not have a problem with the lifts and never waited for long periods. Perhaps it wasn't busy as it was the Australia day long weekend. . We recently stayed at the Shangrila hotel in a premier grand harbour view room which admittedly did have a much better view. However, they did not call us when our room was ready, the room was not as clean, staff not as pleasant, error on bill on check out. . Having two young kids (3 years old and 4months old) it helps when a hotel makes it such a smooth stay. .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Typical Marriott. Service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: dwbrouwer
Reviews.Content: I booked this through the Marriott website for two nights. I found it strange that they wanted me to prepay for the stay, but I went through with it anyway. My air travel was delayed and I ended up missing one of the two days that paid for. Marriott would not refund this. This is strike one for my Marriott loyalty. The hotel is situated in a nice section of Sydney. Very close to the Opera House, the Rocks, and the Harbour Bridge. Very convenient for sightseeing. View from the hotel room is not that great . . . don't recommend paying more for the view. The main problem (and a constant complaint from the guests) when I was there is the elevators. The elevators operate on key card access and several of the key cards do not work properly. This causes havoc with the guests because they cannot punch in their floor numbers and end up riding up and down the elevators. This transcends annoying when you are trapped in an elevator with 10-12 other people. Also, the bell staff leaves something to be desired. I waited almost two hours for my bag when I arrived (also due to the elevators) and finally went down to the desk to get my bag myself and lug it to the room. If they hadn't practically insisted in helping me with my bags to the room, I wouldn't have bothered a minute with them. Overall, a worse than average Marriott experience. People ranked this hotel pretty high, I however, found it to be nothing special and overpriced. After being there, I would have tried to stay at the Park Hyatt. Much better viewing. Much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Thelambs
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 11am and were told our room was ready and we had been upgraded to an Executive room, which meant we had access to the Exec Lounge for breakfast (which was really good, plenty of choice and regularly restocked)and evening snacks. Our room was really big and clean with an excellent view of the Opera House. The bathroom had a seperate bath and large shower cubicle, and as with all Marriott rooms the bed was large and really comfortable. The staff were excellent and always seemed to know how much attention to give. The location is another plus point, easy walking distance to the rocks and Circular Quay and close to plenty of public transport. We easily caught a train from the airport and walked the short distance from Circular Quay station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The personal touch”
Reviews.Author: DudeMunich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in the Marriott at the turn of the year. The lobby and entrance floor area is real swish - just what you'd expect from a Marriott. But what really impressed us was the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. They obviously have a great training programme and seem to have been chosen for their ability to communicate and put guests at their ease. Yes, the lifts are a bit problematic. Five not enough. But we'd go there again. The personal touch is important.

Reviews.Title: “An OK finish to our holiday, although we expected better.”
Reviews.Author: amylmb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay as a last minute splash-out for our last evening on holiday. We were in room 2201 which was touted as a room with Opera House view. This was true, but you had to be in the smallish window looking far to the left to see it. Otherwise, it was a great view over the city and part of the harbour. Pros: Very well located in the heart of CBD at Circular Quay. Very clean rooms with modern pleasant decor. Good shower and bath. Excellent fluffy bed and high quality linens. Great breakfast bar with a huge selection. Staff were very helpful and concerned, however... ...the Cons: the staff also seemed to be completely unorganized and a bit flustered with handling the continuous influx of clients (this is an enourmous hotel/conference center, and everything that this implies.). The car valet area was always very busy and the wait was always long. They lost our car keys (incorrectly tagged) at one point, but did hustle to remedy the situation for us. This room (2201) is not recommended due to its location near the elevators...the hall noises were very loud and clear, although the walls were well-insulated and we never had noise from neighbors. Overall, with a few minor snaffoos, it was a nice place to stay; however if you are seeking perfection or an incredible end to your holiday, I'd recommend finding something else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: vwp
Reviews.Content: As most have said, this location cannot be bettered. Right down the road there are water taxis, ferries, buses, and the subway. But since you are right near the Quay, you might not want to leave. The hotel is a typical large high class impersonal hotel. We had no particularly good view from our room. Great shower, clattering toilet seat, heavy quilt. We ate a delicious steak dinner in the restaurant the first night, but for breakfast went a block down the street to Starbucks for a coffee and croissant. I like the Hyde Park Marriott better because it is easier to drive to, they have a coin laundry, and all around it is friendlier. Can't beat the location on the Quay though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: berylQueensland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two young children.Service was excellent.Rooms were clean and comfortable.Location was wonderful.Within walking distance to many of Sydney's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ghanno
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel is located quite centrally on Pitt St, about a seven minute walk to Pitt St mall and a two minute walk to Circular Quay (near the Opera House and The Rocks). The closest train station would be Circular Quay and the next one after that would be Wynyard. THE ROOM: We stayed in a standard room with city views and a king size bed. The dÃ©cor was surprisingly nice and quite stately. The bed was extremely comfortable and there are some nice black and white framed photographs of the harbour bridge. There is in-room broadband internet access at $9.95/hour or $19.95/24 consecutive hours. There is also an in-room safe and tea and coffee making facilities. The TV wasnâ€™t flat screen although there was a wide selection of cable channels available. There is also an iron and ironing board in the wardrobe. The bathroom was also very clean and included a hair dryer. It was well-stocked with products from the â€˜Aromatherapyâ€™ brand and there was shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and moisturiser (all with lemongrass) as well as facial soap and body soap. It was impressive that the Marriott is environmentally conscious, like other hotels, and allows guests to select whether theyâ€™d like to have their linen and towels changed daily by indicating so with a card placed on the bed, etc. SERVICE: Check-in was very fast and the front desk staff were friendly. I found that the concierge on the particular night that we stayed didnâ€™t seem to keen to help, however. The Marriott has an â€˜At Your Serviceâ€™ button on the phone so you no longer have to AMENITIES: There is a relatively large gym with free weights, weighted equipment, treadmills, bikes, rowing machines, etc. but the equipment is rather outdated and the gym provides a water fountain but not bottled water for free. There is also a pool and a spa as well as a sauna. I believe there is a business centre but we never used it. IN-ROOM DINING: The $35/head breakfast price is outrageous so we didnâ€™t actually eat breakfast here. We did, however, have in-room dining. The hotel has a policy that the room service is free if it takes more than 45 minutes to deliver. We ordered room service and were told that it would be about 30 minutes. It arrived after 17 minutes, which is quite impressive. The quality of the food was very good, albeit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Tips”
Reviews.Author: SaltyDog79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriot for business for one week. I would come back for both business or pleasure. Definitely a place you could come for business and bring the family as there is plenty to do and see. I can echo what others have said in that the location is unbeatable along with the stunning views. I'll skip repeating what has already said and try to give a few helpful hints. A few tips: 1. Do eat at the Sydney Cafe Restaurant. It's a short 5 minute stroll. It has indoor/outdoor seating on the roof with an breathtaking view of the harbor. The food will please and the mixed drinks are unique and well executed. The service was good but American's beware they serve at a European pace (slow). The atmosphere is excellent and not too formal but you shouldn't wear too casual clothes (no jeans and sneakers). A polo and khakis will do just fine. If you have business colleagues in town this is the perfect place to take them. If you want to try the native Rocks oysters (no much brine, a little sweet) go the Waterfront restaurant - they were better there. Pricewise the entrees are all about 35 Australian Dollars or about 25 US. 2. Try the Kangaroo! It's sort of like venison but not as gamy. The Marriot has it on the room service menu. 3. Opt for the rate that includes breakfast. The breakfast buffet is $35 AUD each if purchased at the restaurant but if you opt for the rate that includes it when you book it's only $20 per day more for two adults. 4. Jet lag? Head to the spa for the Jet Lag package ladies! It includes a facial and massage. They use dermatologica products and seemed to have a good amount of experience. The spa is not luxorious by any means. Just little rooms off the gym, the prices were average but the service was excellent. 5. The gym is well equipped for a hotel. Free weights, check. Cardio machines, check. Weight machines, check. 6. The business center has a small conference room with seating for 4 around a small table. You can book it thru the front desk or if you only need it for a short time just walk in and use it. No one seemed to mind. The bar staff will bring food/drinks in their for you if you ask. 7. Beware of the phone. You can only make credit card or collect calls. No simply dialing and seeing it show up on the bill. For whatever bizarre reason you cannot make a 1800 call even if you try to pay for it. Not such a big deal until you need to call American Airlines to reschedule a cancelled flight on a Saturday and the Australian office is shut! Had to have the hubby deal with it from the US. Also, the phone in my room did not work properly. They never did fix it. It seemed to be a line issue. People would just cut out or their was a huge amount of noise on the line.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what location, upgrade to an opera house view room”
Reviews.Author: oztravellerLeeds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sateyd at the hotel in November, we upgraded to an Opera house view room which was excellent, much larger than a city view and the view we had was worth a million, cannot fault it. bedroom was clean and very comfortable, bathroom large and clean. But it was the views that will leave the most endearing memories. Food was excellent. Cannot recommend it enough

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Cold Food”
Reviews.Author: jasper147
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with very clean and nicely appointed rooms with lovely views of the harbour. Staff were generally very friendly and we had no real problems except we felt the food was ordinary. We ordered hot food from the bar menu after coming back after a show and not only was there a long wait, it was basically cold when we got it. Cocktails were small and overpriced for what you got. The food in the buffet breakfast was cold also. I selected my food from the buffet and went straight back to my table and it was hardly warm and certainly cold by the time I was about half way through. Great location and place to stay but be careful of the food. We didn't have an evening meal in the restaurant though so I can't comment on that. They need to watch those food temperatures though or someone is going to end up with some serious food poisoning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been to Sydney a few times before but this was the first time at the Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay. I stayed there for 7 nights and managed to get a great rate on the hotel. The good - Location: The hotel is in a fantastic location right next to Sydney harbour. This is probably the best place to be based if youâ€™re there on holiday as youâ€™re in the centre of everything and right next to where all the buses, ferries and trains go from. There are a few restaurants near by but I recommend going to either Manly or Darling harbour on the ferry. - Rooms and view: I have a gold card with Marriott and was upgraded to the exec level at the top of the hotel. The rooms are as you would expect from Marriott and are very comfortable. Views from the top of the hotel are great of either the city tower blocks or the harbour. - Exec lounge: This is a great lounge again with great views. - Staff: Cannot fault here as the front desk, concierge, maids, and exec lounge staff were all great. The only slight negative was the long queue at check out with British Airways crew using the hotel and checking out together. The bad: - The only bad thing I can really think of is the long wait for lifts. They have quite a few but when getting on at the top floor it would often stop numerous times on the way down (my record was 11 times!!) All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel to either a first time visitor to Sydney or to people who have visited before. Itâ€™s a great place to base yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Marc_on_TV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for our first three nights in Australia. Everyone was very kind. We were on the 21st floor and had a view of the opera house. The hotel has a building blocking the bridge, but it was not a bother to us. The service in the lounge on the 30th floor is outstanding. Always willing to help. Couple of things to note, if you want your laundry done go to the wash at the rocks M-F and they will deliver to your hotel for a small fee, if you do it at the hotel...it will cost you. Overall this is a good hotel and the best Marriott location wise for staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa799
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriott hotel during September 2008 as part of our trip around Oz. The location is fantastic only a 5 minutes walk to the harbour ferry terminal. The hotel itself is beautiful and well worth the money. We had an opera view room which was amazin and really made our stay. The room was spacious and quite luxurious. Staff very friendly and helpful particularly concierge had excellent knowledge about the local area. Internet is quite expensive but convenient. The pool is ok but very cold so we only visited once. While we were in Sydney we walked the harbour bridge which was the highlight of our trip although expensive is well worth the money - an experience we will never forget. The Sydney Aquarium is worth a visit but the Wildlife Attraction is not as good and there are far better similar places in other parts of Oz. We also went on the Jet Boat ride which is an amzing experience but be prepared to get very wet. We didn't get the chance to visit the Blue Mountains which we have been told is excellent. Bondi beach is ok and worth visiting just to say you have been there but would definitely recommend a visit to Manly Bay which is much better. Eating out in Sydney is quite expensive as is any city but we found an excellent pub Phillips Foote in The Rocks where you can bbq your own food at quite a reasonable price. Authentic experience and the staff were excellent would definitely recommend. All in all had a fabulous time in Sydney which was made by our stay at the Sydney Harbour Marriott will definitely recommend and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating experience”
Reviews.Author: waddehra
Reviews.Content: Hotel location & the ambience is completly out of the world. Starting from morning to the night every time you peep out of the window you get a completly different & fascinating view. The hotel staff & the services provided are top notch but the options available at the restaurant can be better. I would suggest that you take your rooms on the second floor from where the view of the opera House, Bridge & the sea is fabolous. For Indian's the best option is to stray out & go to the road side cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonPetvet
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 Nights at this hotel in mid-Sept 2008 on vacation and experienced what you would expect from a Marriott. Used Marriott Reward points to secure the reservations which included access to the Executive Lounge on the 30th floor even though our room was on the 29th. Arrived by 8:30AM the morning of our check in and were pleased to be given a room right way. The room, the property and the staff were all up to the standards of a Marriott and we found the room to be clean, bright and though a little on the small side it had nice views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. On the couple of occassions that we returned to our room during the day, we found that it was already serviced by 1PM. The Executive Floor lounge provided ample variety for breakfast so that we did not feel we were eating the same thing every morning. Evening hors d'oeuvres and drinks were a nice way to relax before our meals at area restaurants. The location was superb. Within 5 minutes of leaving the property, we could be on a ferry to Manley Beach, the zoo or Darling Harbour or viewing the sites around Circular Quay. All of the restaurants that we visited were a short walk from the hotel and there are literally dozens of eating establishments to choose from. Previously voiced concerns from other Trip Advisor reviewers (slow elevators, "tired" rooms, unfriendly staff) were not experienced by us in the least. Would stay here again if/when we venture back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: baloobear
Reviews.Content: I used my reward points to stay here and it is what you would expect from a Marriott. I arrived early in the morning from my international flight, and the check in team couldn't have been more obliging - whilst a room wasn't ready there is an arrivals room where you can shower and change. As i was a gold card holder, I was given access to the exec lounge and went up for breakfast - again cheery staff to greet and my room was ready - on the same floor. The rooms could do with some refurbishment the interiors are classic, but not as modern as other marriott properties. The TV system had a habit of crashing, and internet access is pretty pricey!! That being said it is a corporate hotel, and what you would expect from Marriott. Location is very handy for all the sights being only a stones throw from the ferries and a 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Irritated by the bad service and duplicate charges”
Reviews.Author: irishgalinabq
Reviews.Content: Yesterday was our wedding day. It was a perfect day UNTIL we checked into the Marriott on Circular Quay. We live in Sydney so we had booked into the Marriott as a treat for our wedding night. We had booked through another website so we had paid in advance. When we were checking in, we were in our wedding clothes so the receptionist was very nice to us and even said he would send up a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate the wedding. He also offered us a late check out of 1pm. We headed up to our room which was pretty basic. We called room service and asked for some bath robes so that when we returned from our wedding dinner we could change out of our formal clothes. After about an hour we went to dinner-the bath robes had still not arrived. After we returned from dinner we checked for the bathrobes as I was dying to take off my corset and wedding dress. No bathrobes. So my (new!) husband called down and asked for them again. We were told they had already been delivered. We checked the whole room-no sign of them. To this the person on the phone sighed and responded that they HAD been delivered but he would send the guy up with two more and that it may take a while as the guy who delivers robes was busy. Eventually, as we were about to fall asleep the robes were delivered. The robe guy was pretty apologetic and said that he had delivered the robes to the room next door earlier by accident. There were also a number of other problems-the cold water was not running in the sink so the only choice for hand washing was hot water only which was uncomfortably hot. Of course, we never received our complimentary bottle of wine. And we just checked our bank account and they have charged us a SECOND time for the hotel room. I'm not sure why they charged us again as when my husband checked out there was no outstanding charges on the bill. I called to see what the charge was for and before I could even explain the situation, a very rude lady told me I would have to contact accounts when they open at 9am tomorrow. So yes, I don't think I would recommend the Marriott and we definitely will not be using this chain again. We were expecting a great experience from a 5 star hotel. We have had much better experiences in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking WARNING”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller154
Reviews.Content: Do not leave your car in the hands of this hotel. The valets damaged our vehicle while parking it. When we handed over the keys to our car, they did not warn us about the risk of leaving our car with them. We have given the hotel a chance to respond but after months of phoning and emailing their employee Derek Malley and the General Manager, Jennifer Brown, they refuse to accept responsibility. If you are willing to take the risk and leave your car with this hotel, be prepared to wait 15 minutes for them to retrieve the car. Also, this hotel takes many coachloads of tourists. The porters will just leave the luggage of 100+ people across the inside entrance of the hotel. So if you are travelling alone or as a couple, be prepared to carry your own bags and to wade through miles of luggage to get out of the front entrance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “UNFRIENDLY FRONT DESK STAFF & MORE AT MARRIOTT HARBOUR, QUAY”
Reviews.Author: emma726
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment The Marriott Sydney Habour at Circular Quay was! The rooms were wrong and not ready, even though I had booked and paid at least 8 months in advance. They booked the rooms in my son-in-law's name and wouldn't even put my name on my room even though I booked the rooms in my name and was expecting an important phone call. What kind of rule is that? The staff was rude, snobbish and couldn't care less about our discomfort. the rooms were no better, the refridgerator was'nt cold, we had to buy ice and pay for the delivery. The location was okay, but certainly was'nt worth price of the awful treatment of the clerks or the mediocre rooms. Emma

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eek-i-saw-a-mouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a round the world tour. It was th eonly large corporate hotl we stayed in in ober 5 weeks - and that is what it is - a large corporate hotel - but we booked it for the view and they wre pretty impressive (I have included a photo of the view from our "opera house view" room. Breakfast at the hotel seemed very expensive so we opted to start our day at Starbucks which was almost just outside the hotel and a far cheaper choice. Such a convenient loacation and good view makes the cost worthwhile - if you don't mind that otherwise the room looks as though you could be in any Marriott anywhere in the world. Like someone else said too - the lifts were a nightmare - there was no "popping back to your room" - it was more of a 10 minute wait each way.. Overall though a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: WVTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. You really are paying for that. The indoor pool was cold to me....I don't know if it was really heated or not. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable. I sat on the windowsill and watched the sun rise over the opera house....that was great. Your view of the opera house is going to be of the back of it so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and not up to usual marriott”
Reviews.Author: merionvw
Reviews.Content: We are frequent marriott users and were very disappointed. The standard room was small and could have been any 4 star hotel. The worst thing was the service though. Because we were sightseeing we got back late a few nights and ate in the bar. The food took FOREVER to come and was a very limited menu and not good nor hot when it came. it was almost impossible to get a waiter to take our order for drinks and my husband ended up every night going to the bar and getting them himself. Cocktails are very overpriced, small and not very good. Seafood buffet was good though. Location of hotel great though. We highly reccommend a nearby chinese restaurant to eat - you turn out of the hotel to the right and go up an escalator in the next building along to the first floor. It looks like you are going into an office block but it.s there! The food is wonderful as evidenced by the number of chinese eating there. Also if you go in the door before its a well hidden small shopping mall adn you can get away from the bustle of sydney in a courtyard and get a coffee, sandwich, pastry or go to the chemist or newsagent. We are huge Marriott fans but this hotel was a great dissappointment

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SGGSPAIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for the second year running and the location is great.Just had the one night this year and left on Australia Day.Only a couple of hundred meters from the rocks and still an easy walk into the main shopping areas in Sydney. All the staff are very good especially in the spacious bar area on the ground floor with a special mention for Robert. The beds are comfortable and the hotel has a relaxed feeling. We hope to spend a couple of days in Sydney this year and will stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyandHeather
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is just fantastic and in all honesty that's what you're paying for because at Â£140 a night (without breakfast!!) the overall quality of the rooms doesn't justify it. It was mid winter in Sydney and our room was always a bit cool even with the AC set to 30C !!! and it was also disappointingly small in comparison to rooms we've had at various Mandarin Orientals and Hyatts. Reception and Concierge are helpful but we booked an early check in but did not recieve it but we were given a courtesy room. We stayed here for four nights at the beginning of our 3 week trip and when we came back to Sydney to fly back to the UK we stayed at the Rendevous Stafford in The Rocks which was about half the price and our room was twice as good (complete with well equipped Kitchenette) and breakfast was included. We would not stay at the Marriot again if the Rendevous had rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable, good meeting facilities”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: I was here for a meeting so the hotel was not my choice, and I hadn't stayed here before. It is of a high standard and the lobby is very grand. There is a staircase to three mezanine floors of bar/restaurant/meeting/function rooms so the lobby has a very spacious feel. Check in staff were pleasant, but check out staff were confused as to who was paying my bill - that may not have been their fault, but it did take quite some time to sort out. My room was very nice and the decor was pleasant. The bathroom looks to have been given a mini-face lift which gives it a bit more of an up to date look than it might have had otherwise. I didn't think I had a view until I looked slightly to the right and realised that I had quite a good view of the bridge, albeit framed by tall buildings that were occupied by office workers until quite late at night. The location is good depending on where you want to be (obviously). If you want to be in the heart of shopping then you need to go a bit further up Pit St. But its close to the Quay and the ferry terminals, walking distance to the shops, picture theatres, monorail and the rocks area, and the botanic gardens. So pretty central for all these things. Its almost "just across the road" from circular quay station and about 2 blocks from Wynyard station. Taxis were easy to hail from the front door. If/when I stay here again I will skip the breakfast which at $33 is not good value. I'd rather go for a walk and have a breakfast at one of the city cafes where you can get a hot breakfast for around $10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: TCP-GDI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our month-long trip to Australia and were very pleased with the hotel. - Room was not huge but was of sufficient size so you don't feel cramped. - We had access to the executive lounge, and the views from the lounge were absolutely fantastic. - The location of the hotel is fabulous, 1 minute walk to Circular Quay and the harbor, ferries, etc. - There was a Wagamama's restaurant just behind the hotel, which was great for a cheap quality meal. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Its especially great if you can use your marriott points for a free stay!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings about hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetstarneon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel on 21 June 2008. I was a bit disappointed because I originally booked (through the Marriott website) a non-smoking king bed room. We checked in very early on 21 June and our room was not ready, so we came back late in the peace. When we came back to the hotel, we were given a double bed smoking room. I was extremely disappointed with this, as I specifically asked that my preference would be a non-smoking room double bed, but I got smoking. I had previously stayed at the Marriott in Victoria, Canada in 2007 and was very impressed with the facilities and location. Unfortunately, with these expectations in mind, I was expecting that the Sydney Harbourside Marriott would be the same - unfortunately, it wasn't as good. I do have to say that the Marriott in Victoria was recently renovated in the last year, but the Harbourside Marriott has not been and I saw this in the room. For those who were thinking of staying in a opera house room (I stayed in one of these rooms on the 19th floor), it is not quite what you think.
