You can see the opera house, but the view is seen through in between 2 buildings to the left and right of the window - you don't have a 180 degree view which looks directly onto the opera house (if that makes any sense). Also, your room faces east, so when you go and open the blinds in the morning, the sun comes directly into your room/face and blinds you. I do not recall seeing in the room a USB port (which I saw at the Victoria Marriott) which would have been handy to charge an ipod (for example). The reason why I'm posting this post is because of something that happened on the evening of 21 June, which I was a bit concerned about. I went down to the health club on Saturday evening around 7pm. Firstly, the spa was empty and did not have any water in it (was covered up). So if you have expectations of having a spa in the winter at this Marriott, forget it! Secondly, for those who have children and were thinking about using the pool, the pool does not have a "shallow" depth for you to stand on (I was planning to do some aqua exercises and couldn't, because I'm short and couldn't touch the bottom of the swimming pool without my head being submerged!). The pool is 1.4 metres deep all the way around. Nice pool, despite this. Finally, the biggest concern for me was that I was there for 40 minutes and the health club in that time was not manned. I was appalled because of the swimming pool and the dangers of children drowning - too bad, no one was there to save you if you drowned. Also, there are lockers, but at the time I was there, there was no keys for the lockers, so you could use them. I went to the desk and because it wasn't manned, I couldn't get help, The sauna was very nice, I must admit (though it was not steaming when I was there - it was nice and hot!). With the Bvlgari pack you get, you only get one soap bar, bath salts and something else for ONE person (not for 2 people). We also didn't have bathrobes in our room, so that was a bit sad. Finally, the buffet breakfast is good (on the whole). The fruit was very sweet and nice (given the fact that it is winter in Sydney). Don't go at 10am - we had to queue for 10 minutes before getting a table! I forgot to mention - the location is excellent - 2 minutes walk from the airport train and circular quay. Loved the location of the hotel. You pay for the location though. Walking distance to many things.

Reviews.Title: “this is the best!”
Reviews.Author: aussie1Sydney
Reviews.Content: Out of all the five stars that I have stayed at in Sydney, this was the best by far! The level of service was outstanding, from check in through to dining room service. Had booked a room and was upgraded to a suite because it was my wife's birthday! They have an Executive Lounge that you are given access to which has free coffee and drinks. The staff in here went out of their way to make us feel welcome and could not do enough to help. The room itself was very comfortable with magnificent views over Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. Breakfast was very nice with an egg chef on hand to freshly prepare omelettes, pancakes etc. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: invisigirl23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a work awards night. It was a very pleasant stay, the room was spacious and decorated in heritage colours. Being a work package we were in the cheapest rooms, so didn't have a view, but no complaints as the room made up for it. Very close to Circular Quay and MCA where the event was held. My only complaint was the hotel didn't deliver the welcome letter explaining when to arrive at the event and that there would be a photographer outside to snap professional mementos of the evening, so as a result only about 10% of the guests knew about this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent convenient location!! Average service...”
Reviews.Author: WV18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay for 4 days in March 2008 during the Easter break. Location was definitely one of the best available, very convenient and super easy access to all ferries, trains and buses. Arrived at 9am, and they were kind enough to let us check-in straight away. Eventhough it wasn't exactly the room that we booked, but it was acceptable (24th floor Harbour View Room), or otherwise we had to wait til 3pm. The view was not the best, but still could see the Sydney Opera House. All staff was relatively friendly and helpful, and the hotel condition was perfect. On the other hand, we were rather disappointed at the room condition and its cleanliness. It looked a bit old, definitely not one of their newer rooms, and cleanliness was slightly below average for 4-5 star hotels, especially the bathroom condition on the first day we arrived, let's not go into details tho :) One other point to mention, we did inform the hotel before and upon check-in that it was part of our honeymooon trips (1st leg), but we didn't receive any congratulation or special treatment or gifts from the hotel at all. I guess we expected more, as we did get married at Marriott Hotel in Jakarta as well and their service, cleanliness and the special treatment that we received over there was fantabolous!! Thus, we thought we would receive the same in Sydney. But overall, the hotel environment was excellent inside and outside. Highly recommended to anyone, but for our next trips, we might try other hotels near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pay the Extra for the Opera House View”
Reviews.Author: KPS92-5
Reviews.Content: Great location, terriffic service and wonderful view (from select rooms). We spent our 10th wedding anniversay trip (adult only trip is ex the 3 kids) at the Marriott and it was excellent.The hotel is a half block from Circular Quay which is the harbor area around the Opera house, Harbor bridge, dozens of excellent restaurants and shopping in the Rocks. Restaurants Near by: - Cafe Sydeny on the fifth floor of the customs house was our favorite. Need to reserve a terrace table overlooking the opera house and bridge, best inthe harbor. - Quay on 3nd floor of Overseas Terminal has the best side view of the Opera house of any of the restaurants. - Aria at the end of the pier just next to the Opera house was OK but I think over rated and we personally would not return to this one preferring instead to go back to Cafe Sydney or Quay. Activities: - Wine Country: "Red Carpet" tours out of the Marriott to the Hunter Valley vineyards was very nice. An all day event thouhg, 0730-1800...Visited three wineries, had brefast with the kangaroos on the way, choclate factory and a great lunch. We were lucky to have only one other couple with us. - Live Music: "The Basement" litterally next to the Marriott is an excellent live jazz club (all AUS bars and restaurants are NON smoking:) ) -Bridge Climb: You get to go to the top of the Harbor Bride, makes for excellent photos overlooking the Opera House and city. It's a 3.5 hour event and is superbly organized, completely profesional and very safety conscious. You are connected to the bridge the enitire time by a cable but you are very free to walk to walk and climb ladders. A must do experience.... - Bondi Beach: A ~$20 tai ride away, it a very popular spoke for locals with a very nice cliff walk trail starting form here connecting to adjecent beaches. We enjoyed walking the trail, eating at one of the many side walk cafes and drinks from the bar over the swim club at the one end of the beach offers excellent views... -Roayl Botanica Gardens: great place for liesurely walks and photo taking just next to the opera house Shopping - "Rocks Market" by the base of the Harbor Bridge was excellent for artisian type items of very good quality are reasonable prices. Most prices are marked and haggling is minimal. Lots of jewerly, photos, art work, books, puzzles, food items, kids plush animals, and some clothing items - Pitt Street Mall area It's in walking distance to dozens of excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good View from room”
Reviews.Author: COTravelers22
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and booked our room with Marriott using reward pts. We paid the extra surcharge for a room with an Opera House view, and it was worth it! We had a very nice room on high floor. The room and hotel were very clean. Our room was good size and the bathroom was large enough. There was a light bulb out in the bathroom and it was replaced promptly. Instant coffee in the room, not a coffee maker like you may be familiar with at Marriott's in the US. (Starbucks around the corner). The hotel is in a fabulous location. We were able to walk (or catch a ferry) to just about everything. The front desk was extremely accommodating! We had placed an early check-in request when we made our reservation but our flight was even earlier than expected. We were able to check-in at 9 am. Check-in and check-out was very efficient. The concierge desk was very helpful also. We had rented an Avis car from their lobby (convenient). However, we ended up cancelling the car because everything was within walking distance except the day we planned in the Blue Mtns. The concierge helped us book a trip with a driver and 4wd vehicle instead. There are hotels in the harbour area that probably have a better view but you will pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room with a side view of the bridge”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and was on the 10th floor. The room was on the small side but bed was large and comfortable. I had a side view between some buildings of the harbour bridge. There are 5 lifts available so you're never waiting long to get down to the lobby. I would recommend that you pay extra if you're staying here on holidays for a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great views.”
Reviews.Author: wal_on_hol
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel in April 2008. We paid extra for a room with a view of the Opera House, however, as the hotel is down one of the side streets, we werenâ€™t expecting much of a view. We were pleasantly surprised â€“ great view from the side window of our 27th floor room. We caught the train to Circular Quay from the airport for around $16 per person. It was much less hassle than catching a cab through traffic on a Friday afternoon â€“ and we were in our hotel room within 45 minutes of our plane landing. The hotel staff were very friendly and efficient. The room was comfortable and quiet, with everything you need (good shower, bath tub, lots of pillows).The room service menu is extensive (and expensive) and our food took 45 minutes to arrive. The food was okay as far as room service goes. The hotel is very close to Cafe Sydney in the Customs House (we could actually see the restaurant from our room). We had an excellent dinner there and would highly recommend it (although make sure you book well in advance). There is a convenience store straight across the road from the hotel. Although prices are not marked on anything, it is more reasonable than the convenience shop down at Circular Quay and has a good range of things. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Mall and main shopping area. We paid about $10 to catch a cab to the Powerhouse Museum. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service, and Location”
Reviews.Author: OpusTheCat
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Marriott Circular Quay and absolutely loved it! Upon entering the hotel we had help with our luggage and were able to check in at 10 AM in the morning. Our room had very nice furniture and a great view of the Sydney Opera House. The bathroom was beautiful and included a tub AND a separate shower. We are Marriott Gold members so we also had access to the Concierge Lounge. The lounge was great. Free breakfast in the morning and drinks and appetizers from 4 PM to 9 PM. The lounge was large and nicely stocked. The location of the hotel is excellent. Within a block of the train station and ferries. (We took the train from the airport to the hotel) You can see our full trip report with numerous pictures of Sydney at our sunnytripreports web site.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Junkster
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in April on a special package deal offered by the hotel and advertised in The Age newspaper. It included a double room with city views, breakfasts and free valet parking (unsually costly in the centre of Sydney). We were given a room with a great views of the bridge and harbour which was wonderful. The location is also great - a short walk to the Rocks, Circular Quay, restaurants and the gardens. Our only complaints were that we were charged for one breakfast each day which was odd as there was two of us staying there. This was quickly sorted at check-out and no charge was made to us. Another hiccup was the rudeness of the valet parking attendant who was very rude and condescending. However, the check-in and room staff were extremely helpful and friendly and professional. Overall, I would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocolatefriend
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay for 4 nights in a king room. The 2 nights Fri and Sat included stunning buffet breakfast for $345 a night and then the rate increased for the Sunday and Monday but no breakfast included ?! Great view on 18th floor of Opera House and the best thing really is the location. Just a short walk to the restaurants and life of the harbour. Hint if you want a cheap breakfast and healthy lunch right next door is a great cafe ! The hotel pool says heated but it feels cold ! Ask room service for your robes as they are free for your stay and so is a shoe shine ! The desk staff are very helpful and prompt. We were able to fax information for business for free, the concierges were great and very quick to look anything up they didn't know and the taxis prompt from out the front. About $30 to the airport. Requested a late check out the night before and we were able to stay until 2pm @ no extra charge due to late flight. Lovely gesture. Handy map at the desk, short walk to the centre of town for shopping and make sure you do the Walking tour of the Rocks. The tour guides are brilliant ! Comfy bed, excellent black out facility (best in hotel ever )and rooms were clean. I would say this is a 4.5 star establishment. The atmosphere is elegant but welcoming. Looking forward to trying the Marriott in Liverpool UK later in the year !

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Chianti_girl24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Australia, making our way back to to Sydney fly out. We stayed in Darling Harbour the first 4 nights in Sydney which was nice, but now that I know about this hotel and its location, I would stay here with no hesitation. Walking to the ferries, the Opera House and The Rocks was a breeze. The ladies in the Executive Suite were full of great suggestions on dinner spots and made our reservations for us. We even got to see Chris Robinson who was on tour in Australia while there. A star sighting is always fun! The room was great. Corner room with a view of the Opera House and Harbour. You can't go wrong staying at this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly worth the price”
Reviews.Author: janellb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days. It was extremely overpriced. The rooms were alright, the service was alright. But they made me pay extra for internet in my room (when I paid full price for the room) and even in the business center. I was stuck on my floor for 15 mins waiting for an elevator to check out. Other than the location, it was mediocre at best. I've stayed at places in Sydney that had the same location pluses for much cheaper and have enjoyed my stay much more. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sydney Harbour Location”
Reviews.Author: Slamar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property 3/1/08-3/14/08 for business. The hotel rooms were very spacious with nice bathrooms, a robe, a small hotel bar/refrigerator, coffee maker, and safe. The showers were excellent - plenty of hot water and excellent water pressure. The gym was okay, with several treadmills, stairclimbers, stationary bikes, and machines to work the legs and arms. However, they did not have any machines that worked the abs, something needed after all of the seafood that I consumed! Pool area looked nice, but I didn't actually use the pool. The hotel location was perfect for the Central Business District, and walking to the office was very easy. The hotel is also half a block from the Circular Quay bus stops and ferry dock - excellent. We took buses to Bondi beach and Watson's Bay and the ferriy to Manly Beach. Back to food - there are also plenty of restaurants near the hotel, including a wonderful Italian restaurant right next door. The hotel also has a phenomenal seafood buffet available nightly, with expanded offerings on the weekend. I went during the week and had my fill of crab legs, jumbo prawns, and many other excellent dishes, including multiple mini-desserts. The lobby bar area offers live music Wednesday - Saturday. The Wednesday night piano/jazz singer John Harkins, a Chicago native, made my stay that much more enjoyable - have a nice club sandwich, some tiramisu and a drink and sit back and enjoy the music. The staff in the lobby bar were also outstanding - very attentive and friendly, not overbearing. The only draw back of the hotel was the lack of wireless internet in the rooms - I took my laptop to the lobby to use the wireless access. This is expensive on a daily basis but for 24 actual hours of use at $24.95, this option was very reasonable for a 2 week stay. Concierge staff was also very good - recommended good restaurants, a phenomenal tour to the Blue Mountains, and a place to get my eyeglasses fixed/replaced. They also sold calling cards for the US - very convenient and reasonable. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel for business and leisure. Had a great time, in part due to the very good service that I experienced from the room attendants, front desk, conceirge, and lobby bar staff! PS - for those arriving early in the AM, they have a lounge where you can relax and freshen up/shower after the LONG flight from the east coast - a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Love The Marriott Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: mummy_8Melbourne
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the Hotel for position, walk to the ferry,resturants etc.and just a 10 min.walk to the main downtown shopping mall. The hotel is very clean and for a large hotel is very quite, we were there over the weekend and the hotel was very busy but still very peaceful. And breakfast was great just so many choices. The only fault I have is with the car parking on check out at 7-05am on a Monday morning it took them 32 mins to bring my car up , so make sure you allow plenty of time, also make sure you get everything you need from your car as you have to get someone to go down with you to get anything from your car. But will go back to the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a reward for three nights after working in Mascot. This hotel was great - excellent service, comfortable room (mine was on the 29th floor with a nice view of the Opera House), good bar and restaurant with typical hotel prices (but the bar wasn't bad in that respect - get a Bondi Beauty, especially if Annica (sp?) is making it!). It's so easy to get here and to get around - CityRail and Sydney Ferry both operate a block away. I would love to stay here again next time I am in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: annieo15
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to ferries and Rocks area. Our room on the executive floor was spacious with superb bed linen, and extremely comfortable beds. We stayed on two separate occasions, the first occasion with shower over bath, but on the second occasion a corner room with very good walk in shower. It was disappointing not to have free internet access in the executive lounge. The ambiance and service in the lobby bar was disappointing for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: cwaNy
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect experience. Traveling as a single female, I felt especially well taken care of by the entire staff at the Sydney Harbour Marriott. The Front Office Manager, Gopu Nayar, was especially helpful. One of the best features of the hotel is its LOCATION! Perfectly situated to the harbour and all of its attractions. A lovely stroll to the "Rocks" area, the bridge and the Opera House. Immediately upon check in I was upgraded to a room with a view of the bridge The room was nicely appointed, modern, clean, roomy and 'fresh' feeling. I didn't have any meals at the hotel, but there is a small breakfast place right next door to the right, that served a fast, cheap, satisfying breakfast. The gym facilities were very nice as well. Thank you Marriott for making my trip to Sydney start and end on such a positive note!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: houston77068
Reviews.Content: Had planned to spend two nights at this hotel prior to a cruise. Due to airline problems missed one night, but the hotel cancelled the missed night and held our room for our arrival. Since we arrived in the early morning hotel held our luggage in storage till a room was available later in the day. Gave us a very nice and comfortable room when check in time came and brought our luggage to the room without asking. Location of the hotel is marvelous, just a long block from Sydney harbor, opera house and cruise terminal. Good transportation for the immediate area as well as to and from airport. Plenty of sightseeing in the neigborhood as well as resturants. Didn't eat at the hotel due to sightseeing. Sydney is very expensive so plan accordingly. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A great situation overlooking the harbour”
Reviews.Author: aroberta
Reviews.Content: A good choice if you are in Sydney for a short stay. Pay the extra for a room with views of the harbour and opera house - it is worth it. Staff very attentive. Breakfast excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sydney sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: mimi0
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Marriott for 4 nights and experienced the madness/excitement of New Years Eve, albeit with serious jetlag!!! Room had two double beds (2 adults, 2 ten year olds) and a very nice, well laid out bathroom. Breakfast was delicious. We were the jetlaggers who arrived as it opened at 7am each morning!!!! Kids loved the freshly made pancakes. Great choice, ambience and service all round. This hotel is in a prime position for sight-seeing. Walking distance to Opera house and Botanic gardens. Also The Rocks area which is amazing. Boats leaving regular from the Quay for loads of places. We went to Manly beach which was lovely. Also got bus to Bondi from nearby the hotel. Worth paying just for the location if you're on a short maybe-never-to-be-repeated visit!!! Cocktails in the lobby bar were great too - recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience- gave away my prepaid room”
Reviews.Author: kataTexas
Reviews.Content: room not ready; prepaid executive room w/ view on exec floor and did not get my room for 4 adults; so, had to settle for small suite w/ one king bed and 2 roll away beds stuffed in this cramped room; they simply gave away my room! what a bunch of crap! they knew i was prepaid and reserved for 3 mos before and should have had MY room!!!!!!!! since i prepaid, they would not discount this lower grade room>>>>they were ultra busy...too busy to provide any type of quality service....sad! we were so far away from home and had to put up w/this from what i had previous thought was a quality hotel chain>>>>>>never again will i trust Marriott..........and as for Hotels.com.....their prepayment requirment sucks! there are alot more hotels in this area to stay at and i would suggest one of them........

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Marfak
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would make it to Sydney, but January found me staying a week at the Marriott at Circular Quay. Despite the unusally rainy weather, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is a block away from the main rail and ferry station on the harbor, and some rooms have views of the Opera House (for $50 extra.) The hotel is walking distance to everywhere: the Harbor, the Opera House, The Rocks (great Saturday and Sunday market there), the Botannical Gardens (check out the thousands of fruit bats hanging from the trees by the tropical plant pyramid), Market Street, the Observatory, the Bridge Walk and many great restaurants. The hotel is a very nice Marriott: atrium lobby, lobby lounge, larger-size rooms, very comfortable and clean, and a nice buffet breakfast. You do have to pay for internet access. And the toilets are the low water kind, which means you have to flush them four times. All in all, though, this is a solid pick if you are staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and location! but...........”
Reviews.Author: kipster39
Reviews.Content: usual american chain hotel. Location right on circular quay with all its travel links. room had partial view of opera house and water, worth all the money in the world. room large, comfortable, brekfast up on top floor, fine. Would stay here again just for location and view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld25
Reviews.Content: We really couldn't have asked for a nicer stay in Sydney than what we got at the Marriott Sydney Harbour. It is in the best location you could possibly ask for. It's on Circular Quay, a major tourist area and the main ferry terminal, which takes you all around Sydney and the Sydney suburbs. The train station is at Circular Quay as well and will take you all over Sydney and the surrounding region. It's a 5 minute walk from The Rocks, which hosts the Rocks Market on weekends (great shopping!), excellent dining options, and fun nightlife. The rooms are beautiful and clean. We didn't pay for a harbour view room, but they upgraded us for free since they had availability, which was wonderful. It was probably the best view of any hotel I've stayed at. The beds were so comfortable, which was really important to us with jet lag! The bathroom was fairly spacious, 2 of us could get ready at a time in there. We loved Sydney and our stay at the Marriott topped it all off. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! It may be a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for and it is well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ismith67
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this city hotel for 1 night on a flying business trip north. Service was sensational and professional as one would expect from a 5 star property. Conveniently situated neat the financial hub. A new base for our northern journeys.

Reviews.Title: “No Reward points”
Reviews.Author: castle18
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel. The charges that they charge on your bill, you have to scrutinizes it carefully because it doesn't tally at all! The worst thing is about the rewards points. If you are staying there with a third party paying you, I would suggest you to stay in other hotels like Radisson. Marriot don't give rewards points iof it is paid by 3rd party. This is very frustrating because I choose Marriot as I though I could be rewarded. In fact I have colleagues staying in Radisson and they ware rewarded with points. I would never ask my agent to book this hotel again as this is a 'nothing' great hotel plus the services is not good either.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Opera House view”
Reviews.Author: stsomewhere4
Reviews.Content: After researching extensively the hotels with Opera House views, I picked the Marriot as it was not as absurdly expensive as some of the other choices. We were delighted. Lovely view from both 20 and 23rd floors (2 separate stays during Australia trip). Steps from the Harbor, ferries, the Rocks and close walk to downtown. Staff was helpful, food was good and room was very nice. The hotel is a great base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sailornep5
Reviews.Content: We should mention we booked this hotel through Priceline, which gave us a fabulous deal of $150/night when regular rooms went for $300/night. But while our rave review may be slightly enhanced due to our bargain, I would still consider it a solid hotel choice even at full price. The hotel definitely seems more geared towards business travelers, but the location itself proves great for tourists and leisure travelers as well. It is located only a short walk from The Rocks and Opera House, as well as the ferries in the Quay. The concierge was very helpful without being snooty (as some concierges are nowadays) and gave us some great restaurant recommendations (including one where I was inches away from David Beckham....but that's a different story). We tried the breakfast buffet, which was a bit pricey at $33/pp but was filling and had all the standard offerings. One note of advice - check the taxi rates before coming! I had looked at the Marriott website and it said a cab ride from the airport was only $35. Our cab ride ended up being $61 and we just thought the website was outdated. Later on, we asked the concierge about it and they said that we were definitely overcharged, and that their bellman should have noticed the price and had us refuse to pay. I don't blame the bellman because he was very busy getting our luggage into the hotel, but just know there are cab drivers out there that will screw you - if you know the right fare ahead of time, you will be better prepared to dispute it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for a Splurge”
Reviews.Author: GermantownMD
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. I can't say one bad thing about it. The room was spacious and luxurious. The amenities were great. The location can not be beat. It is very close to the harbor and the Sydney Opera House and the spectacular bonatical gardens. It is also very close to the subway. We stayed for 4 nights and felt very welcome and safe. It was a great way to see Sydney for the first time. It was a bit of a splurge for us, but I figured, how many times am I going to be in Sydney?? At the end of our trip to Australia we came back to Sydney and stayed in a less expensive place on the other side of town. My opinion - Splurge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suffersgirlfriend
Reviews.Content: We ordered this hotel on a website where you name your own price and paid about half the price. The hotel is in a great location, only a couple minutes walk from the Opera House. Upon checking in, we were upgraded to an opera house view on the executive level, so we had access to the executive lounge, which was great because breakfast was included. The pool was undergoing constructiong - but we heard no noise and the hotel had arranged for the guests who wanted a pool to go across the street to the four seasons. So far its the best hotel of our honeymoon and we would gladly stay again, but would defiantely try to get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel to stay in upon returning to Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravler123
Reviews.Content: After our trip to Port Douglas, my family returned to Sydney for two nights. After our expierence with Shangri La, my mom booked a place more family orientated. The lobby had a huge Christmas tree in it, due to our end of November visit. The people at the front desk were very kind and our room had a perfect view of the Sydney harbor. The only problem with it was the air conditioning was on all the time and you were practically frozen. The breakfast buffett was decent, but the location of this hotel was amazing! You could easily walk to the harbor within 5 minutes an array of resturants and night life. It was near a mall also which we had to stop at the doctors for a jellyfish sting. The concierge was very helpful and my mother and I went on a few great trips. This hotel was a great place to see Sydney from!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Top quality Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location just a few minutes walk from the ferries and bustle of circular key and 1o minutes to The Rocks and Bridge Walk. Entrance and lobby is quite grand and the latter features an open bar area albeit at a cost but my guess is the patrons are mostly business travellers. I arrived very early morning and was able to use a room with decent bathroom allocated for such folks. The pool area was being refurbished during my stay which bodes well for the future, however, I phoned hotel just after booking to reserve a room that would not be shaken apart by this work but upon arrival there was no record of this arrangement. I returned later in the day after a great time doing the harbour bridge walk to find I'd been allocated a high room 2 room suite which was great.news particularly as this was a freebie using Marriott points. Everything in the room was excellent from linens to flat screen TVs. Main bathroom was fantastic, very modern, spacious complete with jacuzzi. Train station is just a 3 minute walk which will also get you without change to the airport. The combined ferry/train/bus1 day pass is great value making lunch at Bondi beech and watching the sun set at Milsons Point ready options. Just made it into the 5* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMuk
Reviews.Content: Although we would usually try to go for something a little more boutique and less businessy, actually this hotel turned out to be fab for a holiday base in Sydney. It's big, brash and very business like, but it's location makes it perfect for holiday makers too. It was about 3 days before we ventured more than a walk away from the hotel, there was so much to do right on the door step. We ended up staying here 3 times over our trip to Australia and we'd only really planned on staying there the once. We paid for a room with a view for the first visit which was worth it, but downgraded ourselves for the next 2 stays. Honestly the room standard was exactly the same so unless you really want a view I'd go for the regular room and save yourself a few dollars. The beds were comfy, the aircon worked well and quietly (no opening of windows though), bathroom was great. I really have no complaints at all. They started work on the pool on the day we left but noise was minimum and they have an arrangement with another hotel if you wanted to use the pool. I had a facial in their spa while I was there and it was very, very good. Breakfast was OK and served til 10.30 which is great (sometimes business hotels finish breakfast early). The only gripe I had was the rock ballads CDs they played at top volume - really not breakfast material (and that is really me being very picky). There's not loads of atmosphere here - but you get that from the city itself so who cares.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ozcouple2608
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot for one night for our 1 year wedding Anniversary in August 2007 The hotel was booked through a last minute booking site, and we got a nice package:- Bvulgari bath pack, Wine, Valet parking and breakfast for Two, for what you would expect to pay for a 5 star room. The hotel is in a good location, near to the harbour and shopping. The hotel has a nice little piano bar, with great cocktails! The room could do with a little updating, (green carpet), and the bathroom could do with new fitouts, but the King size bed was super comfortable, and food from room service very nice. The staff were courteous and all in all the Marriot is what we expected from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very business oriented”
Reviews.Author: drcrab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the new year's break and although it was very clean, comfortable and centrally located, we felt that it was very business oriented (even though everyone who stayed there were probably on holiday during that period of time). it was very centrally located though, and that was very useful for us as tourists. The price was ok for the peak period - however if I had to do it again, I'd probably start booking for a hotel much earlier and chosen a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel; stands up to the Marriott reputation”
Reviews.Author: goluxe
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located to many tourist attractions, like the Rocks and the Circular Quay and the botanic gardens. We were a little bummed that a majority of the guests seemed American--was like we'd travelled so far to be close to home! So if you're looking for something where you'll be surrounded by Australians this isn't it (though of course, you probably wouldn't be looking at a Marriott, eh?). It's a big hotel too, so don't expect much personal service (though we did get to know the concierges, who were very helpful). Also, the neighborhood seemed like Sydney's equivalent to Wall Street, which meant that things nearby were closed on the weekend, and lots of characterless restaurants. Quite a nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Sydney Harbour meets all expectations”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentfamily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriott with my husband and two small children. We chose the hotel for it's location and star rating and were not disappointed. From past reviews I have to say there were absolutely NO PROBLEMS with the lifts, they came within a couple of seconds each time. We also payed extra for an Opera House view. It was nice, but there are still a lot of other tall buildings semi-obstructing the view, so agree with a past reviewer and not sure if that was worth it. Our package rate also included a full buffet breakfast for two adults (although we did not have to pay for the kids) and valet parking which was excellent. The breakfast was wonderful and plentiful with the usual expectations from a 5 star hotel; hot and cold selections, pastries, cereals, juices, bacon & eggs with various sides as well as eggs and pancakes made fresh on demand. We also had the Saturday night buffet dinner which was not cheap @ $80.00 per adult, but we made good use of it as there was seafood included which we very much enjoyed. What stood out for us was the staff service and attention. They were very friendly and down to earth, not at all snooty as you expect from some 5 star hotels. Everyone we came across was excellent, especially the restaurant where we were given extra special attention and service due to the kids. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone, especially those travelling with familes.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early August 2007. Since my husband has platinum status with Marriott we had a fabulous room on the highest floor and access to the concierge lounge, where we had free evening snacks and drinks and breakfast. We arrived at this hotel at 8am on a Saturday and they were able to get us a room right away. Our room was very spacious and modern, as was the bathroom, which had a separate tub and shower. The only downfall about this hotel was that the elevators were super slow, especially when you are on the highest floor - it took several minutes for the elevator to pick us up and then once it picked us up it would stop at nearly every floor on the way down. But the front desk did warn us about this at check-in and said that it was being fixed. This hotel is a 3 minute walk to the Circular Quay Station, 5 minute walk from the Rocks area, 10 minute walk to the art gallery, and 20-25 minute walk to the Darlying Harbor area. Since the hotel is so close to the Rocks and Circular Quay areas there are lots of restaurants and shopping in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Better Rooms and Poor Elevators”
Reviews.Author: KatGirrl
Reviews.Content: This was an above average Marriott Hotel overall. The lobby was a little cold and impersonal but the rooms were very nice. Very comfortable bed and FANTASTIC bathtubs with just the right pitch for a long, hot bath. The workout room/spa was very 80s and could really use an upgrade. The main piano bar was a bit cheesy as well and had a small fruit fly infestation. However, the live music played there was top notch. Room service was very inexpensive, but the food was not great, nor all that bad. The main complaints of the hotel were the 1) EXTREMELY slow elevators. They are going thru an upgrade of the elevators at this time, but waits can be as long as 25 minutes and at one point a traveller in our group took the stairs from the 32nd floor no less! 2) Breakfast on the exec floor was somewhat redundant by day 3 and I was there for 8 days and 3) The high speed internet access was $19.95 per day! Highway robbery, especially at the high rates being charged per night. Great location. Better than most Marriotts. Not high end, but better than normal.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most expensive hotel on our trip and well worth every penny. We had a fantastic veiw of the opera house and the harbour. The room although small was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was excelent and the shower was hot and had plenty of pressure. What more can i say there is nothing bad i can say about this hotel. It was the highlight of the trip and i hope to stay there again some day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravellerPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for pleasure using Marriott Reward points for 2 nights. The hotel is ideally situated in the Circular Quay area, only 3 minutes from the City Train stop from the airport. Circular Quay is also where the Opera House and the Ferries are located allowing easy access to all of Syndney, including the Rocks area, Harbor Bridge, shopping, Rocks market, and ferries to Manly and everywhere else. The hotel was also within easy walking distance of a number of restaurants in the Rocks area. The room provided was better than average for Marriott, with all amenities and nice shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SimiDan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week and a half. We found the hotel's location excellent because of it's location at the Circular Quay and proximity to the Sydney Opera House. The room itself was pretty standard - nothing special except a view of the Opera House. One of the most frustrating parts of our stay was the slow elevators. Though they have multiple lifts, they don't communicate with each other and make for long waits. On Sunday mornings it was not unusual to wait 30 - 40 minutes for an already overstuffed elevator. We stayed on the 22nd floor and at times felt like taking the stairs, but the stairwells were locked with alarmed (fire exit only) doors. We felt imprisoned. Another drawback was the lack of computer access. Their "business center" has two out-of-date computers and one low quality printer, and they charge $1 per minute for use. If you have a car be prepared to pay $30 a day for parking, and it's not self-parking - you must use valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.. perfect location”
Reviews.Author: q9rve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late June 2007 and was not dissapointed by one bit. The best feature of this hotel seems to be its prime location- which is right on Circular Quay. Only a 5 minutes walk to The Rocks, and a 3 minutes walk to the harbor area, which gives you a nice view of the opera house and the harbor bridge. Check in was very smooth, with the lobby area always staff with someone to get the door and your luggages for you. The lobby is atrium style which doesn't make you feel like you're being thrown into a compact space. I got a suite on the top floor (32nd floor), which is an executive floor, which gives you access to their nice little executive lounge on the 30th floor. The suite was quite a reasonable size. The pillow menu was very interesting...makes sleeping a lot more fun! The in room furnitures were in perfect conditions. My understanding is that this hotel is quite old but has probably gone through quite an extensive renovation recently as everything in the room seems to be spotless. The lounge on the 30th floor was quite nice, but with the only drawback in terms of size- it was too small. It gets crowded very easily and can be hard to get the waiter's attention. Breakfast is served here but it could have been a bit better as it lacked variety (eg. only scrambled eggs are provided, no other choices available). Nevertheless, this is a great hotel. I saw all types of guests here from business men down to those with their little ones. Great location, friendly staff, nice and clean rooms and a pretty reasonable rate. Highly recommend to honeymooners and first timers in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - just as fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property in two years. And I was very pleased to see that the hotel and staff were just as fantastic the second time around! A mix-up by my travel agent prevented me from getting the complimentary breakfast (sometimes) afforded members of the Marriott Rewards program, but the desk clerk made up for it plenty: placing me on the executive floor with lounge access. The property is kept neat as a pin (as grandma used to say); the breakfast buffet plentiful and "almost" worth the $33 charge. (Again, enquire about a complimentary breakfast when you check in) The property is located a few yards from the Circular Quay railstation and, in theory, you could go straight from airport to hotel with just a very short walk. The famous Rocks area is less than a 10 minute stroll. Even though I am Hilton Diamond, this is the place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddranch
Reviews.Content: Our family just spent 3 nights at this beautiful hotel in Sydney. We paid $50 extra a night and had a stunning view of the Opera House. The room was very nice with 2 queen beds, and a beautiful bathroom. It is not a huge room, but was big enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers and lots of luggage! We requested a newspaper each day and all other requests were promptly met. The hotel is in a great location. We walked to The Rocks area and to the Harbour ferries easily. All of the busses and public transportation are just a block away. There is a nice little Deli just next to the hotel where we ate a few meals...very nice food. The hotel restaurants were very pricey and we never ate at the hotel. The room came with a hot pot and makings for coffee and tea. I would definitely stay there again...it is a great location and we didn't need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kris33
Reviews.Content: We were there last month at the start and end of our honeymoon and really enjoyed staying here. The staff knew it was our honeymoon and bumped us to an Executive Level Suite - it was a nice size, 2 bathrooms and a fabulous view of the Opera House. Also, they sent a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. It was very clean, service was great - concierge was very helful with directions, making dinner reservations, etc - and it is a great location for tourists. Easy access to Opera House, Botanic Gardens, bridge walk, buses, ferries to beaches. There did not seem to be a ton of nightlife and some other areas looked funkier with more interesting shops, bars, maybe cheaper dining options. But it was great if you only have a few days in town and want to hit the big attractions. The Executive Lounge was nice - not sure its worth it if you pay for it (which we did during our end stay) but there is a nice buffet breakfast, soft beferages all day, and a pretty good cocktail hour (2 hrs food, 4 hours drinks). Overall, we highly recommend it for a business stay or a first-timer to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great business Traveller Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Constant_Traveller99
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel in a nice location - easy access to airport and other business needs when travelling to different parts of the city. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Business Center is average, Internet in the rooms work great. Restaurant in the hotel is good, with nice buffets for those that are interested in that. I truly enjoyed staying here; I stayed here a few times in 2006 I would recomend the hotel for business traveller, and also for those planing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: birdhouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in early April. Loved the location. Walking distance to Circular Quay. the Rocks and Pitt street shopping. We even walked to Darling Harbour about 15 minutes away. The staff was promt and had our room ready when we arrived at 7:30am after a long international flight. The only problem was the elevators where being renovated and only two out of five where operating. This made for some slow and crowded elevators particularly if you're up in the upper floors where the rooms with the view are located. I would stay here again but check for full elevator operation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldAventurer
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. This hotel is within walking distance to the harbor, the opera house, the botanical gardens, the circular quay. It is accessible to the airport. You simply get on the airport metro/train dsetination Sydney and get off the circular quay/harbor exit and you are within one block walking distance to the hotel. The staff at the front desk were wonderful; they let us check in early and check out late. The rooms were nicely decorated and the bathroom well stocked. The bed was very comfortable, with down pillows. Every staff person we encountered from the doormen to the cleaning crew was extremenly friendly and helpful. Definitely worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Whilst visiting friends i decided tp stay here for 3 nights back in June "06" Check in was swift and efficient. i had a harbour view room on the 21st floor and the view was fantastic! The gym and pool were absolutely fantastic and the staff were top notch! They had nightly entertainment in the foyer with a band (I stayed over a weekend so maybe it doesnt happen during the week) and i was VERY Impressed! Circular Quay which is a 2 min walk has some great eateries for anyone who has never been there! i ordered room service one night and found price wise it actually wasn't too bad. P.S. The Hawaiian Pizza was yummy! Room (Standard) was very luxurious and with the deal i got included 2 bottles of wine and Bvlgari tolietries! The bathroom had a bath/shower combination and was a little small which is probably the only fault i could find. Great location not far from any of the tourist spots, Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtkitchn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in March during our vacation to Australia. The hotel location is great, and a short walk will get you to the Rocks, the ferry terminal, or shopping. The hotel lobby is spacious and friendly. Our room was very nice, with comfortable beds and sliding "shutters" that darkened your room so you could sleep. My only complaint of the room was that there was a very small (about an inch) step up to our bathroom and I stubbed my toe (HARD) on it in the middle of the night. My husband creaked his back stepping out of the bathroom and not realizing that the floor was lower than the bathroom floor. Another complaint was the elevators. I believe the hotel may have been working on some of the elevators, but it took upwards of ten minutes to get a lift sometimes. Otherwise, we had a very pleasant stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to begin a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: nyc2006321
Reviews.Content: This was the best way to begin our honeymoon! We booked using priceline bid and got this five star at a steal - $137/night! We arrived early - 9am b/c we were coming from the states. So they let us into the early arrivals lounge. It had internet, a shower (which we used), coffee, snacks, etc. We were upgraded to an opera house view room for our first night there. Location of this hotel cannot be beat! It's right by circular quay and you can catch all buses, ferries, and trains from this station. It's also a 1 min walk to the rocks. One minor thing about the concierge though was that whenever we asked how to get someplace, they always recommended to take a cab. It's a little crazy when many of the places we were going to were within walking distance or a quick bus ride away. Luckily we figured out how to get around on public transport. That being said, the concierge was very helpful with my many requests and questions. One other minor thing was the hot tub and pool. The hot tub was disgusting with dirt floating in the foam. Really disgusting and kind of a let down for such a nice hotel. Very comfy beds, could have stayed in bed for hours. Check-in staff was very nice and were very accomidating when we requested a different room as we were given a smoking room. Overall, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_MD
Reviews.Content: Obtained a great rate on Priceline, currently the only hotel Priceline uses in Sydney CBD. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Room was not available at 1030am check in but left our bags with bell boy who later delivered them to our room which was available by 1pm. There is a early arrival's lounge on floor 6 with commercial coffee maker available to make anything you want, snacks, bottled waters, sofas, a TV & PC with Internet. A bathroom with shower is also available. Was never anymore than 5-6 people in room at a time, very quiet and relaxing. The hotel is only about 1 block from Circular Quay station which we took Cityrail to/from airport. If you plan on buying any Sydney Explorer passes (1, 3, or 5 days), be sure to buy them at the airport when you arrive because it includes a free trip to/from airport without activating the card first. The gym is nice, it's actually a full service fitness club run privately by another company. The views from the machines are nice over looking a park below. Gym is free & open 24 hrs with complimentary towels available. The dinner buffet was very nice, not your avg buffet. It was worth $49 (Mon-Thurs price) which includes top of the line seafood, other hot foods, made to order pasta, stir fry, & desserts. Service was top notch there. They advised that they are upgrading their elevator system with only 1 of the 5 down at any given time. Work is to be completed around Aug/2007. The longest wait was usually in mornings but never more than 5 minutes. Usually the time it takes for a red light to change.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaV
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in Australia. The pre-ordered limo whisked us in no time to the hotel. After the 20+ hour flight we felt like arriving in a haven of tranquility. A hotel like this is just what you want after such a trip. Sure this is no designer or 'boutique' hotel, but it is everything a good solid luxury hotel should be. Our room (executive suite) was superbly comfortable, with off course the wonderful Marriott bed and a good view of the harbour and opera house. From this prime position we watched the QM2 and QE2 glide into Sydney harbour. We took breakfast and evening drinks in the executive lounge, which made us feel very privileged. In our room we had wireless internet acces. My husband needed medical attention during our stay, this was organized with a minimum of hassle. Every staff member we had dealings with was courteous and efficient. I recommand this hotel and when I visit Sydney again I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: zodiac
Reviews.Content: Great location just off Sydney harbour, but the hotel is a bit tired and in need of refurbishment. We found service poor and were kept waiting for rooms after the 3.00pm check in time. Be warned about the lift situation, they are being refurbished and one of them is permanently out of action. This means at peak times you can be kept waiting for 15 minutes or more and when you do get one they are scarily packed. We liked the look of the Observatory.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: steptravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night here upon arrival in Sydney. (We would have stayed more nights, but every decent hotel in Sydney was booked for our duration there.) Arrived around 10 am and no room was ready yet, but hotel graciously provided an "early arrivals" room for others like us. It's a room they converted into a waiting area, with candy, shower/toilet, free Internet-connected computer, couches. This made the wait fairly painless after the long flight. The room was standard business-traveler - perfectly fine. The hotel's main strength is its outstanding location so close to Sydney's best attractions. Just minutes walk to Opera House, Botanic Garden, Rocks, etc. Wish we could have stayed more nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: oiwseufrwbfkwjndc
Reviews.Content: As expected, this is a nice hotel with very knowledgable and friendly staff. There are stunning views of the Opera House, Bridge and all the boating activity. For me, it's the location that really made it worth the price. Aside from the views, it's an easy walk to the hubs for ferries, buses and the city trains. (A car will only cost you a lot of money to park and infinite frustration with driving in a major city. You really won't need it.) The Rocks (nearby hip area) always has something going on. Or if you want something a bit more serene, take a walk through the nearby botanical gardens or just cruise on the ferries. This was our base of operaton while we toured the area. We stayed at the Marriott 3 times with side trips in between. They were awesome about keeping bags for our shorter trip so we didn't need to be bogged down with the extra baggage. The staff was helpful, knowledgable and responsive. Each of the 3 rooms we stayed in had the same flaw. The carpet was wet near the refrigerator. We ran into one of the facility engineers who confirmed my suspicion. When the refrigerator goes through a defrost cycle, the accumulated ice melts, runs to the bottom of the refrigerator then out into the cabinet and onto the floor. In each room we used handtowels to soak up the dampness and remind us to avoid walking on the spot. (The engineer noted that the staff intentionally runs the defrost cycle at the end of each guest's stay to keep the refrigerators looking good and are supposed to put a towel down to catch the moisture. But, ...) Really, quite irritating and no one seemed to understand what we were talking about when we called down to the front desk. We also had a problem with our bill for our first stay. We were given a smoking room but (per our request and based on our booking) were moved to a non-smoking room which was a little smaller and not quite the same stunning view. And although the desk staff stated that breakfast was included (confirming our reservation) we were mistakenly charged for breakfast. It required talking to the manager to reduce the bill to reflect the correct amount (a concession for the smaller room and removal of the breakfast charges). Annoying but at least it was fixed. Overall, the location and pleasant staff compensated for the annoyances. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THJ
Reviews.Content: Arrived in SYdney after a long flight from the UK and went straight to the hotel. Was expecting to have to wait for our room but we were checked straight in and were in our room by 09.00. Wonderful accomodation - very comfortable Marriott beds and all the amenities you could need. Very friendly staff, particularly Damien on reception who couldn't do enough for us. Hotel is litterally 100 metres from Sydney Harbour with loads of shops and places nearby to eat. Great views from the hotel room - ask for a higher floor. Only downside was the lift. There are five there but you often have to wait up to 5 minutes for one to come and then it stops at every floor on the way down. But if that's the worst thing I can find to complain about!!

Reviews.Title: “Just something missing.....”
Reviews.Author: Posthum
Reviews.Content: Our night here was booked as part of my 30th birthday and although there is nothing to fault it wasn't quite what we expected from a 5 star. The rooms in the hotel are strangely shaped (we had 2 rooms and one was more oddly shaped than the other) and I assume this is to take in the fantasic views of the harbour that the harbour view rooms have. The rooms at the back are like many city centre in that the look over rooftops and alleys. One of the rooms we had, had a seperate shower and bath while the other was combined. One of the rooms had bathrobes and the other the slippers! The rooms are not as large as the other Sydney hotels we stayed in on our trip and neither were the bathrooms. The rooms although recently refurbished didn't feel like 5 star. The breakfast was extensive although would have been expensive if it was not included in the nightly rate, there are however an abundance of cafes locally offering excellent value breakfasts. The hotel is located almost opposite circular quay and has onsite parking although it is $35 per night. One word of warning would be to make sure you are not in the rooms that are opposite the lifts. We were thankful we weren't in these rooms as they were the first we have ever seen facing the lifts which I imagine could have made them slightly noisy. We would probably stay here again but at A$100 per night more than the Grace Hotel it would need to be on offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay and close to everything..”
Reviews.Author: dsgol
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!! If your going to Sydney and want to be in the heart of the city near the opera house and harbor bridge this is the place to stay. Just walk out the front turn right and 300ft later your at circular quay which opens up to Sydney harbor and the views of the opera house and bridge. The added bonus is the Rock's "an area with lots of pubs" along with a bit of history is a very short walk away which is nice. The hotel itself was clean and the staff was great even making a paper airplane for my 6 year old to throw off the upper level although 3 times seemed to be the magic number. As for the food...there are to many other places to eat that are close by give them a try before eating at the hotel. But to be fair, I did not eat at the hotel and I'm sure the food is fine..

Reviews.Title: “3 stars maybe, 5 stars, definitely not”
Reviews.Author: emansouri
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in a hotel that was more undeserving of its rating. There is nothing 5-star about the accommodations, appearance, and service associated with this hotel. My wife and I had reserved a club room with harbor view. The room was very small and cramped, and had a view facing the city opposite the harbor. They made us wait til the following day to switch rooms, and when they did switch us, they switched us to another room with an almost identical view of the city. At that point, we just accepted the room. The concierge staff was hit or miss. One of the gentleman was genuinely helpful. The other two we interacted with seemed aloof and apathetic. Probably the most annoying thing about the entire stay, is the elevators. I don't know how or why, but there are 5 elevators in the hotel. Each time we attempted to ascend or descend, the wait for an elevator was unbelievably long. I am not sure why this was but it was strange. Other random notes: The food was descent, the workout facilities were acceptable, the spa/massage area was cold and sterile. If you can get a good price on this hotel, and book accommodations with expectations of a 3-star property, I'd recommend it. If you are expecting a true 5-star experience, I'd keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: NF_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott as part of our honeymoon to Australia. Emailed the concierge before our arrival to ask about transportation to hotel...we had a lot of bags. He arranged a car service to pick us up at the airport. Very courteous driver, clean Mercedes, carried my wifes bags. Concierge during the day was amazing (wish I could remember his name) but we asked him AT LEAST 2 questions a day. He was knowledgable, always had a smile on his face, and was just great to deal with. This hotel is located within 5 min walk of circular quay port and station. You literally have all forms of transportation within steps...ferry, taxi, bus and train. Also, if money isn't a big issue, spend the extra $75/nite to stay on one of the top executive level floors with views of the opera house. You get membership to the executive lounge with this extra fee, which has daily hot breakfast and hot appetizers in the early evening, and also drinks available 24-hrs a day. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dyson/Kyra
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and got the revive package, which included two bottles of wine & a bath pack upon the day of stay. They were a little busy when we arrived, so the driveway attendent asked if we wanted to take our own bags to our room. Its a nice hotel and was good value for money , we paid $339-00 per night and that included a buffett breakfast & parking in the price. The room was medium size, but the bed is wonderful- we had the best sleep and shutters to close over the windows which makes sleeping in a breeze as it is as dark as night. You dont get much of a view, so if you want to see a view this is not your hotel. The rooms are clean & nicely furnished - although we did notice coffee had been split over the wall near the bathroom & not cleaned , we stayed in room 1019. We also had to ring them and remind them to send up our revive pack, but that was about it - which they did in about 10 minutes Nice place to stay , well priced & good service I am a fussy person and have stayed and some lavish hotels, and this is nice & clean although the bathroom is a little small & small bath towels as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Emily0717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during one leg of our Australian honeymoon. We arrived earlier than standard check-in time, but they held our bags, delivered them to our room when it was ready, and gave us access to the early arrival lounge with internet access, snacks, a TV, etc. This was only the beginning of fantastic service. I noted that we would be on our honeymoon when I booked online, and the Marriott staff knew this upon check in and upgraded us to an opera house view on the 22nd floor! We were ecstatic-- the views were tremendous. Above average rooms, comfortable and clean. Beautiful lobby area. The concierge was also very helpful-- providing us with the name of a local pizzeria where were had one of the BEST meals of our entire trip, Zia Pina. (I highly recommend this hole in the wall, celeb-frequented pizza place in The Rocks area). The location is also prime, just across the street from Circular Quay. Cannot recommend this place enough. We miss Sydney and hope to return one day! Travelers from North Carolina, USA

Reviews.Title: “First-rate experience”
Reviews.Author: Heathcl
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into a room with an exquisite view of the Sydney opera and harbor, but he never sent us a coupon, so the front desk didn't have the necessary information. No matter: the floor manager set to work and within a few minutes we were into our room (quite early). Typified the approach of the hotel staff--uniformly sunny and helpful. The hotel is very well located--a couple of blocks from the Circular Quay, just a bit further to the Opera and the Gardens, and quite convenient to the business district as well. The big lobby can be hectic when large tourist groups arrive or leave, but the rooms are themselves quiet and they have the usual Marriott amenities. And the breakfast is relaxed and first-rate--a meal for most of the day. Speaking of meals: nearby is the Cafe Sydney, a restaurant of excellent food but incredibly mindless service. One night their credit card machine was down and they kept our card so long, over half an hour (instead of processing it by hand), that we could not make the curtain of the opera. There are more rational places around the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: theallens04
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great. We didn't have views of the harbor, not sure if any of the rooms have the view. We were on the 12 floor. It was a two blocks away from Circular Quay. It is a great location to catch the buses, metrolink to Darling Harbor, and the trains. We caught the train to Blue Mountains. You can easily walk to The Rocks. There are some great restaurants within walking distance. The room was clean and the bed was SUPER comfy. We got there earlier than our checkin time, but the front desk was really nice and immediately showed us to our room. There are a lot of choices for hotels in sydney. Although I was content with the Marriott, I may try smething else the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: saccuch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location and is luxurious. It is better than we expected, even though we expected a lot. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location and view”
Reviews.Author: WestCanTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a top rate Marriott property with views over Sydney Harbour and the Opera House--a million dollar view if there was ever one! Great location as it takes only a couple of minutes to walk to Circular Quay (hub for city buses and the train station, as well as range of shops and restaurants) and only slightly longer to the Rocks and to the Botanical Gardens. Terrific concierge desk that gave us great recommendations for neighborhoods to visit, where to shop, and also set up surfing lessons at Bondi for my teenagers--and in each case made it clear what bus to take and approximate cost. (Bus drivers in Sydney were helpful and friendly and made it easy to get around the city.) The rooms were American Marriott standard--comfy beds with nice linens and lots of other amenities. We had two rooms with an adjoining door so it felt very spacious. Some reviewers have complained about the price of food in the hotel--we had room service once which I thought was very reasonable (better than average menu selection, too, and very prompt and friendly delivery) and the breakfast buffet another day which was pricey but a very nice range of food available and good table service. There's also a vast range of eating options literally on the hotel doorstep (beware, though: this is the business district and many of the places are closed Saturday and especially Sunday)--from cheap take away food to haute cuisine. Nice pool and well-equipped gym in the hotel, but the attractions of Sydney don't leave much time to take advantage of them! Highly recommend a harbour-view room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chewpei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July 2006 and were very happy there. The location can't be beat -- it's a short walk to Circular Quay and all that's there -- the ferries, the Explorer Bus, the subway station, restaurants. The room was clean, although on the small side. The elevators were quick, the concierge was helpful, halls were quiet, check in and out were speedy. We never ate in the restaurants -- prices were high and there were plenty of nearby options around Circular Quay or a short walk to the Rocks too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eocarlos
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 2 days and 2 nights on our way from the US to Melbourne. Upon the advise of other trip advisor reviews, we booked an additional night so that our room would be ready when we arrived at 8 AM. After 14 hours on a plane, being able to check in was wonderful. There was some initial confusion upon check in with the extra roll-away bed that we requested, but it was all solved very quickly and off we went to our room. The views from our room were excellent. You could see the Opera House right from our window. We did not eat in the hotel as we found the prices too high - especially with all the other restaurants right in the area. The location of this hotel is the best. The Sydney Explorer tour bus starts right around the corner from the hotel (at Circular Quay) and the Rocks, the Opera House, and all the ferries are right within walking distance. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: fattymitchell
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be in a better location. Walking distance to the Opera House, Royal Botanical Garden, QVB, the Rocks and Circular Quay ferry, train and bus station. The staff was accomodating and the concierge was very helpful. The only complaint I have is the restaurant in the hotel, "Icons." Incredibly overpriced! My friend and I had a steak dinner, it took over one hour for our steaks to get to us, they were over cooked and they not once refilled our water. The meal cost us over $100 and we had NO alcohol. Another morning we thought we would try a quick breakfast. The buffet costs $32 so we opted for the menu. It took 15 minutes for them to take our order and my bowl of Special K cost $6.50, toast $6.50. The kicker was when I saw the waitresses obtaining some of the food people were ordering off of the menu from the buffet! Our overall experience with the hotel was excellent but avoid the restaurant at all costs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only book this hotel if you can't find anything else.!!!”
Reviews.Author: sanddollard
Reviews.Content: Huge Disappoinment. Only good point is the location. My husband and I travel quite extensivley and honestly, for a 5 star hotel, I can think of better hotels. The room was very average. Hotel lobby looked somewhat tacky. Staff overall very unhelpful and really not that interested. We had to change rooms, dirty bathroom, loud buzz on the Ac vent and a VERY noisy sound from constant water running through the wall. In all fairness we were offered a different room but it was so late at night that we opted to do this in the morning. Changed rooms: We found a noisy Ac fan (surprise surprise) closet door would not close, which meant the light would not turn off. The grill in the bathroom door was lose and kept falling out with a loud bang everytime you opened or closed the door. Service technican did come Fan was fixed, closet door was somewhat fixed, grill was never fixed. As we only had 2 days there we couldn't be bothered anymore. This hotel really needs to be rated down, we have had better rooms, better service, friendlier staff in a 3 star hotel, there is no way this hotel deserves to be rated as a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Sydney, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: arlingtonvaresident
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Sydney Marriott Harbour. This is a great hotel and a truly wonderful city. It's located about a 1-2 min walk from Circular Quay....you want to stay as close as possible to this location. This where everything starts, the Sydney Explorer bus, Biondi Explorer bus, all the harbour cruises, main subway line. You can get the to airport by train or taxi, it is easy and close by. Another positive is the executive lounge. It has a huge full breakfast every morning that is included free. In the early evening, they also have a great selection of wines, beers, and mini plates of dinner food...also free. Please keep in mind that only higher level Marriott Rewards members and certain room rates will get you access so make sure you ask. The service at the hotel was very high and accomodating...fantastic lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A+ to the Marriott Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Hope2seetheworld
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels and this hotel was by far one of our favorites of all time. The views were stunning, the service was perfect, the rooms were clean and we thought this hotel was wonderful. We are coming back to Sydney this summer and we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. We give it an A+ and we are hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have visited Sydney and found this hotel to be very comfortable each time. We had already paid for an Opera House view room as we did last year as we found it to be a slightly larger room with a great view of the Opera House and circular quay where we watched the ferries go back and forth. Hotel staff extremely efficient, rooms very comfortable and great restaurant to have breakfast in the morning. I have read the negative reviews on this hotel and I think they are very unfair, we are particularly fussy where we stay, the state of the room, restaurant etc. and this hotel is very good indeed. Indeed some 5 star hotels cannot match the Sydney Harbour Marriott. The location is fantastic and when we visit Sydney again we will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Habour Marriott ideal hotel for first timers”
Reviews.Author: starfish123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 06, we had a great deal which included an Opera house view, it was fantastic to open the curtains and see this wonderful land mark, we also went to a concert to see Olivia Newton John, it was a highlight of the hoilday. The hotel was lovely, spotlessly clean and very quiet. Checking in was smooth and the sraff attentiveand efficient. Posistion was marvelous step outside the door turn right walk a few meters and you were infront of the harbour/railway station,keep going right for 5 mins and you were at the Opera house a few more minutes and you were in the Botanical gardens ( well worth a visit for views to Opra house and bridge.) Turn left out of the hotel and you are in the city for all the shops and museums, the Rocks are easy to get too as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: XcitingTrips
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 4 nights at this hotel. Had to upgrade our room to obtain the harbour and opera house view, but this was well worth it. The room was quite large, with 2 double beds, as we had our 2 children with us. The only disappointing feature was another taller building in front of the hotel which spoilt the full view of the harbour and the bridge. The swimming pool was a little bit small for the size of the hotel. The staff were very friendly, and even took care of our luggage as soon as we stepped out of the taxi. Breakfast in the hotel is a bit pricey at $25 but this included everything from the cold and hot menus.
