The hotel is in a very good location with 5 minutes to Circular Quay for all the ferries and cruises. Some good restaurants nearby, and the City Centre about 20 mins walk. The icing on the cake was our departure from the hotel to the airport. We called for a taxi at the front of the hotel, but instead got a limousine service from the concierge as we had 4 suitcases plus hand luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hilmar
Reviews.Content: The location, as everyone says, is superb, right on Collier Quay. Presumably because I am a member of Marriott's Frequent Stayer programme, we were upraded to a room with a good view of the wonderful harbour and the Opera House. There really was nothing any reasonable person could fault the hotel for. The room was a reasonable size, clean and well equipped. Service could not have been better and the Buffet breakfast was something special. All staff encountered were helpful, friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a zoo!”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: The only great thing about this hotel (and it is amazing), is the location. It is literally a stone's throw from the main ferries and the transportation area. I chose this hotel because we were arriving @ 10A internationally with two small children and they have an early arrival lounge. The whole hotel is packed-a complete zoo. Elevators full ear-to-ear, long lines to talk to the front desk, etc..The early arrival lounge is a joke - A vinyl couch with three people on it and a jar of mentos, one bathroom with the single toilet and shower inside. I emailed the conceirge twice before departure asking for an early check in because of the kids and they still could not swing it. We were forced to riffle through our bags in front of everyone in the lounge and shower/change or lose our first whole day in Sydney. The actual rooms are very cramped and nothing great, but adequate. The buffet breakfast is beautiful. We also stayed at the Shangri La and it was twice as nice and less expensive, although a little farther walk from the ferries. Also received my invoice back in the states and a few extra charges appeared on my bill which has not been easy to retify.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Citibreak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DubaiNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, great location, close to the Rocks, Circular Quay etc. Get a room on an upper floor, we had a great view over the Harbour Bridge. The rooms are of a comfortable standard but not large. The only thing that annoyed was the AUS$7 for a bottle of water in the room, I dont care how many stars - thats a joke. In summary an excellent standard hotel in a great location for accessing the harbour and city attractions - the perfect "citibreak" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “must try harder !”
Reviews.Author: gabby
Reviews.Content: having stayed at other marriot, in sydney and brisbane, i was a little disapointed with the harbour marriott. the plus' first though, the location is fantastic ! just across the road from cicular quay, however we did feel that this hotel is almost too big. we had neumerous problems with contacing 'at your service ' we reqested a sydney telegraph daily, but this request was not met and we were told could not be as the hotel did not stock this local paper, yet they could get international papers ! the bed was VERY uncomfortable and hard and the bath room in particular was very small. the staff we found were not particulary freindly either ( this is in comparison to other marriott ) but we spent very little time in the hotel and it certainly was a clean hotel and felt very safe. it is however expensive and if you do'nt mind a bit of a walk i would recomend the sydney marriott on hyde park out of the 2 marriott in central sydney

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jaime0779
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Sydney Marriott Harbour. The best location, right by Circular Quay/The Rocks. The hotel have beautiful rooms, very friendly service and a convenient business center. We used the internet every day to stay in touch at home. We ate breakfast at the hotel in the morning. Very good food and a good price. I loved everything about the service I received and the room I booked. Very comfortable beds! I want to go back, and if I do I will only stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave_261
Reviews.Content: We picked the Sydney Harbour Marriott to use some coupons we had received, and were very pleased with the hotel. As we were out touring most of the time, we didn't spend too much time there (nor did we eat/drink anything in the hotel). The main selling point is the location. I suppose there are a bunch of hotels that are well located in Sydney, but for our purposes, location couldn't be beat. We like to walk, and found it a breeze to get anywhere. - 3 minutes from Circular Quay, for the ferries, buses and trains - 5 minutes to the Rocks, for shopping, food and the Harbour Bridge - Less than 10 minutes to the Opera House and Park - 15 minutes from Darling Harbour and Woolloomaloo The room was a fairly typical Marriott room. We had a decent view of the Opera House, which was nice to look at while we were in the room. Bed and sheets were very comfortable. Rest of the room was just OK. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, adequate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Scallie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel - right on Circular Quay and a short walk from The Rocks and Pitt Street Malls - was absolutely perfect for my first visit to the city. The hotel give a good service, although I felt the rooms needed updating, and after tasting the food we soon found other places to eat. The only problem we had was being disturbed at 9am by housekeeping on our last day, somewhat unnecessarily as we were checking out that day! Not a welcome intrusion when you're trying to get some sleep in preparation for a long-haul flight. Apart from that there were no problems, and the staff were attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Well Situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronfaddison
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. It is possibly the best situated tourist hotel in Sydney and it certainly has some views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge - but possibly not both! We possibly got upgraded because we had a good view of the Opera House - thanks for that. The hotel has a branch of Avis in the forecourt and the main reason we chose the hotel in the first place was that we knew where it was and that there was an Avis branch where we could leave our hired car without searching the city. The theory worked and we disposed of the car without any problems. The hotel was very good and our room was of more than adequate size and very well appointed. Breakfast was included in our rate and was good without being over extensive or particularly memorable. But the hot things were actually hot and that is a bonus these days. The service (i.e coffee supplier)was good and we were cheerfully supplied with more coffee when we asked for it. The concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. When we left we were offered a limousine to the airport at the same price as a taxi ($40) and we accepted - it was a good decision. We enjoyed our stay and would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no worries mate”
Reviews.Author: traffert
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for a week and overall thought it was a great hotel. The room had 'the view' over the harbour, the staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfasts were the usual 'international' stuff, but don't bother eating dinner here... for the price they charge there's much better local options at the Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Londoner75
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights mid-December '05. I spent a lot of time reading through various reviews of other Hotels on Tripadvisor - most that sounded good were either fully booked (Shangri-La) or just too ridiculously expensive (Shangri-La). I did look into staying in Paddington (marginally more affordable), but in hindsight am so glad that I didn't - not that Paddington isn't lovely, just that at the end of the day for me, as a first time visitor to Sydney, it was better to be so Central. When we arrived at the Marriott we knew we had a double room with a view and had been quoted $220AUD. At check in we were offered an upgrade - for $60AUD per night for both of us we could have a room on the Executive floor (higher up, 30th floor) and a view of the Opera House. That also included breakfast and use of the Executive Bar (views of the Harbour Bridge)with as much free drink as we wanted and snacks (which turned out to be lovely buffet style food early evening). As breakfast was going to cost $25AUD per day EACH it was a no brainer and we took it. And so glad we did. We had a gorgeous room with a great view, huge comfy bed, plenty of space (I don't know how big the normal rooms are I'm afraid). I also used the Internet access the Hotel has in a small Business Centre which was $5 for half an hour (didn't find a better rate near the hotel). Sydney itself is fantastic. I'm a Londoner and loved the fact that it was city life - but outdoors! I would recommend to anyone going for the first time to go on one of the tours of the Harbour by boat. You could just take the ferry, but it is worth going on one of the Guided tours. I would also recommend the bus tour which leaves from various points in the city. You learn a lot about all the areas (Paddington, Potts Point, Darling Harbour, Kings Cross) as you drive through them, and you can also pick up the bus which goes to Bondi Beach on the same ticket (valid for 24 hours from when you buy it and you hop on and off). My only criticism of the city is that the restaurants seem stupidly priced (though the food is very good). $30+ AUD for a main course EVERYWHERE seemed a bit excessive. All in all what a wonderful stay. Don't forget to ask for an upgrade when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for intro to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few contradictory reports on this Hotel. Many of the comments are true, BUT for a first visit to the City, I think it is a great base. The location, within easy walking distance of Circular Quay, Opera House, the Rocks and even downtown shopping, makes a three or four day visit very easy. City Tour and Bondi Explorer busses start their route a few steps from the Marriott and there is a taxi rank right outside the Hotel. Add to this the most comfortable beds, excellent housekeeping and a reasonably quiet location and you have an almost ideal hotel. I say almost, since as many others have pointed out, the restaurant or bar is best avoided unless desperate. There are many excellent eateries nearby such as City Extra on Circular Quay for breakfast and Doyle's or Quayside Brasserie for dinner. One of the best locations in the City, without paying the earth!

Reviews.Title: “Functional, great tourist/business location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights here, using our Marriott points. The hotel has good service, good concierge. The room is small and a cookie-cutter Marriott. It served our needs well and was quite busy. There is an early arrivals lounge which is a bonus if you arrive before your room is ready. Staff is very helpful and the view of the Bridge was quite nice. It seems very fairly priced, though a bit higher on the points scale than merited (probably the location.) It is a straightforward place and baby friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: kruzlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbor Marriott after 3 weeks in Australia. Sydney was our favorite city out of all and the Marriott our favorite motel. The bed was great as well as the view. The Marriott was in a great location. It was right at the bus stop , one block from Circular Quay. Great food in the area. One tip for travelers from USA , hotels are food establishments , motels are where you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Six Stars if Possible”
Reviews.Author: Edtioga
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last five days of a three week trip to Australia. I had read trip advisor before booking so was fairly confident about location with just some concerns about service. In short, everything was perfect. The service was impeccable. All requests where handeled in a prompt and friendly maner. The beds where the most comfortable we have ever slept in. We upgraded to concierge level where we had all of our breakfasts and a few of our dinners and a view from our room that was unbeatable. Well worth the upgrade price. The concierge was helpful in getting tickets at the last moment for the symphony. And the location was supberb. I have no problem fully recommending this hotel to anyone. It was a perfect conclusion to a perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a great and central location”
Reviews.Author: eslb
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Located a few steps away from Circular Quay and the Rocks. On arrival we had a minor glitch with our room, but it was quickly resolved, above and beyond what we expected. The staff was extremely helpful and always willing to help. The concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast buffet was excellent. We had a great time here as a family, and this hotel would also be perfect for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room/view/location,dining terrible”
Reviews.Author: AlohaHal
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at this hotel end of September. We had a lovely Opera House view. Bed was the most comfortable ever. Great location, too. On the downside, "at your service" rarely picked up. Room service did not show one night after 1 1/2 hrs and three assurances "it would be checked in to." Also, took 1 hour to receive breakfast in restaurant-only ordered eggs and bacon in lieu of buffet. So, recommend the hotel highly, just eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning at the Sydney Harbour Marriott”
Reviews.Author: NIKKICOOK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nine days for my honeymoon. No problem checking in at 8am. Our room was spacious and on the 26th floor with views of the Opera House. The beds are great! Almost like the heavenly beds at the Westins. Only problem with the rooms were the lack of drawers to put our clothes in. No worries though. We called their "At your Service" desk and asked if they could bring up additional hangers and we received them within 10 minutes. The fist day, we ate the buffet breakfast at the hotel. That was the first and last time we ate at the hotel. The service in the restaurant was poor and it was totally overpriced. We didn't use the pool or the hot tub because it looked like it hadn't been used in months. Once again, no worries. We went to Manly and Bondi Beaches instead. We didn't use their spa either. They have three massage rooms, that were very "cold" feeling and uninviting and were right off of the work out area. On the flip side, the concierge was great! They booked tours for us, told us the best places to eat in town, and gave us directions on how to get to some of the top tourist attractions (Manly Beach, Taranga Zoo). Food: Try the big breakfast at City Extra right by where you catch the ferries. Pizza: Tia Pina at the Rocks Chinese: East End by the ferries on the walk way towards the Opera House. Fish and Chips: Rouge on Manly Beach. Things to do: Do the Harbour Bridge Climb, the tour of the Opera House, the Blue Mountains/Featherdale Wildlife Park tour, and take the ferry to the Taronga Zoo. If you only have time to go to one beach, bypass Bondi and go to Manly! Do the five+ minute walk to the Botanical Gardens. This is a walking town and the Marriott is in the middle of everything! Bring comfortable shoes and have fun exploring! We surely did! I am very happy that we chose Sydney for our honeymoon and the Sydney Harbour Marriott as the place to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great level of service from staff”
Reviews.Author: randomtask
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get a work trip to Sydney with a few days to myself. Stayed here for 4 nights and was very pleased. Location is excellent - very near the Rocks area (Harbour Bridge and Opera House) and Circular Quay station for catching the many ferry options. Also walkable into the CBD shopping areas too. Sydney felt a pretty compact city and I walked most places, helped by a hotel in a good area as base. As for the room - it was spacious, with a fantastically soft and large bed which could fit 3 people, let alone just myself. Bathroom was shower only, but it was big and clean. If I'd stayed for more nights, I might have wanted a bathtub but not an issue this time round. Had no trouble with noise and slept well (aside from having to adjust a lot of time zones!). Buffet style breakfast was plentiful, though I tended to eat out more so can't comment on the restaurant fully. Lobby area was nice, with lounge singers in the evening and staff waiting on tables bringing drinks and food. My stay wasn't trouble free though - my booking wasn't actually on the system, which meant I had to be checked in as a walk-in. As a result, I was on the 8th floor which doesn't have much of a view and is probably the floor most of the flight crews who seem to stay here are on. But I'm not that fussy and was pleased with how it was handled. They did offer to move me, but I was already unpacked so declined but nice of them to recognise the error. If not for this mix up with the reservation, it would've been 5 out of 5. I imagine that I would have been put on the 20th floor or higher, so I'd advise to phone ahead in future to make sure, should the view be important to you. Want to mention specifically, the high level of service from staff I received. All were very friendly and helpful but I want to highlight the particular time where I foolishly lost my passport in the Botanic gardens (obviously no fault of the hotel). The front desk endeavoured to help me by contacting the police and the British Consulate on my behalf. So even though I was actually reunited with my passport an hour or so later as it was lucklily handed in at the Botanic Gardens bookshop, I was more than impressed with how they helped me out in my time of need. If my work requires me to Sydney again (fingers crossed) I can easily see myself staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location. Location”
Reviews.Author: fraggles
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a deluxe room with a view of the Opera House. We arrived at 7am and had no problems checking in to our room. The room was lovely but a little small for four of us. Breakfast was always plentiful and very relaxing. The hotel is in an excellent location with most sights of interest being within walking distance. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best service”
Reviews.Author: TakinRTime
Reviews.Content: Best location and best service--that describes our experience with the Marriott Sydney Harbour. The concierges were the best we've seen anywhere--helpful and specific, volunteered additional information and made suggestions without being asked--all with a smile, of course. The room was quiet, spacious and spotless. The maid even lined up the two under-counter toilet tissue rolls so they were even. The location is just a block from the harbour--even better than a much higher priced competitor. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rado_traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 3 nights of our 2 week trip to Australia here. The location is excellent for access to public transportation and the sites for tourist. The concierge was excellent in helping us. The room was nice and clean. We had a harbor view room and a great view of the Opera house from our 22nd floor room. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: Peggles
Reviews.Content: My husband did quite a lot of research (TripAdvisor was a BIG help), and the first thing we did upon landing was purchase a 7 day Sydney Pass which gave us unlimited travel on all Sydney bus services, ferries, and the CityRail train. We took the train from the airport to the Circular Quay Station which is just a short walk to the hotel. We then made use of the "early arrivals lounge" that Marriott offers, since we landed in Sydney at 7am. There was already another couple in there, so the shower was in use, but we had some coffee and cookies and we used the internet. After we freshened up, we checked our luggage with the bell hop and explored the city. We went back and wandered the Circular Quay and took a morning cruise on one of their ferries! We then walked to The Rocks and browsed through a lot of stores and had lunch. After lunch we walked all the way up to the QVB on George Street and then we walked back to find our room was ready at 2:30pm. We didn't upgrade our room for an additional $90/night which would have given us a better view and access to the executive lounge. My husband said he'd BUY me a coffee pot and all the pastries I wanted in lieu of the upgrade. Our room was fine without the upgrade. We had an "okay" view of the bridge, an electric hot water pot, and free tea and instant coffee packets. We paid for 7 days of internet use so that we could stay in touch with our work and family back home. The room had a comfy bed with lots of pillows. The bathroom had a tub and separate shower. Window shades were neat; they slid aside like a door panel. They also blocked out the early morning sun really well. The elevators were only annoying slow twice during our week's stay. The concierge desk was always very friendly and helpful when we asked about finding the right city transport to get around town. We used our Sydney Pass several times a day and access to all its amenities were all close to the hotel. What I disliked about the hotel was that we had to request ICE from room service. I really begrudged giving even a $1.00 tip for that! Another annoyance was the price we paid for our Saturday night dinner buffet. We didn't see any prices listed, and actually the service was bad (we went up to refill our own water glasses 3 times); but we were surprised that our buffet price was $69.95 per person! This hotel is very conveniently located. There is even a popular night spot around the corner called The Basement that offers food and live music (however, there is a cover charge on weekends).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Great Location, Not 5*”
Reviews.Author: aglazer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after an overnight flight from Asia as a place to "recover". The staff was kind enough to let us check in about 9 a.m., which is fantastic after an overnight flight. The rooms are comfortable and decently sized. There is wireless Internet in various locations in the hotel (although it's a bit pricey at around AUD$25 a day). Staff is friendly, too. The location can't be beat -- a couple blocks from Circular Quay in the heart of Sydney's CBD. The hotel is billed as a 5*, but I'd say it's more of a 4* type place. It's comfortable, clean, and nicely designed, but it lacks the extra touch that pushes something to that 5* level. Even so, it's a perfectly fine place to stay and I'd stay there again, but if you're looking for 5* accomodation, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and very convenient to the Circular Quay and The Rocks areas. The hotel staff was very helpful in arranging tickets to the opera for the same day. There is an Avis Rental car office on site. I believe that this hotel is classified as a 5-star hotel. I would rate it as a 4-star. Regarding the rooms, the baths have step in shower and separate tub. The rooms are noisy. Avoid an ajoining room and a room near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a few extra $$$”
Reviews.Author: CFIGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property on two separate visits for a total of 7 nights. Paid for the upgrade to the executive floor as well for AU$110 per night. Every single staff member at the hotel was great to work with. Everyone was very friendly and extremely helpful. When we checked-in around 11:30AM, there was no line, and we were able to go directly to our room. From what I have seen and heard, the Executive Level rooms are the same as the regular rooms, except they get turndown service and 2X daily housekeeping. Speaking of housekeeping, they cleaned our room everday in the 45 minutes that we were at breakfast. Executive Floor lounge was nice. Breakfast food was great. Evening food service was hit or miss, but I don't think that many people were trying to make a meal of it. The bellmen were extremely attentive when we needed baggage picked up / delivered. On a couple of occassions, they walked off before we could give them a tip. The coincierge desk was a great tool as well. I dealt with Scott, and he helped me out a ton. I also dealt with another coincierge on Scott's day off. We were trying to find a casual restaurant for dinner on Sunday, when most restaurants are closed. The other coincierge was trying to point us to places with $40-50 entrees. Went to the Rocks Cafe instead for a great meal at a cheaper price. On to the hotel services... In my opinion, the mini-bar prices and most of the room services prices weren't all that bad. You would be hard pressed to find meals at local restaurants for the prices offered. The restaurant on-site seemed like it charged about a $5 premium, which isn't terrible. The place to avoid though is the spa/gym. Prices were beyond sky high. Laundry services were also outrageously priced. All in all though, the best Marriott property that I have stayed in. The staff really made all of the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel. We stayed with our two young girls and were very happy. The staff was kind and helpful. The location can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but Money Vacuum!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as part of our vacation package through Qantas. The room was beautiful; I loved the big, comfy bed and we had a great view of the Opera House. We were thinking of staying at a hotel on Darling Harbor, but this seemed a much better location (right near the Opera House, Botanical Gardens, Circular Quay, and the Rocks.) We ended up walking to Darling Harbor (I think hotels in that area would be much better for family holidays) and that wasn't too bad as we were staying in the heart of the city. Everything was pretty expensive, but considering where we were that seems a given. We were billed for a $6.50 bottle of water that we didn't drink, but that was taken off our bill when we checked out. (Therefore, in addition to speedy service, I was pretty impressed by the Customer Service). We had an hour to kill once we checked out and were waiting for our airport shuttle and the hotel was able to securely hold our luggage. Overall, if I was ever back in Sydney I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, up market choice near the harbour.”
Reviews.Author: Stedatraveller
Reviews.Content: A wonderful choice near the harbour, shopping, and theatre. I stayed 2 nights in a deluxe non-smoking room, and found the amenities a cut above other first class properties at this price point. The staff were efficient, and courteous. All of the public rooms were luxurious, yet comfortable. The main lobby is spacious and grand, reminiscent of a foyer on a ocean liner with a sweeping staircase. The only criticism would be the rather small hot tub provided near the swimming pool. Well worth looking at on your next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: justdreaming
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here upon our arrival to Sydney from SFO and again on our way home, back to the states. We were pleasantly suprised when a room was available for early check in. (We were expecting to be offered the early arrival room.) The double room was rather small but very clean and comfortable. City and Bridge view especially nice at night. We had breakfast in the Executive club lounge. Lounge access was provided with my husband's Marriott gold status. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, sausage/bacon, toast, fruit, cereal and pastry. Nice deserts in the evening. We didn't take advantage of Room service because the menu was a little pricey. I had planned on using the Health club but I chose to be a lazy girl instead. My husband, niece and nephew enjoyed playing in the pool and hot tub. Our second stay at the Marriott prior to returning home was equally comfortable. If I were to return to Sydney again, I would stay here. The staff is very friendly and they go all out to make you feel like happy campers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KDK
Reviews.Content: Great location - just one block out of Circular Quay. Walking distance to the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, and the Rocks. It was easy to find breakfast on a weekday since it was in the financial district. We walked to the Rocks most evenings for dinner. Good access to city buses and the train. The room was a good size for a city hotel but nothing spectacular to write about. The concierge was very helpful in selecting tours and restaurants. On our next visit I would probably consider staying in the Rocks - that neighborhood has much more character.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great service”
Reviews.Author: rock412
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Syndey Harbour Marriott for 3 nights in early February for our honeymoon. Before booking our hotel in Sydney I did some research and decided that using Priceline to book the hotel would be best, and that's what I did. For $90 US/night we got the Marriott. February is a high-peak month, so I highly recommend using Priceline to secure your hotel for a good rate! We arrived with the United Airlines crew around 10am and we were escorted to an upgraded room since we were here for our honeymoon. It was great that we were able to check-in right away and didn't have to wait for our room, although there is an early-arrivals lounge with a bathroom, food, and free Internet. The room was large with a city-view on a high floor. There were both a tub and separate shower, however the sink area was small. The lounge in the lobby is very active and reasonably priced. The location is in Circular Quay which is 2 blocks from the Ferry building and the Train. I highly recommend using the train to get from Sydney Airport to Circular Quay (Sydney Harbour Marriott, Four Seasons Hotel, Shangri La Hotel) because it's a lot cheaper than the $50 AU in a cab and very efficient. The ferry will take you to all the nearby harbours (Darling Harbour has great restaurants, the Sydney Aquarium and Casino). The hotel is about a 10 min walk to The Rocks area, which is where the Park Hyatt is, as well as some fabulous restaurants and pubs. Try Sailors Thai if you enjoy thai food. The concierge worked with my husband to surprise me with a dozen roses in our room and flower petals decorating the room, they really went all out to make our honeymoon and first visit to Australia amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: allgoodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: I was there hours before the normal 2PM check-in time, but they had the room ready, plus they offered to upgrade me to the Executive level for $50AUD. It was well worth it, plus they gave me a room with a view of the Opera House so I took dozens of pictures from my room. The room was a very good size and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The staff in the Executive Lounge were very knowledgeable about every question I had for them. Every member of the staff I encountered during my 5 day stay was exceedingly courteous and helpful. The location is perfect for sightseeing in Sydney. The Circular Quay train stop is a very short walk, doable even laden with luggage, and the harbour is so close, it's practically inexcuasable not to end each day at the harbour, enjoying a drink or gelato from the cafes, bars and restaurants that seem to be open 24 hours a day there. There's no point in my shopping around for a hotel the next time I'm in Sydney, as this hotel more than met my expectations. The great price I got was just a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: frozenfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel and getting it for $140/night US at priceline made it an unbelievable value! We stayed here for 3 nights, left for Cairns, and returned for 1 night before our trip back to the U.S. They kept some of our luggage while we were in Cairns. We stayed in 2 different rooms and both were lovely. One was just cityview, but had a unique triangular shape. The other was rectangular and faced the bridge. We loved the sliding window panels, the art deco furnishings, and the beautiful bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable. We had no problems with the staff. The concierge was helpful with restaurant suggestions ( seveal great places within a 3 block radius ) and with information on the public bus system (also nearby). Internet service is available in the business center at $5 for 30 minutes. My husband said the fitness center looked nice, but we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “Soak Tub Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: sallyhess
Reviews.Content: Showed up about noon and room was not ready so the wonderful front desk employee, don't know her name, Indian woman, gave me a key to the early arrivals lounge which had everything your would need. I got the deal of 100 a night on priceline, included all tax and service fees, so I didn't expect much but the room was 5 star and would recommend it and my only problem was that I had left something in the drawer and hadn't realized it until after check out and the items were not returned. I called as I had moved to Shangri-la hotel, best in Sydney and they said they had just some of the things I left in drawer so I can only assume they were stolen by housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sally70SouthWales_UK
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. We initally had a small room which was adequate but as we were staying for 2 weeks we were moved to another room with no fuss-we even had a view of the Opera House-wonderful. The hotel has an excellent location-turn right out of the hotel & you have just a 2 minute walk to the Rocks & Circular Quay and if you turn left you have a 5 minute walk to the shops. Just across the road is an excellent convenience store & internet cafe. The hotel was undergoing refurbishment when we were there but not even this work could spoil our time at this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: perth trip advisor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at SHM early April for two nights. Absolutely brilliant location. As another reviewer noted though, Hotel lacks a little character and is perhaps somewhat sterile but rooms were first class and bed extremely comfortable. Dined in on first evening and meal was excellent with well researched wine list providing many highly drinkable Aussie vintages. Didn't bother with hotel breakfast as found small cafe right next to Hotel that provided good English/American breakfast for only a few dollars. Walked to most sights of interest, even walked from Oxford St. Paddington back to Hotel. Paddington is an old, very interesting inner suburb with chic shops and delightful terraced houses. Lovely stroll back through beautiful Hyde Park. (Reminiscent of Londons Parks). It is many years since my wife and I last visited Sydney and it is still a fascinating and delightful place to visit. The Marriot being so close to the magnificent harbour and surrounds made it just that much more enjoyable. An absolute must is to visit the cocktail bar on the 36th floor of the Shangri La Hotel (a city block away from SHM). We arrived just before sunset and had amazing views of sun setting through one set of windows and rush hour traffic crossing Sydney Harbour bridge directly below us through another set of huge glass windows. Must be one of the most spectacular city sights anywhere in the world! Enjoy your stay at SHM, we certainly did..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Good Names All Gone!
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriott for a few days in March. Booked using Marriott reward points for 4 nights. Closer to the trip, we added an extra night but explained that we wouldn't be arriving until early the next morning (landed at about 6 am and wanted to get straight into our room after the long trip from the UK). Got to the hotel and the fact that we had booked for one night and were only just arriving caused them no end of confusion. We had phone messages every day because they couldn't find the reservation with the points on. On one occasion, they also couldn't manage to switch off the message light so we had this flashing all night (or until we unplugged the phone). Other than fairly useless staff, you could have been in any big chain hotel anywhere in the world. It was clean, comfortable and characterless, but we only wanted a city base so weren't bothered about that. Wouldn't bother paying the upgrade charge for the harbour view. I imagined a glorious view of the whole sweep of Sydney harbour with the opera house. What we got was a view of the opera house in between other tower blocks - really not worth bothering with. Didn't have brekkie included in the deal and there are loads of places you can get a good breakfast for half the price of the Marriott. Don't bother paying for brekkie unless you really want to pig out at the buffet. I would class this as a characterless hotel, great location and okay as a central base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!! You really need to stay here...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Good Service! Near a great location which is near the quay. It was accessible to everything. You must really have a Harbour Opera View... so beautiful. Staff was very accomodating and very friendly. The easter buffet lunch was to die for.... Chocolate fondue and main course lobster!!! YUMMY! Anyway, loved our stay and we will be back!

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Pitt Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
